text: W aromacie ciemny chleb, zboża, skórka chlebowa, czerwone owoce. W wyglądzie ciemna czerwień wpadająca w brąz, niezła kremowa piana. W smaku rodzynki, figi, kandyzowane owoce, nuty melanoidynowe, czerwone owoce, nuty utlenienia, słodkie, bardzo przyjemnie. Ciało średnie, średnie wysycenie, dość aksamitna faktura. Ogólnie przyjemny koźlak o fajnym, złożonym smaku i średnim aromacie
Tastes of malt and toasted wheat bread. Carbonation strong at first and disappears quickly with the sip. A solid classic dunkel which doesnt at all taste like its abv.

Bottle. Dark mahagony/ruby/copper with an impressive head and lots of lacing. Aroma of dark malts, berries, molasses and some chocolate. Taste is malts, dark fruits, a hint of chocolate, caramell, cherries, nuts and finishing off with a subtle hoppy bitterness (floral and slightly citrussy). Beautifully balanced. Medium to strong carbonation. Full bodied and smooth. Alcohol is well hidden. I think this was the first Doppelbock I ever had and it made me fall in love with the style and the Andechs brewery.

Pours a clear, dark reddish brown with a medium, off white head. The aroma consists of earthy malt, caramel, bread, lesser cherry and chocolate, and hints of spices. The taste is just a little sweet. This one has a good earthy backbone to it. A healthy amount of caramel is the main impression, with compliments of cherry, raisin, nuts, bread, herbal hops, and mild licorice. Everything here is pretty well balanced actually. Caramel aftertaste. Medium in body, with a chewy texture, and average in carbonation. This one goes down smooth and easy. Doppelbocks arent usually my favorites, but this was really good.

0.5 L bottle, poured into a tulip. Lovely, clear, ruby brown color, with a medium, foamy, tan head. The aroma is light toast, toffee, brown sugar, plums, anise, and pipe tobacco. Sweet and malty, with a barely perceptible bitterness. Medium body, with a smooth, velvety texture. This is a wonderful, balanced, and easy beer.

500 mL bottle. Deep brown body with a small off-white head. Smells of caramel, bready malt, some dark fruit. Tastes very bready with some sweet caramel and brown malts. A touch of cola before becoming earthy and a little bitter. Medium bodied. Wanted to try this a long time ago. Glad I got to try it. While its good, its not all that remarkable.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 consumed a while ago - notes from phone: the liquid bread quality of this one isnt particularly overbearing nor nauseating, rather sets in later for a great aftertaste drinking experience. perfect mf.
Thin head fades fast but the bubbles keep rising for quite a while. Caramel, molasses, dark fruit, light roast. Somehow not sticky.

9. 5. 2017, Pivopis, Ljubljana. Bottled. Subtle and toned down aroma and flavour for pretty high ABV, almost hiding that alcohol content. Served with ribs and potato chips which proved to be quite good combination.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at Andechser am Dom, Munich. 
Dark copper, clear body, with a big, creamy, lacing, beige head. 
Aroma of caramel, toast, dark fruits, cocoa, dark bread, some spices. 
Tastes pretty similar, very smooth and balanced. 
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation. 
Finishes smooth, moderate sweet, a bit warm, a bit roasty, a bit dry, toasty, bready, a bit fruity, with some cocoa. 

Tasty. Smooth and very well balanced, more on the sweet side, but with enough toasty notes and overall very rich. Lovely cocoa and dark fruit notes throughout. Not my favourite style example, but a lovely, classic one nonetheless.

$4.29 pint plus bottle from wine warehouse. Iced tea to color colored with a tiny head. Aroma is somewhat smoked, earth, caramel. Flavor is smoked peat, chewy caramel, strange dark fruit. Interesting.

Su aroma es licoroso y muy acaramelado. También hay notas de pasas y ciruela.

En boca es una cerveza muy maltosa y rica. Muy rotunda, con final amargo y alcohólico. No la toméis nunca con prisas o no disfrutaréis de ella.

Botella, @Cerveceria Internacional, Sevilla. 17/04/17. BBD: 10/07/17. Color ambarino oscuro una pequeña corona de espuma beige persistente, buenos aromas a maltas tostadas notas a café, el sabor es tostado toques a café cuerpo medio agradable Rica.
On draught. Pours mahogany, with a minimal tan head which fades quickly. Nose is dark roast malt and caramel. Taste follows. An excellent doppelbock.

Bottle at home. Pours deep auburn, thin but lasting lacy tan head. Big aroma of malt, molasses, dark fruit. Lovely full thick sweet mouthfeel. Big deep dark sugar taste, dates, cognac, hint of burnt toast. Really really nice.

50cl bottle purchased @ Tante Emma Laden. Belle couleur ébène avec fine mousse brune. Puissance maltée avec un arôme de tartine grillée. Lalcool est peu présent ce qui donne un côté assez aqueux pour une doppelbock.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2017 (500 ml bottle) Dark ruby-maroon beer, with a small tan-coloured head. Continuous, fine carbonation from the bottom of the glass. Big malty aroma of chocolate, coffee, and caramel - also some cinnamon and fresh dough. A touch of alcohol. Some dark fruits too, like blackberry and cranberry. Hop aroma almost non-existent, bar a little bitterness. Slightly earthy and minerally finish. Nice silky mouthfeel, makes for easy drinking.

Lovely little Doppelbock. Comes highly recommended!
Dark red brown colour, beige head. Roasted malt, caramel and dark chocolate aroma. Bittersweet taste. Lively carbonated. Alcohol well hidden. Full body, medium texture. Nice!

Ciemno bordowe klarowne. Piana średnia opada do pierścionka. Palony aromat. Trochę chlebowy i susz. Smak karmelowo słodkawy.Goryczka ziemisto palona alkoholowa. Całkiem syte piwo-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Cerveza ambar opaca, predominio de mlatas tostadas muy ricas, cuerpo medio y alcohol muy bien integrado, merece la pena

500ml bottle bought at Great Food Hall in Pacific Place, Admiralty.
Looks: Clear copper amber colour; Explosive four finger head with crumpety orange light-beige foam which lasts for 4 minutes; Very good sticky lacing with fizzy small carbonation.

Aroma: Fragrant and lively dark malt, with moderate roastyness, strong mustiness, strong dark fruits, red fruits, chocolates, strong caramel, toffee, light burnt toast, floral, brown sugar, dark bread, light lemon and light grass.

Taste: Mid to strong sweet rich dark malt, with caramel, toffee, light red fruits, light dark chocolates, light floral, sugar, spices, strong dark bread, lemon, medium bitter hops and grass. Wow!

Body: Full body. Very slick and creamy palate. 

Mouth Feel: Wholesome, Schwarzbier-like dark maltyness in a thick background, very silky and smooth. All the caramel, toffee, dark chocolate and red fruits are there but they take the back seat as the pure maltyness shines! Wow! Light floral and spicy. Sneaky strong sweetness. Booze is totally hidden, lots of dark breadyness with lemon to round. Incredibly nice!

Hoppiness: Floral, light lemon and light grass in nose. Spices, light floral, lemon and grass in taste; Bitterness is slightly herbal for a lasting, mid-to-light astringent grassy full malty finish.

After Taste: Dry. Sweet, rich malty and fairly bitter to mouth.

Comments: This one has a strong Dunkel aroma with sweet malt and mustiness, but I am totally surprised by its full, silky dark malty taste which keeps me yearning for more. Feels like a very pumped-up Schwarzbier with all its restrained chocolate malty characters being liberated. What an experience. Great stuff!
Klares dunkelrot mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, süß, Karamell, etwas nussig, leicht fruchtig, etwas Pflaumen und Rosinen, sehr süffig.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2017 Wow, Virkelig en god mørk doppelbock. Særdeles fin smag, med en snert af karamel.
Butelka 0,5l. Aromat przyjemny, chlebowy, dużo owoców, śliwka, wiśnia, te klimaty. W smaku chlebowe, karmelowe, dość słodkie.

Pours a dark red with a off white head that dissipates quickly. Has the aroma of bread, and a bit of cherry. It started with an overwhelming sweetness but as it warmed it became malty. There is a lingering after taste that is annoying to me. Over all I like the beer except for the aftertaste taste and its not as "chewy" as I thought it would be.

0,5 l bottle. Pours dark ruby red with a finger of rocky tan head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is huge malt, caramel, toffee, chocolate, dried fruit, resin. Taste is medium sweet, not overwhelming though, light bitterness. Body is medium to full, but it does not feel heavy, texture is smooth, carbonation is average. Finish is long, quite sweet, caramel and resin with some light bitterness. Overall very balanced doppelbock, very smooth, rich and easily drinkable.

Ruby-brown color. Great malty aromas of baked dark rye bread, red berries, a little bit of roast. Nice rich flavor. Super malty. Some chocolate, roast, a bit of herbal hoppiness. I expected it to be sweeter, but it is actually very balanced and complex. Medium plus body, but easy to drink. Medium carbonation. Lovely beer.

Draft Half Pint at Battersea Beer Festival, London in Feb 2010 - Ruby Red colour. Very Malty; toasty/roasty malts, lots of caramel and toffee, chocolate, hint of coffee, nuts?. Very Fruity; dark fruits, plums, dates, some spice. Sweet malty fruity throughout leading to a dry slightly bitter finish. Nice beer! (2010-02)

and that is why I love this style. great solid brew. malty, got some chocolate in taste, some dark fruits and much malt - nice hefty palate. could drink this often...
draft at the grail. want to try a bottle next
clear mahagony liquid with tan head. aroma of caramel, bread, berries. tastes same, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

Appearance: red, clear, white foam, rocky head. Aroma: bread, malt, roasty, wild berries. Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, spicy. Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, astringent, medium bitter, long finish.

Bottle. Pours dark mahagon brown with small beige head. Aroma: malty, caramel, bready, toffee, chocolate, berries. Taste: medium sweet, caramel, cherry, bready, berries, dark fruits. Medium body. Nice beer.

Brown body with moderate beige head. Sweet roasted malt forward aroma with caramel and dark fruit.Taste is caramel malts, sweet, bit of chocolate, some roasted flavor. Medium carbonation and mouthfeel.

Dark red brown some tan foam. Aroma fresh farmhouse oats, hay, caramel. Tastes caramel toast. mild bitter finish. some creamy. best doppelbock ive ever had (I dont usually like em either) way better than celebrator
On tap at the flying hound. Ruby brown, roasted, sweet, caramel malt aroma and taste. Well balanced and rich. Just amazing. Full bodied, drinkable not cloying so good

Clear deep brown body, medium white head. Malty aroma, caramel, dried raisin, honney. Flavours of different layers of malt, caramel, dried raisin, sweet, light alcohol fusel, light bitter backone. Medium warm and malty bitter dry finish. Malty aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Slightly hazy brown / red colour, beige head.
Malty, caramel sweetness, short bitterfinish,
Instant classic, always try to have a few in the cellar, especially during winter.

Very dark bronze color. Nice lacing head. Aroma: fruit, cherry, malt, honey, caramel. Full body, malty, chocolate. A little bitterness and sourness in the finish last for a while. Minimal carbonation.

Kolor:  Mahoniowy, czysty jak łza. 
 Piana:  Żółta, drobnoziarnista. Początkowo puszysta i zwarta, pęka po czasie do wstążeczki. Na ściankach szkła pozostają liczne krążki.
Przy przechylaniu szkła tylko nieznacznie się odbudowuje. 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest wybitnie słodowy. Na pierwszym planie pojawiają się ciemne owoce z których najwyraźniej czuć ciemne winogrona, tudzież rodzynki. Za nimi podąża nieco suszonych fig.
Dalej silna karmelowa nuta, orzechy włoskie i odrobina gorzkiej czekolady. 
 Smak:  W smaku mnóstwo melanoidowych detali. Tu przypieczona skórka chlebowa, tam tosty.
Tuż obok pokazuje się karmel, orzechy, toffi, może nawet lekka śliweczka wędzona.
Smak jest złożony i harmonijny. Goryczka jest umiarkowana, półsłodki finisz.
Pełne ciało, gładka, kremowa tekstura, niskie nagazowanie. 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Znakomity Doppelbock. Bez wahania można go uznać za ideał stylu. Zajmuje on w tej chwili 2-gie miejsce na RateBeerze. Chciałbym jeszcze spróbować Celebrator z Ayinger, który jest na szczycie listy, aby mieć pełne porównanie.

Bardzo bogaty smak i aromat. Króluje slodowość, a wraz z nią wyraźne akcenty melanoidowe (przypieczona skórka, tosty), karmel, ciemne owoce (śliwki wędzone, winogrona, figi).
Z tyłu pojawia się lekki czekoladowy smak.
Delikatny, kremowy i bardzo smaczny lager z tradycyjnym podejściem do piwowarstwa.

Bottle. Nuts, almond, wafers, vanilla, honey, bread crust, only subtle caramel. Sweetish but far from cloying, fullish though not chewy, very nutty flavour with a note of incense, lighter notes of cocoa and a light, herbal bitterness. Awesome beer, worthy of its praise.

Amber coloured almost dense head that doesnt stay long. Strong malty caramelish aroma with hints of cinnamon. When drunk, my first thought was Im drinking maltbeer for kids. A simple and straight forward beer that Ive expected more. The finish average, carbonation is soft. Maybe I got a bad bottle, I will try it another time again. But by now I recommend Ayinger Celebrator

0,5 l Flasche. Aroma: malzig, karamellig, süß. Erscheinung: Rotbraunes Bier, cremefarbener boöis hellbrauner, dichter Schaum, schöne Gardine. Geschmack: Karamellig, süß, leicht bitter, leicht alkoholisch. Nachgeschmack: vollmundig, schwer. Gesamt: Lecker.

On tap at the brewery. Clear mahogany color with tan head. Aroma has dark, toasted malts and some brown sugar. Taste starts sweet and malty with a burnt sugar note. Finish has some roasty bitterness. Medium body and carbonation. A really well made beer, tasty and easy to drink.
UPDATED: OCT 30, 2016 Aus der Flasche getrunken (Getränkemarkt Dessau). Schönes Dunkelbraun im Glas mit feinporiger Schaumdecke. Volle Malzaromen, leider sind Lakritznoten durchschmeckend.

Quelle mousse et que dire du liquide. Il est dun beau marron-cuivré. Au nez, des effluves de caramel, de raisins secs, de grain et dherbes fraîches.. Le plaisir est immédiat en bouche. La texture est veloutée, les saveurs sont sucrées; par du miel et/ou du caramel, fruitées, par des fruits séchés; raisins et figues, dune belle façon subtile. On sent lexpérience derrière cette bière. Cest plaisant de boire une bière dun style original. (M.A. 01.12.16) (2004-181016)
Z kranu w Andechser am Dom. Klarowne, bardzo dobrze się prezentujące, z drobną pianą pomimo wysokiej mocy. W smaku mega słodowe, troche palone - bardzo przyjemne. Gładkie w odczuciu, pijalne.
Dark brown with a tan head. Very malty, sweet, caramel malt, chocolate, with mild earth notes. Full bodied. Fantastic.

Largish bottle into German glass. Dark ruby but still transparent. Malt cola aroma and cola taste. Slightly sweet malt dominated. Alcohol hidden. Pretty good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle. Pours a dark mahogany colour. The head does not last. The aroma of this is fruit, dark chocolate and brown sugar. The taste is very good indeed. Medium heavy sweet with light bitterness maybe some unami. It is rich and satisfying. lightly carbonated. Really good stuff.

Flasche 0,5l: Kastanienbraun, Schwarz, glasklar, kräftiger mittelporiger brauner Schaum; tiefe dunkle Süße in der Nase, komplex, schwer, Malzzucker, getrocknete/eingelegte Früchte, Röstaromen, schwarze Kirschen, dunkle Schokolade, Kaffee; im Körper kräftige dunkle Süße, Malzzucker, kräftige Röstaromen, dunkle Schokolade, Kaffee, cremig, deutliche Kohlensäure, angenehme Bitterkeit; langer süß-malziger Nachgang mit leichten Röstaromen

Amsterdam Pubcrawl 2016, @Brecht, van tap. caramel bruin/rood met zacht fijne bruine kraag. geroosterde mout, caramel, rookmout, gerookt, gebrand, zacht, super goede smaken, gedroogde pruim, wat rozijn, zacht en redelijk dik mondgevoel. lekker

Tap. Pours clear copper chestnut, medium beige head, dissipates quickly but leaves nice lacing. Aroma is malty, roasty, black tea. Flavor is rich, malty, cocoa, hints of coffee, roasted malt, toasted rye bread, tea tones. Medium body, soft mouthfeel.

Poured into a pilsner glass, the appearance was a rich dark brown color. A rich semi-thick one finger-ed eggshell white foamy head started and dissipated. Smooth foamy rings of lace form nicely.
The aroma starts with rich sweet dark fruity bread. Rich sweet roasty nuts with sweet milk chocolate malt balls comes through to blend with the Lager yeast very nicely. Robust enough to bring about caramel and toffee portions. Candied fruits somewhat show their face as it warms.
The flavor takes in all of the previously mentioned aromas sweetly with a nice bready smooth aftertaste leading into a sly dark fruity sort of finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a damn nice sessionability about it. Carbonation feels low. Slight sticky but acceptable.
Overall, damn nice doppelbock. Of course, why knock the Germans on their own style.

Bottle. Pours a dark red-brown with a soft, creamy, shallow, off-tan head. Nose is dried fruit, port wine, chocolate, vanilla, roast nuts, and a very faint edge of salinity. On the tongue, its exceedingly rich and complex; this is a doppelbock that veers closely to being a stout in body and layers of flavor. Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy, and the alternating touches of dark dried fruit and nuttiness is perfect. I see why this is a hundred pointer.

Theres really nothing quite like the enjoyment you get from pouring a German brew from one of those distinct bullet-shaped bottles into thick-walled mug. The best feeling is knowing you get to enjoy it all to yourself. Andechser Doppelbock Dunkel has a clear brown body and a thick eggshell-colored head. Candied fruit and toasted sugar aromatics. Flavors are both rustically simple yet quite complex (for a Lager). Molasses, fruitiness, caramel, bread, chocolate, and a bit of hoppiness near the finish. Completely smooth feel. This ones easygoing yet works best when enjoyed over a period of time to experience how the starchiness comes out as it warms. Slowly enjoying this with Sleeps Holy Mountain playing nearby seems like a wholly appropriate idea.
Shared 16.9 oz. bottle. Pours a dark amber-brown, clear, with a very light-beige head. Aroma of caramel, nuts, dark fruits, bread and toast. Similar flavors. Very good.

Aroma: intense maltiness with some molasses; Appearance: very dark amber with offiwhite head that lingers; Taste: follows nose with some additional vanilla and molasses; reminds me of Christmas cookies; Palate: medium body with long, sweet finish; Overall: can appreciate it but not my favorite style. Would not get again.

500 ml bottle from Stoughton Spirits in Stoughton, WI, served at a bit below cellar temp in a St. Ambroise glass. Big creamy off-white very stable head diminishes gradually, so gradually atop the dark translucent bronze body, leaving light flecks on the glass-sides...nose is overwhelmingly caramel-cream to begin with, a bit of fig steals in, very sweet, just a touch of roast or smoke...body is sweet, mostly dominated by those caramel malts with just a bit of dry roast coming in at the finish, along with an ashy character that is a bit unpleasant, unfortunately - not ruinous but a definite detraction...body isnt as full as it could or should be, perhaps not watery but certainly feeling a bit thin; carbonation appropriate or perhaps a little strong. I had a few of these in Vermont in 2013-14 and I think they might have been a little better, perhaps a little fresher; as it is, though not poor by any means this has to count as a disappointment given its reputation and how long Id been looking forward to it. Ill certainly give it more chances, especially if I can find it a little bit closer to home and more obviously fresh.
[backlog] 26-08-15 // bottle at Domsgickel, Mainz. Dark brown, beige head. Massive bock. Sweet body. Strong malty. Some caramel. Chocolate, roasty malts.Full body.

Aroma: caramel, dark bread with fruits, some molasses.
Taste: sweet with light acidity and light spicy bitterness.
Flavour: light sherry notes, some rotten fruits, 
Light spicy alcohol in the finish.

Very good malty and aromatic beer with well hidden alcohol.
So this blew me away. Not as sweet as many doppelbocks but just a delicious flavor. Finish is smooth, a little caramel. Easily my favorite doppelbock hands down.

Bottle courtesy of Deanso. Poured a clear medium brown with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is fruit, sweet caramel malt. The flavour is moderate sweet with a rich, fruity, light spice, light hop palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Pours a deep deep brown/maroonnwith a medium beige head that leaves pretty good lacing. Nose is of caramel, alcohol and some caramelized/slightly burnt sugars. Taste is moderately sweet and a lightly bitter with more caramel, a light roastiness and light alcohol. Not boozy but slightly warming. Body is medium-full and carbonation moderate. Long lasting sweet finish. A fine doppelbock that is exactly on style. Nice!
(Bouteille provenant de Bottlecraft): Une Doppelbock assez croustillante et moyennement sucrée. Pommes cuites, baies et fèves de cacao avec une finale assez rôtie.

Deep bronze pour, 2 fingers of light tan head. Nose is dark malt. More sweet than bitter. Middle is chocolate malt, stone fruit, some molasses; bready and delicious. Finish is smooth, with the hops drying things just a bit.

No information in detail about the malts, hops or drinktemperature on the bottle but a very good beer.
Clear red-brown beer with a nice light cappuccino head, very roasty and good, fizzy, smell is roasty, for a German Doppelbock Dunkel very, very good and one of the best, full body, 
(I have 0.5l bottle with best-before 24.02.17)

Aroma: Caramel, bread, raisins, dried fig, light spice, flower. Appearance: Ruby color, head medium-high, note very durable. Taste: Very smooth, bready, caramelly, feels a bit roasty, fruity notes: dates, dried figs, light spicy bitterness. Palate: Body is medium-high, carbonation low, finish sweet, very drinkable and soft.

Keg at The GBBF, London. A clear brown colour with a thin beige head. Aroma of bready malt, prune, some caramel, maybe dates, slight liquorice and subtle dark chocolate. 
Taste of bready malt, prune, other dried fruits, some dark chocolate, slight caramel, a little liquorice, maybe vanilla and subtle brown sugar. Full bodied and soft carbonation. A long, warming, pruney, chocolate bitterness in the finish. Not a fan of prunes which are dominant in this but I warmed to the deep, flavourful taste of this beer. Nice traditional doppelbock flavours like chocolate and caramel. Really good.

On-tap at the brewery. Clear deep brown with a small beige head. Aroma is intense malty with notes of dark bread, caramel, chocolate and prunes. Sweet, flavors of caramel, light roast, toasted bread, toffee, chocolate, dried fruits, alcoholic bitterness. Medium-full bodied. Good Doppelbock.
40 cl på restaurang i Lubeck. En fantastiskt god och väl balanserad öl. Vill ha fler.

Andechs Doppelbock Dunkel
:
Fawn big schaumkrone, dark brown clear body.
Fruity aroma, prunes, plums, complete fruitiness, with malted candies and roasted honey malts.
Malty taste, plums, almond, prunes, vanilla, red apple, sweet liquorice
- leading to a pruney malty good finish.
Good body, soft fizz.
Overall a really good, umcomplicated double-bock.
[Btl 50cl BB01118 at Birreira Andorra...of all places on earth...hehe]

Elaborada mediante el procedimiento tradicional Triple Mash, esta cerveza está destinada a ser saboreaba lentamente. Su aroma deleita al bebedor: acentos suaves tostados y matices de frutos secos con caramelo. Esta cerveza de la Santa Montaña de Baviera presenta una agradable efervescencia. Y luego está su sabor inconfundible: recubrimiento bucal y aterciopelado, fuerte y aún así con mucho sabor a malta, junto a un potente y robusto cuerpo. Al mismo tiempo, se desarrolla una dulzura fácilmente reconocible, aportada por el cacao tostado.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2016 Tap at Zum Schneider, Montauk. Pours dark caramel brown sort of Burgundy. Off white head. Aroma is caramel heavy, toffee, fig, roasted malt. Nice. Flavor is carnal, toffee, sort of the same. Not bad. I can dig it.

Pours a clear dark amber color with plenty of ruby highlights coming through when held to a light. A dense, foamy, two-finger light tan colored head quickly reduces to a thin film and collar, leaving behind small amounts of soapy lace.

Rich, sweet, toasty and bready malt profiles lead the aroma upfront. Notes of toffee and caramel follow, along with raisins, plums and dark stone fruit. Taste follows suit, but encompasses far more complexity than the nose implied. Soft caramel and toffee lead above an abundance of warm toasted malts, before transitioning to a complex amalgamation of dark fruits with a raisin-like sweetness leading the way; plums, figs, prunes and cherry are all detectible, along with hints of brown sugar and molasses. Towards the finish, slightly darker roast characters combine to bring traces of dark chocolate, cocoa and spice. The mouth feel is a medium to full body and moderate carbonation give a soft, smooth and creamy feel. Traces of roasted bitterness and dark chocolate linger on the finish.

Overall this is a fantastic beer. The best Doppelbock I have tasted to date. Highly Recommended.

Scents of bread, malt, yeast and pumpernickel.Pours deep dark brown with a tan head of small bubbles big but fast dissipating. Balanced bread tastes with some sweet undertones and a toasty lightly sour finish. Medium carbonation with an oily mouthfeel and some fizziness. Balanced and rich. I like it.

Ein zutiefst malzsüßer Vollstrecker. Aromen von Dörrobst, Beeren und natürlich MALZ machen Lust aufs erste Schlückchen. Der Trunk begeistert dann ebenfalls dezent säuerlich, unaufdringlich waldhonigsüß und fast ein wenig verführerisch. Man denkt sogar an Barley Wine :) !!!! So muss ein dunkles Doppelbockbier munden, spritzig & voller "Emotionen". 0,3/3,50. Bei der KIELER WOCHE 2016, vom Fass, am ANDECHS Stand.

Mély árnyalatú, réz színű, rubinos reflexeket megcsillantó főzet, az első pár szippantás valósággal szivárványos illatok palettáját tárja elénk, melyek között a gumicukor, málna és karamell képe is kirajzolódni látszik. Egy pár pillanattal később már sötétül a szerkezet, leginkább az égetett cukros, kávés, diós elemek érvényesülnek. Íze már ennek alapján képeződik le, kellően komplexek és izgalmasak a kortyok, melyek kezdetben gyümölcsösek, majd sötétbe hajlóak, pörkölt színezetbe fordulók, eközben kellően krémesek és teltek, utóíze alapján azonban egy árnyalattal vaskosabb malátás támogatást talán még elbírnának.

Nagy, tartós hab, vörösbe hajló, sötétbarna szín. Karamelles, pörkölt malátás illat. Enyhén kesernyés, édeskés karamelles, csokis ízvilág. Testes, közepesen szénsavas, jól egybesimuló ízekkel. Finom, jól csúszó sör.

500ml bottle purchased from Lifesource Natural Grocers in Salem Oregon
$3.99
Dark amber/ brown colored body with a nice sized thick and frothy cream colored head.
Unlike most dopplebocks the aroma of this is mainly wheat, vanilla and hazelnuts. Nice
Taste similar to the aroma but more of the dark fruit and over ripe bananas , raisins and a bit of licorice appear..many flavors as it heats.
Delicious smooth and silky mouth feel.
An excellent traditional dopplebock.
Bottle. Pours a brown color with orange high lights. Notes of earth, caramel, toffee, metal, and tootsie roll.

From the 500 ml. bottle stamped L-3004. Deep dark amber brown pour with a modest off-white head. The aroma is sweet with malt and molasses. Maybe a little chocolate but more malts and molasses. Low hop profile. Bold body. A very rich and sweet tasting beer with mild bitterness to finish. Very good indeed.

Pours deep brown with a creamy tan head. The aroma has rich cream, toffee, caramel, smooth toasty malt and milk chocolate. It has a medium smooth body with fairly soft carbonation. The taste has lots of toffee, thick bread, caramel, crackers and some woodiness. The finish is drier and more of an earthy rustic thing than most of the style. Really well done.
Along with Yves at his home dark brown colored body with off white head and a herby malt hops aroma a herby sweet caramel malt taste with a slight bitter finish
Shared with wim at my home. Malty fruited aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is malty sweet caramel hinted.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Kloster andechs doppelbock Dunkel 7.1% shared by my buddy Laurent.

A purplish brown with a fruity aroma featuring plums and raisins as well as spicy malts. decent body as malty stone fruit flavor with a bit of heat. OK.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

May. 15. On tap at Andechser am Dom. It poured clear copper body with medium sized head. Aroma contained alcohol, caramel, some sweet dried fruit but also roasted notes. Flavor was more bitter at first, roasted sugar and cocoa with a sticky sweet doppelbock (caramel, sugar, dry fruits etc) counterpart coming on. Then, light herbal hops were more pronounced in the aftertaste, rounding it nicely without too sticky impression. Full in body and cloying anyway. Quite pleasant and relatively complex, although might have expected more to be honest.
Ottima birraaqa ottimo il sapore di malto e la qualita della birra bravi birraiii

Aroma: toasty, roasty, caramel, chocolate, alcohol, toffee,
Appearance: brown with reddish tint, off-white head, good retention. 
Taste: low bitterness, light sweetness, roasty, chocolate, nuts, toast, bread, alcohol, raisins and vanilla. Impressed.
Palate: medium-full body, slick feel, average carbonation, long smooth finish.
Overall: A nice sipper that I will gladly return to.
Draft to taster at Churchkey pour dark cola brown with thin tan head. Nose molasses, toffee, hint of soy. Taste raisin, prune, molasses, sweet character throughout.

Tap at churchkey in DC. Dark copper plum with thick off white head. Dark fruit nose. Malty. Malty sweet and tangy grain. Slight caramel taste. Otherwise the malty grain dominates. Dark fruit is low in the taste. Finish is ok. Medium body. I wanted more layers and depth, but decent.

Draft 0.33l at Cafe Brecht Amsterdam Netherlands.28.03.2016.Pour it dark color with medium white head.Aroma blueberry,caramel,just pinch of spices.Taste starts with caramel,brown sugar,rusted note and finish with blueberry juice.Nice easy drinkable,with fizzy carbonation.

Quite impressive in aroma and taste: quite similar to Schlenkerlas products, but without the bitterness added from the smoked malts. Strong lager with quite unique presence of malts and sweetness... overall, pretty good doppelbock.

Garrafa de 50 cl partilhada com alguns amigos em Nuremberga.Uma Doppelbock muito bem conseguida. Escura com tons de rubi.Aroma de frutos secos e caramelo. Encorpada com sabor a cacau , especiarias e ligeiro lúpulo.

Bottle:
Pours almost clear, dark, wet, copper with a thick tan head.
Aroma of raisin bread, caramel.
Flavour is sweet dark bread, wheat malt, chocolate malt, raisin/figs.
Really great.

Ar- strong malts, light caramel, getting a salty molasses

Ap- clear brown with hints of red, nice off white head

Fl- sweet dark malts, dark toast, no hop flavor, slight hop bitterness, hint of milk chocolate. 

Mf- full bodied, well carbed, slight warming, smooth

Ov- great beer if you like malt sweetness. I do. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2016 Dark brown, little light brown head. Malt: roast, coffee, dried fruit, raisins. No hops. Light bitterness, sweetness which is almost phenolic. Heavy bitterness in the long finish. Medium body, smooth.

500ml btl. No apparent code date. Appearance: Deep brown and clear, with a beautiful deep ruby red and a moderate khaki head. 
Aroma: Strong dark fruit character of raisin, fig, and plum 
Taste: Rich bready, toasty maltiness with caramel and roast. Strong dark fruit flavor continues, predominantly raisin and fig. Fruit has a slightly spicy feel. Bitterness just strong enough to counter the rich malt. 
Mouthfeel: Medium to heavy body with a moderate carbonation. Alcohol strength well hidden. 
Finish: Toasted bread and dark fruit linger long after. 
Overall: Top notch Doppelbock. Complex malt character of bread, toast, caramel and a slight touch of roast. Raisin and fig fruit character stays strong on the nose and continues through the taste and finish.

Deep mahogany color, large bubbles head diminishes quickly , fizzy bubbles. 

Herbs, sour (just right amount of sour) dried fruits, raisin, some smoke on exhale, mouthful, semi sweet.

I find this combination of gas and sour common in many German beers. 

Not my kind of beer, it has too heavy smell for me (hits sinuses), but for those who like malty nut brown ales, may be a real treat.
UPDATED: APR 13, 2016 Una cerveza densa, con mucho cuerpo. Muy aromática, de sabor intenso. Deja muy buen gusto tirando a miel.
Bottle at green sheep. Brown colour with a small white head. Nose of roasted malts. Taste is medium sweetness. Medium carbonation. Nutty taste with slight cocoa. Nice beer.
Drank from a large bottle poured into a pint glass a great, delicious sunken well done!

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2016 Pours brown into the bottle with a creamy head. Pleasant roasted malt and dark fruit aromas. First taste reveals a rich, full bodied beer with strong hints of roasted malt, caramel, molasses, and chocolate, with more subtle dark fruit and even vanilla undertones. The flavors deepen as you progress. Smooth and extremely well balanced. Sweet without being overly sweet, and with a light hops bitterness in the finish. Drink cool but not cold. Excellent stuff!

Clear mahogany body with a beige head.
Sweet caramel malt aroma with metallic notes.
Balanced moderate sweetness and bitterness. Rich, malty flavours. Bitter finish with a bit of alcohol.
Full body with a creamy mouthfeel and soft carbonation.

The smoothness and full malt character make this a very good doppelbock. The aroma is somewhat lacking, though.

Rich, delectable and complex. The sweet malty nose and deep carmel color make this beer enjoyable even before the first sip. Well-balanced, and although there is a strong alcohol component, this brew is somehow delicate
500 ml. bottle. Pours reddish brown with a nice beige head. Aroma of malt, fruit, and caramel. Taste is malt, dark fruit, caramel, bread, and a hint of chocolate. Excellent.
Flasche - Pechschwarze Farbe mit cremiger Schaumkrone. Aromen von Schokolade, Toffee, Karamellmalz. Alkohol präsent aber gut verdeckt. Abgang süßlich, gut ausbalanciert.

February 1, 2016. Bottle, best before July 6, 2016. 
Clear deep mahogny with a small yellowish head. Aroma is malty with toffee, dark bread, hints of prunes, raisins and berries. Taste is sweet, malty soft bitter. Finish is soft bitter, sweet caramel, dark bread, prunes, ripe berries, very light roasted notes, caramel and just a hint of alcohol. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, creamy and silky texture. 
Very good, sweet and malty yet balanced and drinkable.

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Aged for around 2 years. Dark brown-ruby coloured with a large head of white foam. It has a sweet caramel and malty flavour with chocolate and red fruity flavours followed by more sweet malt on the finish. Ok.

Bottle from Erzbierschof Zurich. Like a good Doppelbock should me. Malty and sweet, a bit boozy and greasy, with that indistinguishable aroma that makes Doppelbock great. Heavy and full-bodied. Delicious.
Bottle shared by John - thanks! Orange amber pour with a small dense head. Caramel malty, slightly earthy, mild banana and mild cocoa. Very good.
Dark mahogany, full and tasty smell. Rich and full-bodied taste, smooth feeling, only slightly bitter, malt and some caramel, dried fruits. Sweet, but not too sweet. A really good beer.
Red-brown color with a nice large foamy head. The aroma is malty with caramel and small hints of sweet hops.

Bottle. Plus mahogany amber with small beige head. Aroma is a malt bomb. Figs, prunes, plums, malt, light roast, really sweet. Taste is the same. Overly sweet maltiness. Boring. Light toasty finish only.
Bottle split with a few friends. Reddish amber pour with a frothy head. Notes of dried fruits, prunes, caramel, apples, grains and some dates.

Pours redish-dark brown with a medium off-white head. Aroma is is quite strong, roasted mostly, with some hidden coffee notes and caramel. Taste is very full bodied with very low carbonation, strong roasted feel with a slight sweet-feel, evolving in to a slightly dry finish. An exquisite beer. Top notch!

Clear brown color with foam layer. Little licorice and light roasty nose. The taste has a roasty malty note. The beer is smooth with a foamy mouth feeling and a rich unique character. Calm aftertaste.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours a reddish, clear dark brown with a small, off white head. Aroma has lots of dark malts, surprisingly fruity, plums, jam, sweet prunes. Taste is again super malty, dark, caramel, fudge, fruit. Fairly intense, high carb and a medium oily texture.

Rosso rame con riflessi carminio, schiuma sottile bianca e fine. Al naso è complessa con sentori di prugne, caffè e caramello. In bocca si percepisce il leggero amaro di luppoli nobili e il dolce dei malti caramello. Il corpo e la carbonazione sono equilibrati ed il finale è di calore alcolico netto.

500 ml bottle, no dating that I can find but L 1595 is stamped on the back label. This was a recent arrival at my local beer store so Im assuming its somewhat fresh. Served in a mug, the beer pours a clear reddish/copper color with about an inch and a half light tan head. Head retention and lacing are both pretty good. Aroma is nice and malty, the brew smells like toasted malt, caramel, dried dark fruit, and some light grassy hops. Taste is similar to the aroma, but with some breadiness and chocolate noticeable. Mouthfeel/body is medium, its smooth and very easy to drink. I thought this was really good, Ill have to pick up some more soon if theres any left at the store! $3.49 a bottle.
Smell of coffee, malt, slightly toast, come in dark brown red with very thin tan head. Taste with plum, coffee, caramel and malt, balanced bitterness, medium body, low carbonated. Quite good

Blackbelly Market, 11/23/15. Dark brown in color with a tan head. Has a nice mix of dark fruit (plum, raisin) , with dark malt, caramel / toffee, and some bread. A bit of spice comes through as well. Some hop bitterness is here too, hiding in the background. Nice beer overall.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2016 Bottle from SB, had at home. Best by date: 21-07-16.
App: Lots of pressure when the cap comes off. Clear dark nut brown with a 1 finger fizzy short lived nicotine yellowed head leaving no lace.
Aroma: Rich sweet musty malty aroma with dark christmas bread, maple syrup, nuts, chocolate and vague notes of coffee and minty salmiak. Very nice and deep aroma.
Taste: Taste is nutty and quite sweet with syrupy caramel, bread, chocolate and some spice/pepper.
Palate: Medium to bigger body, soft low carbonation, oily sticky texture.
Overall: A bit disappointed. Very nice rich aroma, but the flavour doesnt really live up to it and the carbonation is a bit on the weak side. Nice malty beer though. Have more so it might grow on me.
Flaske. Farven er klar mørkebrun med en kraftig lysebrun skumkrone. Aromaen er mørk frugt, krydderier og krydderurter. Smagen er chokolade kirsebær og rosiner

Poured from the tap at Ottos in Willow Grove, PA. The appearance is a deep reddish brown with a big tan head. the aroma is full of malt and caramel with some coffee in the back. The flavor is incredible and your mouth fills with malty greatness. A world class beer.

Botella 50 cl tomada en el Lupulo en octubre 2011. Fcpref 28..03..2012. (r1090). Cuerpo ligero a medio con 7.1 vol algo denso y pasyltoso con cierta sensación alcohólica. Maltas y cereales ligeramente tostadas. Buena.
Reddish brown with dissolving head. Lot of roasted, nutty, chocolate, dried fruit, cinnamon, pine, hint of smoke. Little sweet little bitter. Backlog from 2014/06/25.

Details: Bottle purchased from Hometown Spirits.  Aroma: The nose is molasses and raisins. There are subtle notes of Worstchershire sauce. Appearance: Deep dark brown, but still transparent. Rich tan head about 1.5" tall which disappears to a thin cap shortly after pouring. Bubbles are visibly apparent. Taste: Sweet with further notes of molasses and prunes. The barest notes of bitter in the finish. Palate: Medium full bodied with a slight effervescence on the tongue. Somewhat mouth coating leaving trailing notes of the aromas. Overall: A remarkable beer well suited to a piece of wheat bread or pumpernickel and a sharp cheese. Equally a match for grilled or roasted meats, and perhaps for smoked and peppered dishes as well.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2015 Bottle bbe 10.12.15. Dark brown beer with a small quickly vanishing head. Sweetish aroma of malt and honey. Pretty flat taste of malt and nuts with minuscule hints of dried fruit. Somewhat nice but not breathtaking.
Reichich Malzaromen und wenig Bitterarumen, Anklänge von Schokolade und Trockenfrüchten, im Abgang etwas kurz

Pours a dark chestnut brown color with mahogany edges and a two finger, frothy beige head that very slowly settles into a lasting ring. Impressive retention with sporadic streaks of lace left behind. 

Toasted, slightly smokey aroma with a nice balance of sweet and roasted malt notes. Lots of toffee and caramel along with some bready yeast and subtle zesty spice. I surprised about the roasted/smokey element by it adds another dimension to the swee malt profile. 

On the fuller end of medium body with a smokey roasted malt presence that gives off a decent amount of lingering bitterness. Hints of toast, smoke and subtle BBQ/smoked meat followed by caramel and toffee sweetness. This is balanced by a strong bready yeast presence as well as some hazelnut and a touch of rye spice. Sweetness nicely counters the roast/toasted malts. Finishes dry and slightly tart. Well balanced and refreshing. ABV is barely noticeable making this complex beer very easy to drink.

Aroma: malts, a little caramel and honey, a faint fruity note (plums, grapes, this kind of thing), a bit of dark bread, and a little bit of alcohol.
 Appearance: dark brown; clear; head small, unstable.
 Taste: sweet and mildly bitter.
 Palate: body full; carbonation soft; finish sweet and a bit bitter; spicy from alcohol, in a pleasant way; a bit tart.
 Overall: really nice, intense but not overwhelming. Maybe just a tad too sweet, both in the aroma and in the taste. Quite enjoyable nonetheless.

Piana delikatnie beżowa, średniopęcherzykowa, nietrwała. Piwo nie koronkuje. Barwa głęboko rubinowa, czerwone refleksy. W smaku alkoholowe, brakuje słodyczy, kwaśności, generalnie wszystkiego. Odczucie w ustach żadne, goryczki brak, wysycenie niskie.

Botella. Color rojizo oscuro. Limpia. Dos dedos de espuma. Aroma muy complejo. Mucho de cereal tostado, pero muy tostado. Recuerda un poco al olor que desprenden las fábricas de cerveza. Hay algo también frutal que no consigo distinguir. Quizá algún fruto del bosque. En boca lo primero que viene son esos cereales tostados para luego sorprendentemente pasar a algo dulce con un final y un postgusto claramente a caramelo. Deja un regusto muy bueno y con 7 grados muy disimulados. Distinta y muy interesante.

Beer was good, had a unique palates and taste and was smooth. Unique I will say.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Cooper Craft Kitchen Chelsea. Dark brown with faint reddish tint, small foamy beige head, faint fruity aroma, medium carbonation, caramel taste, well balanced caramel malt taste, abrupt finish. Very well balanced brew, the high alcohol content is well managed.

Nice ruby color, medium beige head. Sweet caramel, malt, dried fruits, raisins, spices and cherries in aroma. Dried fruits, spices in taste, Low carbonation, medium to full bodied. OK, but IMO not that spectacular to be the 2nd doppelbock on RB.

A dark, ruby-red beer with a firm, brown layer of foam. It has a sweet, syrup like aroma with the touch of chocolate and caramel. It has quite a balanced taste between sweet and bitter, but also some licorice and chocolate. The aftertaste is nice and bitter.

Een donker, robijnrood bier met een stevige bruine kraag. Een zoet, stroopachtig aroma met op de achtergrond de hint van chocolade en caramel. De smaak is mooi in balans tussen bitter en zoet, en op de achtergrond de toets van drop en chocolade. De nasmaak is lekker bitter.

Ruby beer with a small, short lasting, beige, almost yellow head. Aromas of intense cherry wood, coffee, alcohol, floral and herbal hops, licorice, caramel, malt and yeast . Full of roasted malt in taste, coffee, light peppery notes together with fruity alcohol, sparkling afterglow. Full body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Aroma could be less "plain" malty, apart from that really good.

500 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with a nice frothy off white khaki head that settles to a thin sudsy film and collar. Aroma is chocolate roasted malt light clove raisin chocolate licorice. Palate is medium creamy velvety. Really nice!

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2017 0.5l bottle from hieber, 1.05.
pours a clear dark mahogany with a steady tan head and a nice lacing. aroma of caramel, butterscotch, dried fruits, roasted malts. sweetish flavour; nuts, dried fruits, chocolate. slight alcohol warmth, alcohol is well hidden despite 7.1% abv. long finish with some coffee and dark chocolatey bitterness. nice and complex.
Pours a clear Amber, with a tan head. Nice taste, malt and slightly sweet, well balanced. This is a very good doppelbock. Thumbs up!

On Tap at German restaurant in Philly. Pours brown fluffy beige head and nice lacing. Aroma is of plums, caramel malt and hint of coffee. Body is full, creamy and slightly crisp. Taste is of caramel malt, plums, brown sugar and some herbal hops. Finish is long and semi-sweet. Sweet but tasty brew.

On tap at Gourmet Haus Staudt in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is MALTS on MALTS on MALTS, sorghum syrup, raisins, lots of dried fruit. Taste is a little more mellow (but welcome) with some creaminess and light stale breadiness on the finish (also welcome). One of the best malty German beers Ive had.
Fin krop med smag af chokolade og rosiner anes i sødme. En god bockøl man nemt kan drikke flere af.

Z zapasów przywiezionych przez Ojca z wycieczki do Niemiec.
Być może po prostu nie jest to mój styl ale jedyne co chce mi się o tym piwie powiedzieć to, że szału nie ma, niczego nie urywa.

Review based on the BJCP215 guidelines (style 9A). Bottle 50 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: significant malt aroma with some caramelized notes and Maillard products (bread crust). slight vinous background. no hop aroma discernible. APPEARANCE: ruby body color and translucent. average ivory head with good retention. TASTE: very nice malty flavour with a lot of Maillard products. slight caramel note. low bitterness with an almost sweet finish. PALATE: medium-full body with moderate carbonation. very faint alcohol warmth. OVERALL: a very good example of a doppelbock with great complexity. recommended.
On tap at the bier Haus. Dark brown, thin lacing, very small head. Huge sweet malt and molasses notes . Complex, deep fruit and chocolate notes. Very interesting and tasty. Will buy again.
Roodbruine kleur met een kleine kraag. Ruikt zoetig, herfstfruit, vanille, mout. Smaakt zoetig, vanille, hetfstfruit, beetje bitter in de afdronk.

Ein guter Doppelbock. 
Rot-braun im Glas mit beiger Schaumkrone. Schönes Lacing. 
Im Aroma Honig und Karamell, zudem etwas Röstmalz. 
Im Geschmack betont malzig, Honig, Karamell, Pflaume, eingelegte Rosinen. 
Langer süßer Nachgeschmack.
16 oz draft pours hazy brown with a off white head. Aroma of malts, raisins, fruit and chocolate. Taste is dried fruit and malts.

500ml Bottle - Dark brown with red tinges. Raisins, chestnuts and caramel popcorn in the aroma. Fruity, malty and fairly rich taste with raisins, plums, cocoa and caramel detected. The finish is fruity and slightly warming.

L:
-pours a clear ruby-brown with a medium,quickly dissipating,foamy,beige head
-medium carbonation visible
S:
-bready,brown sugar,spices,grassy,caramel,syrup
T:
-Follows the nose plus plums,raisins and dates
F:
-medium carbonation,medium body
O:
Just a really good Doppelbock

Bottle from Capital Market. Super deep ruby in color. Nose is strong dark fruit with some underlying candy sugar. Very rich aroma. Rich roasty flavor up front with a lot of dark fruit. Very rich and malty. Some sweetness make up the background. Very smooth with lots of flavor. A slight hint of some hops in the finish. Most rich dark fruits. Very sippable.
Zwart bier zonder schuim. Smaak is krachtig sterk, licht zoet, rook, noten, bittere chokolade, met een klein vleugje fruit, aardbei? Echt een top bier.

Mahagony-chestnut-brown colour with a light tan head.
Aromas of some chocolate malts, bit vanilla and nutty notes as well as hints of toast develop. Gentle carbonation with a medium slick-velvety texture and a full body. Malty, toast, nutty sweetness rules the palate, yet a light bitterness lingers on the back of the palate. Lasting alty finish.

Muy oscura, casi opaca. Espuma beige de dos dedos, bastante densa. Olor marcado a café. Sabor redondo, predominando azucar tostada y caramelo. Llena la boca, entra de maravilla y nunca se diría que tiene 7 grados. Super agradable.

From a .5L 2014 bottle. 
Ive had this excellent dunkel on tap at the brewery in Andechs several times over the past few years. While the bottled version is not quite as pleasing as the fresh draft version I remember it is certainly excellent for style. The alcohol is very well hidden, theres a rich malty backbone, and the beer has great balance.

Bue en bouteille de 50cl à la brasserie un jour de forte chaleur (et ça compte dans la note)
Couleur cuivrée, peu de mousse et peu deffervescence.
Une bière avac un nez caramel.
En bouche grosse attaque sur le houblon, le caramel et le fumé. Problème avec la chaleur cest une bière qui nallait pas à regouter !
Bottle->willibecher. Medium brown with huge frothy lite tan head. A: sweet malt, bread, toffee. T: sweet malt, toffee, nuts, toast. Good.
Bue en bouteille de 50cl. Ambrée foncée. Arômes multiples : raisin, caramel, alcool, grain torréfié. Bel équilibre.

Dark copper to deep ruby, small non lasting tan head, only a ring remains. Aroma is sweet caramel, Munich malt, bit toasted, bit choco, some nuts, and fruity. Taste starts with sweet caraMunich malts, candy, dark fruits, then toffee, nuttiness and roasted malt near the end. Light+ hoppy bitterness near the finish, bittersweet finish. Medium to full bodied, velvety, low to moderate carbonation.
(0,5 bottle Pivoljub, Ljubljana)

On tap at the Andechser pub in Munich-Germany. Pours chestnut skin dark color, huge tick brownish cap. Nose: round and distinctive burnt malts aroma, dry fruit, smoke. Mouth: burnt bread crust, cheese (mild), round roast feel. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled. Deep brown pour. Strong malt character, hint of dark fruits and spice and candy. As good as advertised.

Amber brown in color... Aroma of Munich malts, caramel and toffee... Flavor is dark fruits, overripe bananas, toffee, molasses... Solid beer, more smooth than I imagined

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 50cL. Home. A clear dark brown beer with mahogany hues ; big beige foamy head ; average retention. Toasty aroma, biscuit, raisin and... grease. Medium sweet, light bitter ; light dry. Medium body and texture, average carbonation, sweet caramel lasting finish. Overall, delicious ; surprising peculiar aroma. Awesome !
It is a sweet doppel bock. The colour is dark brown. The beer is not so sparkling and there is a strong presence if caramel and it is makty. It is overall a good product.

Un nez très puissant, très présent. On sent très peu lalcool. Il vient tout de suite une rondeur assimilable au sirop dérable ou une sauce soja sucrée.
En bouche, on pourrait sattendre à quelque chose de vulgaire et sirupeux. Finalement, lalcool enrobe un peu la langue mais sert très bien les arômes déjà évoqués et permet même une longueur en bouche très agréable.
Finalement, on retient des notes boisées et une impression de rondeur.
Un produit de très haute qualité.

500mL bottle purchased at Bottle Barn in Santa Rosa. The aroma on this is really toasted and grainy. Not much else. Super malty. Transparent dark amber body with a egg-shell head that is on the small side. Starts with a super toasty malt flavor that essentially mimicks the smell of a boiling mash. This is a nice, nutty caramel sweetness in the middle, before more of the toasty melanoidin flavor comes in at the end. The mouthfeel on this is sublime. This is a much different idea of doppelbock than I am used to tasting. Some late nuttiness and a little leather, too. Great stuff.

Bottle 0.5l at home, Nivala. BBE 25 03 15. Colour is clear deep reddish copper with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Some dry fruits, chocolate, some sweetness, syrup, hints of caramel and malts. Little bit of disappoint for me.

Bottle at the Swan and Rushes, Leicester. Mid brown and ruddy, translucent. Scent consists of caramel, roast malt, treacle, orange peel. Full sweet malt bomb of a taste. Chewy, warming, sedative palette. Gorgeous beer.

12 oz bottle, poured into a tankard at ~40 degrees F.

Appearance: Pours a clear amber-brown, and forms a thick, fluffy light tan head with excellent retention. Lacing is somewhat insane.

Smell: Sticky buns with raisins throughout, fresh from the oven and just finished glazing, all bread and sweetness and fruit.

Taste: Sweetness is the primary characteristic, and it is present in abundance, from the first moments of the sip all the way to the finish. The sweetness is definitely bready as well, alongside a sort of coppery, metallic twang. Theres a not insignificant amount of noble hops in this beer, which lends a slightly medicinal taste to the sweetness, and an oddly bitter finish and aftertaste for a doppelbock. I get no fruit or nut aspects from the flavor, possibly due to the hop factor.

Mouthfeel: This beer doesnt exactly deliver the sort of thick, creamy, sticky mouthfeel I associate with a doppelbock, instead drinking more like a bock.

Overall: Being perfectly honest, this isnt my favorite doppelbock, nor do I classify it in the same tier as Korbinian and Celebrator. This drinks more like a maibock, and itd be a pretty darned good one.

Bottle. Pours reddish brown with a beautiful creamy beige head with little lace. Aroma is roasted malts, caramel, light dark fruits, light alcohol. Taste is similar with burnt sugar notes, caramel, roastiness, some coffee and some bitterness. Oily mouthfeel, medium body, low carbonation.

Schöne Farbe, sehr dunkles rot, erinnert an Kirschsaft. Aroma: süß, malzig, brotig, getrocknete Früchte. Im Geschmack zeigen sich die gleichen Aromen. Wenig Hopfen. 
Gut!
On tap at Hot Spot. Pours a dark brown color without much head. Malty, but a little too sweet for my preference. Some toffee.

Andechser Doppelbock Dunkel has a fairly thick, creamy, cream-colored head, a mostly clear, dark-brown, bubbly appearance, with low-to-moderate lacing left on the glass. The aroma is of rich, sweet, syrupy, brown bread crust, raisin, spiced bread, raisin bread, and brown sugar. Taste is of the same elements, riding alongside moderate hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy, and Andechser Doppelbock Dunkel finishes somewhat crisp, surprisingly drinkable, and exquisite. RJT

Deep burgundy with a thin dissipating head. Sweet caramel and dark fruits for the aroma. Taste of raisins, molasses, woody and earthy. Very sweet and malty. Thin and oily palate with fairly lively carbonation.

Pours a clear dark nutty brown with a fast fading off tan head. Dark malty and sweet nose with a bit of toasted bread. Bready flavor with a dry dusty malty finish with a kiss of molasses and nutty dark malts. Pretty generic and a touch too sweet.

Very sweet and malty doppelbock
 Hints of earth nd coffey creamy and rich consistenz. Nice
Great body and flavor. Smells like toffee, great head. Great mouthfeel and the taste of chocolate lingers. Youd never know this is a 7% beer. Really, really solid doppelbock.

Ottima doppelbock scura. Colore marrone intenso con vena rossastra e schiuma discretamente persistente, al naso malto tostato e punte di cioccolato. E molto beverina, il sapore è dominato dal malto tostato, note di caramello, cioccolato, forse bacche. Equilibrata però, non sono sapori troppo forti. Relativamente alcolica e di medio corpo. Ho visto il voto di 99 su ratebeer e in realtà un pochino mi ha sorpreso, perché per quanto mi sia piaciuta non la ritengo addirittura eccezionale.

0,5 l bottle. A dark red brown in the glass, nice one finger head. Choco and malt on the nose. Taste is intensive roasted mal, pleasant sweetness, little bit bready. Easy to drink, nearly hidden alcohol. Nice one.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2016 Dark reddish brown colour with tiny unstable creamy head. Aroma without note of an alcohol, with strong note of honey / caramel and hints of dark fruits, bananas, herbs and roasted malts. 
Flavor: Alcohol note is low-mild noticable. Prevailing sweet notes of caramel/honey, with fruity esters of dark fruits, with hints of banana. Malt sweetness is medium-high, hop bittereness is mild-low, finish is sweet with malty aftertaste. Carbonation is low, body is soft-sticky. Overall: very proper beer.
UPDATED: JUL 21, 2015 500cc bottle. Dark Amber/copper clear with tanned head. Intense malt. Sweet caramel. Nuts and berries. A great dopplebock!

Flaske,kjøpt i Berlin, og delt med Ovesen på Holmens påskebrygging: vakker, dyp rubinrød med lyst beige skum. Nydelig, saftig aroma og smak - dobbelbock er en herlig stil. Tørkede frukter, karamellmalt, mørke bær noe krydder og fremfor alt en stor saftighet i en elegant kropp. Stor nytelse og drikkeglede fra første til siste dråpe (mens vi venter på at vørteren kjølner).

Bottle shared with JMD at HNB 02.04.15. Dark copper. Pale, brown head. Sweet aroma, of medium dark malt and ripe berries. Excellent taste, with lots of sweet, dark malt, dried berries and nuts. Well balanced.

At the Kloster. The aroma is ripe fruit, bread. The appearance is deep red brown. The flavor is sweet, ripe fruit, bread, caramel. The finish is sweet, light hops. Medium, slightly thick in body. Nice representation of the style.

Arômes dépices : cannelle, girofle, gingembre.Caramel, céréales et houblons légèrement amérisants et poivrés.
Bouche ronde, corps solide, arrière goût alcoolisé sans trop : très bonne Doppelbock (une des meilleures).
Leicht bräunlich, gedörrte Früchte ich der Nase, relativ leichter Körper, schön süßlich ohne zu malzig zu sein, Top Doppel Bock

50cl pours a hazy copper with some creamy, beige head. Nose has plenty of raisin, stone fruit, plum, mild booze, clove. Flavor follows, stone fruit, raisin, plum, some booze, dark fruit, mild rum. Medium bodied, boozy finish.
Sweet grain nose. Clear ruby brown, thick yellow head with little retention. Cane sugar, grain and wood. Somewhat cloying, even for the style. Full body, soft carbonation.

Pours chestnut brown with red and orange highlights and a firm tan head.
Aroma is sweet malt, brown bread with nuts and caramel. That continues on the palate with hints of raisins and perhaps a whisper of cocoa. But the range doesnt develop much.
Whats more notable is the smoothness. Even if the body is a touch heavier than medium, it suggests leisurely consumption rather than weightiness. The alcohol is firmly controlled.
Nut and caramel aroma. Rich mahogany brown body with an off white head. Raisin-like sweetness with hints of caramel and malt. almost no bitterness. Finish is clean and wet. Incredible.
Rather heavy doppelbock which reminded me a lot of Belgian Dubel beers. It has a strong aroma of nuts and caramel with an aftertaste of dark chocolate.
Perfect colour with nice foam. Tastes very nice with almost no bitterness. For me one of my new favourites.
Chestnut brown color with reddish hues. Aroma of caramel, toffee, bread, and tropical fruit. Caramel and toffee sweet flavor with bread, tropical fruit, and spice Very nice beer.
Chestnut brown with full bodied foam. Spices - cinnamon, liquorice, malt, bread, caramel, almonds, dried figs.
Bottle. Hazy medium amber brown with a pillowy beige head. Terrific doughy brown bread and caramel profile, bran buds, light hop kiss, yeasty undertones. I love this style, and this one is superb.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Pleasantly surprised to find this on tap in the US, in Jenkintown of all places. This is only the second perfect score Ive given to a beer ever, and that is saying a lot because I tend not to like Doppelbocks as much as many styles. This was an amazing beer. Its also very aptly described. It has a velvety smoothness, and the aroma is beautiful and evolving. Malty, with notes of cocoa, caramel, dried fruit (date or fig?) Enjoyable to the last drop.

Flaska från Systembolaget. Coca cola-färgad, klar vätska, lågt beige skum. Smak av koncentrerat mörkt bröd, brödkryddor, farinsocker, väl integrerade smaker, sött men också väldigt fylligt med stora smaker, lätt beska balanserar också lite. Riktigt bra klassisk dubbelbock.

Ocre foncée, translucide. Bonne mousse beige qui persiste. Belle bière.
Au nez grosse complexité de maltage, toastage sucré caramel, fruitée (rouges-noirs), alcool présent et très bien intégré.
En bouche toastage chocolat, fruitée, alcool. Fin sèche.
Très bonne bière, à relever la complexité du maltage.
Hyvin makean maltainen tuoksu. Maku alkaa hyvin makeana ja maltaisena. Ei niin syvän musta kuin doppelbockit yleensä ovat.

500 ml bottle. Pours a red/orange tinted amber color with a huge frothy light tan head. You get caramel, plums, and cherries on the nose. The flavor is this hop bitterness upfront that gets washed away by lovely caramel sweet malts. Then comes the fig and plum flavors. Theres a little roasted smoke as it finishes. Its carbonated and creamy on the palate that finishes semi-dry with a lingering sweetness. What a delicious doppelbock.

0.5l bottle. Clear ruby body, light brown head. Aroma of caramel, cocoa, figs and cloves. Taste of caramel, figs, grains, floral hops and cherry. Although its fruitier than an average doppelbock, I think its very good.

The Germans sure make fine beer. No exception here. Dark with a tan head. The aroma is malty sweetness, caramel, fruit. The flavor follows with the caramel and fruit. Some molasses comes through. Complex and changing as it warms.

0,5 l, flaske, 7,1 % ABV, BB 15/04/15, købt i Tyskland af laboko - tak! - 5. februar 2015.
Kastanjebrun, rolig og klar/filtreret Dobbeltbock med 3-4 cm tyk offwhite-farvet skumtop, som efter en halv snes minutter svinder til lille kant og overflade. Ganske smukt skum.
Syrlig og sødlig aroma af rosiner. Desuden karamelmalt-noter, men overordnet ikke meget fyldig og gennemtrængende aroma.
Dejlig smag af ristede malt-noter. Masser af god balance mellem sødme og bitterhed og dejlig "varm" eftersmag. Let til medium sødme og medium bitterhed. Zero surt eller salt. Bittersød eftersmag af medium varighed.
Vel karboneret på et niveau under medium med en olieret konsistens. Kroppen er mellem fyldig.
Solid, let drikkelig og gedigen Dobbeltbock, man kan drikke en masse af.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2015 Thanks to tderoeck for the bottle! This one has been aged about 2.5 years or so, it may be slightly different. 

Poured into a taster glass showing a slight head, appearance is practically the same as a light bodied red wine but dark caramel in color. 

The nose shows light chestnuts and a slight herbal medicinal aroma. 

The palate was very lightly carbonated, light-medium body, with some round sweet malts. The only way to describe the malts were that they were somewhat "mature". Difficult to imagine but less eager to please than a young beer and took its time to warm up on the palate.

Bottle at Tre Små Rum,Gothenburg.Thanks Rick. Dark redish almost brown beer with a brown head. Malty, caramell and floral aroma. Sweet malty and hoppy flavour with some fruity notes. Roasted. Nice :-)
500ml bottle at Bierhof Athens. Amber copper color with light beige head. Aroma is malty caramel, dark fruity, dusty yeasty. Sweet and bitter taste. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.

50cl bottle. Pours reddish brown with a beautiful creamy beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, caramel, light dark fruits, light alcohol. Taste is similar with burnt sugar notes, caramel, roastiness, some coffee, light sticky cola sweetness well balanced by a good final bitterness. Oily mouthfeel, medium body, low carbonation.

Marrom claro com nuances de rubi. Boa formação mas pouca estabilidade de espuma. Aroma evidente de toffee, biscoito, pão preto, tosta. Sabor condizente com os aromas. Corpo médio-baixo, amargor leve. Carbonatação leve. Aftertaste doce, levemente aquecedor.

Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av humle, rostad malt, karamell, plommon, nötter, brunt socker, russin med toner av kakao och choklad. Mycket sötma, stor kropp med tydlig beska. Rund och len med fina smakar.

Ripe plums and caramel in the nose. Appearance is clear, brownish, with red highlights, not much to the head and nothing getting left behind on the glass. Palate is delicate, a touch sticky, balanced by a certain sourness, a very nice palate. Taste is like plum juice from the my Grandmothers canned plums, quite a bit of tartness in the finish. Pretty darn good. Thanks Ron for coming up with this one for me, Ive looked for it for years.

Bottle from The Beerhive. Ruby body with a thin off-white that quickly fades. Low carbonation. No lacing. Aroma of black cherry, toffee and prune. The flavour of treacle dominates subtle notes of cherry, candy and rye bread. Medium body with a sleek, oily mouthfeel. Light fizz. A lovely, moreish beer - a real winter warmer.
Wow, very surprised. Aroma of dried fruit and sweetness, taste is dried fruit, velvety in mouth feel, finishes clean and very well. Anyone interested, this a beer worth trying!

0,5l bottle. Pours dark ruby colour with a nice brown head.Sweet aroma. The taste is caramel, plums and a pleasant touch of alcahol.This is a wellbalanced and smooth beer. Has a nice bitter taste in the end. One of my favorite beers.
Beer tasting @ Jorn69, 6/12-14. Bottle from Bordershop, Puttgarden. Aroma: Extremely malty. Taste: Malty, caramely, sweet. Malty and sweet finish.
Really not much more I can say . . . solid. Very, very strong malt flavor. Like burnt toast in a good way. Recommended.
Medium mokka head dark black with a red glow, fruity malts maggi like herb maple syrup smell, medium carbonation low bitter some chocolat and coffee malts a bit low on body low bitter taste
Very full flavored tasteful beer. Full with malts and caramel. Very treacly and delicious. Sweet en mild juicy finish. Very nice.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2015 Bottle at Biertstube. December 2014. Clear dark red brown with just a slight white ring. Dark caramel and nuts. Big on hazelnuts/filberts. Also chestnuts. Dark candied sugar. Fainter notes of apricot and golden raisins. Certainly much nuttier than expected. Less dark, but fuller than your typical Doppelbock. Very distinctive! UPDATE: April 2015. Now having on draft for the first time (at Bierstube again). Clear dark caramel brown pour. Slight, but dense, foam on top. Looks and tastes not dissimilar to the bottle but feels juicier. Fuller raisin flavors. Nuttier notes are less pronounced. Hints of aged blood orange. Very nice dark caramel flavors without being particularly sweet at all. Interesting how the expected dark wheat notes with the style are still vaguely present but do not define the beer at all. Very well constructed!

I love that liquid syrupy toasted malt note in my nose, light roasted character, caramel, somewhat interesting dried fruit character, nuts. Yes, it is so sweet that my lips are sticking together, but with that great balance I cant say that its a bad thing
A rich dunkel beer, but it is overly sweet in my opinion. It has that beet sugar kind of sweetness. Alcohol presence is not assertive, so that aspect is well made.

Location/Date:Bottle in December 2014 from Dave.
Appearance: Pours dark brown red. 
Aroma: Aroma of caramel, dried fruit.
Taste: Light bitter, caramel, dried fruit, faint roast.
Palate:Medium light.
Summary: Germans just know how to make these.
Dark with a deep red hue. Earthy aroma, including some roasted malts, caramel and cherries. Sweet with some warming from the alcohol. A sipping brew

Poured from bottle into a pint glass
 Appearance  The beer pours a ruby brown color and has a huge cream colored head of bubbly foam. The head holds on with a pretty good retention, slowly fading over time to leave a decent level of foamy lace on the sides of the glass. 
 Smell  The aroma of the beer is very sweet smelling with tons of dark fruit and caramel aromas, with the dark fruit being mainly of a plum and raisin nature. Along with these smells comes some other aromas of a molasses and a light wheaty smell.
 Taste  The taste begins with a thick sweet and toasted bready taste with the sweet being mainly of molasses and caramel with a little bit of a dark fruit tastes of plum and raisin mixed within. These flavors create a base for the brew and are all there throughout, although with some gaining strength and some losing strength as the taste advances. The darker fruits get a bit stronger at the expense of the caramel all while a little bit more roast and dark chocolate comes to the tongue. A hint of wheat and some light earthy hop come to the tongue at the very end, leaving one with a very sweet but flavorful and enjoyable flavor to linger on the tongue.
 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the thicker and creamier side with a carbonation level that is on the lower side. For the big and robust sweet and malty flavors of the brew the feel is very nice and creates a nice slower sipping brew.
 Overall  A very nice doppelbock being a little more roasted and chocolate and less fruity then others. While not the best out there, it is very good overall and is certainly one to try if you get the chance.
Bottle. Aroma soft toffee, milk chocolate. Clear dark ruby-brown colour. Taste is sweet, sugary, candyish, dried fruit, caramel. Sticky mouthfeel. Quite good.
Bottle. Pours brown color, beige head. Aroma of coffee, malty, alcohol. Taste is sweet, caramel, malt, roasted, coffee.
@ Beer tasting, Havregatan 141206. Really malty and sweet with light caramely notes, medium to full body. The finish is dry and malty. Too malty in my opinion.

Strong aroma, German malts take the main stage with chocolate and light bitterness. Dark mahogany medium bodied looks at home in a Berliner Kindl goblet. Picked up a 500 ml bottle at Whole Foods for four bucks and change.
Aroma of sweet malt, dried fruit and a trace of vinegar. Dark brown with a lasting small tan head. Sweet malt taste with a mild floral finish. Full bodied with a sweet finish.

Poured from a bottle. Medium brown color, short lived medium off white head. Sweet malt with hint vinegar. Full body with a full flavor of syrup and malt with a full lingering finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A fantastic malty brew, worthy of its praise. Smells of dough and raisins. Taste is similar. A touch sweeter and more alcoholic than some, but also ridiculously smooth and with a better flavor. Very well done.

Bottle from supermarket. Deep ruby red, clear with beige head that disappears quickly. Strong aroma of roasted malts, some dark fruits and nuts. Taste equally malt dominated, some malt sweetness. Lingering roasted aftertaste. Hop character only in the background bitterness. A beer with plenty of character.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2015 50 cl. Pours a moderate diert white head, dark brown to ruby but with still a bit clear colour. Smells brown sugar, light roastiness, cereals, dried fruits, cinammon spices. Tastes caramel, all malt, toffee, hints of cocoa; nice and right level of sweetness, minimal bitter notes, just some slight final roastiness. Medium body, sticky oily texture, good and balanced carbonation. Very drinkable, now I aslo see why it has also "dunkel in the name" (not as doppelbock as a celebrator), between the top doppelbock but not the best
Pretty one note, just malty, not much else.  Pours a nice deep red. Smells and tastes like malt liquor. Tasted at the BevMo Holiday Beer Fest.

Aroma: roasted dark malts, alcohol, light DMS.
Appearance: clear dark amber color, nice beige head.
Taste: low bitterness (herbs), roasted dark malts, roasted caramel, dried fruits, alcohol, coffee substitute, semisweet, some weak honey notes.
Palate: full / medium body and low carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Dopplebock with the clear profile. Can be viewed as an icon in this style.

Sehr schmackhaft mit großem Charakter. Am Ende sehr malzbetont, fast schon wie geröstet. Großes Bier!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 mL bottle supplied by WillRunForBeer - many thanks! To oversized snifter, it pours a an bourbon/oak amber with which an off-white ringed 1 finger in length stood. Aromas of pumpernickel, sorghum molasses, cherry blossom honey, basement smells/dust, dried cranberries, DME, aged cheddar, Munich malt, and traditional Bock yeast. Tastes the same with the addition of tree bark, sweat, pine needles, and sweet malt. Awesome. Alcohol crept soothingly.
Bottle shared at my place. Pours bright mahogany with a ring of white head. Aroma is brown bread, banana, wet dog. Taste is brown bread, molasses, banana, mild clove spice in the finish,

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2015 500ml bottle. Filtered ruby burgundy body. Thick caramel looking translucent body. Foamy, respectable off-white head. Malty, rich...but not at all overbearing at 7.1%. Really sublime. Bready caramel, chocolate tones. It is what it is; a DUNKEL Doppelbock, so you get more chocolate tones, less deep red fruit. A touch syrupy in the finish, not so much depth. Overall a pretty enjoyable beer.  I liked it better the second time, really sublime mouthfeel.
Pours flat. Aroma very similar to Newcastle. Flavor is outstanding but palate would be better with more carbonation.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 500ml bottle served in my huge Weihenstephan Weizen glass.
A: Pours a beautiful deep dark amber colour forming a big bubbled and beige head. Good retention but not much lacings left
S: Quite sweet and toffee in the nose and a little bit smoky too. Notes of caramel malts, grapes, brown bread and Lager yeasts
T: Follows the nose, a quite sweet, toffee and molasses upfront. Roasted and caramel malts. Notes of coffee. Brown bread and raisins with a great stingy hoppy bitterness in the end, delicious...
M: Medium body. Quite molasses. Medium carbonation. Very well balanced bittersweet aftertaste
O: High drinkability. One of the best German beers, for sure. Very rich on smell and tte. Not recommended, but mandatory
[ BA Review @ 12/23/2009 ]

Couleur brune au reflets ambrés, mousse qui disparait. Nez caramel et fruits noirs. Bon gout de caramel, fruits noirs, vieux fruits, note grillée. Corps sans carbonation, mais pas trop liquoreux, juste bon. Fin assez rapide sucrée et grillée.

On tap. Served a dark brownish color with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, bit of toffee and dark fruit in the background. Taste of roasted malt, nice caramel sweetness, dark fruit and bit of grain. Nice bitterness and a fairly dry finish. Medium body, smooth, quite creamy and very well balanced. An enjoyable beer that has a nice robust feel to it.

Flasche aus einem Kaisers in Berlin. - Tiefdunkles Kastanienbraun, kurzlebiger beigefarbener Schaum. - In der Nase rosinenartige Süße, kalter Kaffee, deutlicher Alkohol und etwas Nadelwald. - Im Antrunk zunächst eher zurückhaltendes Röstmalz; vor allem aber eine sirupartige dunkelmalzige Süße, die an Rübenkraut erinnert. Rosinen, gesüßter kalter Kaffee, ein Anflug von Trockenpflaumen, ein Spritzer fruchtig-herbe Säure. Mild rezent, beinahe schal; vollmundig aber nicht schwer. Im Abgang immer noch karamelsüß, etwas matt und nur mild bitter, obwohl bei genauerem Hinschmecken krautige Hopfenaromen zu entdecken sind. Schwach holzig-herber Nachtrunk. - Anfangs wie kalter gezuckerter Kaffee, später durch milde holzige Herbe aufgelockert. Gar nicht schlecht. Die fruchtige Herbe, die etwa ein Stout oder ein belgisches Starkbier zu bieten haben, kann man natürlich von einem untergärigen Bier nicht verlangen ...

lots of caramel and subtle roasted malts, taste is very sweet but also tough and bitter... nice fizy carbs and a big caramel burnt sugar bitter finish... very drinkable, but a bit simple? 
todo: drink warmer!
Pours a deep caramel brown with an off white head. Malt, toffee, caramel, toast and earthy aroma and flavors. Medium full body and average carbonation. Toast, toffee and malt finish.
Not bad, maybe i expected more from it, depending on my friends fairytales. I dont think i will buy it again.

Bottle at home. Pours a clear, deep reddish brown colour with a medium, beige, creamy head. Malty aroma of nuts, rye bread, cooked vegetables, wood and some leather and chocolate. Sweet flavour with more chocolate, wood, dried fruit and leather. Has a slick and silky mouth feel, and a light bitterness. A malty beer, balanced but Im a bit disappointed.
Bottle 50cl. Dark brown color with a small white head. Aroma - caramel, chocolate, fruits and raisins.

Pours a nice ruby/brown color with a medium tan head. Aroma has nice dark and candied fruits. Flavor follows suit and adds layers of earthy hops and dry leaves...tasty. Mouthfeel is medium and the finish is dry and earthy / dark fruity.

Refrigerated 0.5 brown bottle poured into a glass. Clear dark amber with highlights of crimson and big beige head. Aroma is medium body, medium/light carbonation, and good small bubble lacing. Taste is malty, caramel, and some chocolate.
Sweet malt aroma with a copper color. Well balanced hops malt and carbonation. Easy to drink more than 0.5l

Clear dark brown color with red hue, medium sized off-white to maybe even tan head. Aroma of toffee, caramel, nuts, coffee, a bit boozy, Medium body, soft carbonation. Nice and creamy. Medium sweetness. Nice, but not spectacular. 
(Pivoljub 0,5l bottle)

0.5l bottle. Dark ruby color with quickly disappearing head. Aroma is toasted malt, dark fruits and caramel. Taste is rather sweet with some alcohol notes. Full body and average carbonation. Overall it?s nice and tasty beer.

Pint9 bottle shared. Poured a red mahogany color with off white head. Aroma is sweet malts, caramel, dark fruit. The flavo is incredible. Wett madly s, mild bitterness, dark fruits, caramel blended very well together. This is an incredible dopplebock. Thank you sir may I have another.

This one came out of left field when I was looking for a new German beer to try a few days ago...
