Definitely a dopplebock that Ill be revisiting often, as long as they keep it in stock at the SuperStore. Love looking for any subtle differences between the German "Rhineheitsgebot" limited-ingredients-used beers. I Also love anything malty and Scotch ale-esque, and this sure fits!

How: Bottle.
Where: RBESG 14 not so grand tasting.
Appearance: Dark brown colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Yeast, bread, nuts, dark fruit.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Bread, fruit, plum, a bit vinous, malt, some alcohol.

Bottle: Thanks, Jason. Deep, ruby-tinted, burnt caramel brown with a wispy tan collar that hangs around just a bit. Aroma of sweet caramel malt, cocoa dust, light toffee, faint nuttiness, & a good bit of toasty malt. On the palate, the caramel has a slight metallic twinge to it. Quite sweet, lots of rich maltiness, toffee, & a little bit of cocoa powder. A little stale, not sure how fresh this one is. Medium bodied. A really decent doppelbock, but it didnt blow me away.
Botella de 50 cl, en Cerveceria Internacional. Color marron oscuro. Sabor a malta, caramelo, cafe.
One of my favourites. Dark brown colour, medium white head. Aroma is coffee, coffee, a bit of caramel. Taste is sweet, with lots of bread and coffee/dark chocolate again. Medium carbonation.

Bottle 0,5l. Pours a satk brown color with a small white head. Nose is caramel, toffee, dark fruits and bread. Same for taste with a prominent alcohol taste. Low to medium carbonation, and medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazysh reddish brown color, average sized tan head. Aroma of caramel, roast, dark fruits. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Taste is medium sweet with notes of blackberry, caramel and raisins. Excellent.
hay, cereal, roasty, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish

A bit heavy on the candied sugar in the aroma, but otherwise a great well balanced Dopplebock. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl bottle at home. Dark amber brown with a medium slightly off-white soapy head. Medium body with light to moderate carbonation. Sweet with herbal bitterness. Malts, caramel, raisin, chocolate, some dark fruits, herbs and spices. A decent full flavoured doppelbock.

Aroma:cooked végatble,nutty and toffe...
Appearance:Clear ruby brown,light head..
Flavor:raisin,honey,light molasse....

Bottle at RBESG 14, day 4 not so grand tasting at Craft Clerko, 10/08/14.
Dark chestnut brown with moderate light beige edgeing.
Nose is dark toffee, nutty vibes, dark malts, caramel, brown bread, dark fruit notes.
Taste comprises earthy tones, brown bread, dark malt, trace cocoa, hint of booze.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent Bock.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Fin mørk rødbrun farge med et beige skum, skummet holdt bra. Deilig aroma av røstet malt, røde bær, karamell og treverk. Smaken følger aroma, men her får jeg toner av cherry og brunt sukker i tilegg.
GBBF 2014 on 13-Aug. Cask. Dark, with a small to medium sized cream copper coloured head which disappears quickly. Rich, malt taste. Caramel, dark chocolate and fruits. Nice double bock.
Nice ruby color sweet smelling and tasting of fruit and bread very smooth tasting with a nice finish.

Bottle. Pours a transparent mahogany brown, big off-white head with excellent retention and lacing. Nose is malt forward, caramel, dates, prunes, raisins, molasses. Mouth is medium bodied, light malty sweetness, caramel, toasted pumpernickel bread, raisins and dates. A somewhat thin finisher though. Otherwise very nice. Prost!
Cherry, nuts. Loads of bitter caramel dominating the character. Quite a tasty and smooth doppelbock.

Sparkly on the palate, or so I remember (I did not mark the palate in my notes). This beer has a taste of caramel-coffee with an aroma and a small, small taste of birdseed and new clothes, fresh from the department store. Upon consulting my notes I find that I have jotted down "sort-of roast / barley?" The question mark is because I have no idea what barley tastes like. I was unable to identify some of thw other tastes. Hay? I dont know. Best enjoyed with Moonrise Kingdom or in front of a fountain.

The beer is medium-dark brown with some reddish hue. The color of a dark, polished wood. It is quite clear with no haze evident. The head is medium to small and cream-colored. It builds up into a nice blanket with the first pour but most of that dies away after a minute leaving little lacing. The aroma is rich and malty. Lots of toasty malt, caramel, fruit and assorted other malt sweetness. Dark stone fruit, mild medicinal note, brown sugar, toasted bread, caramel, molasses, raisins. Mild background acidity. Just a bunch of big clean malt flavors. The taste starts off with light, bright malt sugar. Then, fruity notes pop in along with darker sweetness. Brown sugar, treacle, cherries, prunes, mint, maybe a hint of vanilla. Mild vegetal flavor. Little recognizable hop presence, just a touch of grassiness at the end. However, the beers sweetness does clean up well in the finish. Never gets cloying or boozy. Theres kind of a mild tannic quality to it, almost woody. Thick feel. Almost syrupy but its not sticky, just rich and full. Excellent doppelbock. An absolutely fantastic example of the style. Happy to have finally tried it.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2014 Drink cool (10°C)
Eye: Pours a reddish-brown colour with a beige to brown head. dissipates rapidly.
Nose: malts, caramel, chocolate and dark dried fruits. Spices as well.
Mouth: strong malts, caramel, chocolate, coffee and hazelnuts. dark dried fruits (prunes), dates, blackcurrant, cherry, licorice and coriander. 
Palate: wheat, bread (Pumpernickel), chocolate, banana, acacia honey, malts as well as hops.
Overall: very good, complex beer. slightly smoky but sweet at the same time. reminds me a bit of a special or christmas beer, more complex though.

0,5 l bottle. Dark amber color with a small brownish head. Aroma is clear roast/smoked and caramel. Taste is bitter at first, but the finish is sweet with some chocolate. Well balanced beer. Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2014 Pours dark brown with a copper hue and sports a beige head, which dissipates rather quickly. The aroma is brimming with toffeeish caramel maltiness, accompanied by notes of prunes, dark berries, honey, and savory soy sauce. The flavor begins with rich malty caramel and muted sweetness, which is then followed by blackcurrant and honey notes while a roasty-toasty dark bread crust note slowly builds up, forming a gently bitter finish. Andechs Doppelbock Dunkel carries its 7.1% ABV with impressive grace - the alcohol feels very gentle throughout. The body is silky and full. While the flavor overall is big, the subtleties are the key to making this beer really shine. Great stuff.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2014 Great Bavarian classic double bock, one of those celebrities in the genre. Yellowish, creamy, not too stable head, colour a dark copper brown, clear and translucent. Nose pretty strong, displaying a fine maltiness with impressions of chocolate, hazelnuts, bread, caramel, coffee beans, some hay. Taste softly malty, mellow, seamlessly evolving into a toasted bitterness, warm and mouth-filling, dark chocolate, and all in the end a subtle, flowery flash of hops. Alcohol well-hidden but still faintly noticeable in the tail.
(Backlog) Bottle at fantasy tasting at Pauls. Dark brine pour with tan head. Dark fruits, malts, brown sugar, and other sweet tones. Similar to a celebrator.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2016 Dark brown color with a small white head. Nose is caramel, toffee, dark fruits and bread, taste reflects the nose well. Low to medium carbonation, and full-bodied. Easily drinkable, although the alcohol is noticeable, it?s still well-managed. A great doppelbock!

Tap at the mountain. Great as always.

4 oz draft pour at ChurchKey. Dark brownish almost black with off-white head. Aromas of caramel, toffee, dark fruit, milk chocolate, plums. Tastes of cherries, dark fruit, plums, wheat bread, chocolate, spices. Light body with a dry finish. Medium carbonation.

Dark brown with medium small tan head. Aroma of sweet malts, dark fruits. Medium full body. Tiniest bit of alcohol. Sweet mostly. Molasses and dark breadj flavors. Some caramel and a bit of hop balance but remaining on the sweet side. Tasty.

Bottle thanks to WillRunForBeer for hunting this down for me. Shared at mrebeks. Clear dark copper pour with very little head. Aromas are butterscotch candy and toffee. Tastes like dark bread, butterscotch, caramel, and cola. Smooth finish, very easy to drink.
Brown pour, cream colored head. Chocolate, toasted bread, light honey, very malty and I detect the alcohol a bit in this one.

500 ml. Pours a clear dunkelish braun with a ruby tint and a lasting film of creamy bubbles. Nose is molasses, dark cherry, toasted peanut and earthy-spicy dry grass. Tastes of the same nice mix. Heavy body is smooth and somehow walks the tightrope to a delicately sweet balance just this side of cloying. I typically like low carbonation but my only quibble with this excellent brew is that it could probably use a tad more.

0.5L bottle. Pours a clear dark brown-black with a fluffy tan head that lingers. Really interesting aromas: Rich malt, soy sauce, cheese, molasses, smoke. Mildy sweet at the beginning, with notes of molasses and nice roasted malt. Sweetness lingers, but develops into a decent bitter roasted malt character, finishing with some alcohol warmth. Full body with a thick mouthfeel and minimal carbonation.Overall, a superlative doppelbock. Amazing complexity in the aromas and really nice flavors. One of the best Ive had.

In short: strong but drinkable boozy/malty beer.
Pours strong cloudy orange, with beige foam. Very liquory and drinkable at the same time, malty to cooked flavours, aroma too soft.
Arôme café au lait noisettes. Une mousse pas trop épaisse par rapport à d'autres bières allemandes.. Au goût elle n'est vraiment pas un air très douce on sent le café en bouche

Tap. Moderate roasted and caramel for the malt, light to moderate cooked orange for the hops and dough for the yeast, with hints of brown sugar, raisin, and faint spice. Head is large, fizzy/frothy, off-white with no lacing and is fully diminishing. Color is dark red brown. Flavor starts moderately sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes moderately sweet and lightly bitter. Palate is on the fuller side of medium, slick with a lively carbonation. A Doppelbock on the lighter side, but perfectly balanced and plenty complex.
Rust/cola color, no head. Nose is dark fruits, cola, chocolate, ash. Taste is dark fruits, bread, cola, a touch of cardboard. Medium bodied.
Rötlich-braunes Bier mit röstigen Aromen, etwas Honig und Weizen. Geschmacklich süßlich, schönes Malz, Honig, etwas Karamell. Sehr süffig mit guter Kohlensäure.

dark caramel brown color with a 1 finger creamy tan head..a delicious doppelbock...nose is laden with caramel..toffee with some molasses and plum..alcohol is hidden well..very smooth and has a lot of character..not overly malty or sweet like some offerings of this style..highly enjoyable..

Drunk from 50cl bottle bought in Bamberg. Pleasant dark bock beer.
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice reddish brown with fast disappearing off-white head. Roasted grains, nuts, chocolate, dried fruits, apple, cinnamon, light smoke and dry cocoa powder. Medium sweet and light bitter finish. Very nice!

Bona cervesa molt equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza muy equilibrada y sabrosa.
rich malty aroma. color is dark brown with a nice head. taste is rich malty and very slight roastyness. slight hop finish.

On tap at Church Key. Pours a rich clear translucent brown with thin wisp of bubbles that quickly fades, leaving no lacing. Hues of deep crimson when backlit. Aroma is mild with notes of bread and yeast. Flavor is fantastic: classic doppelbock, but better than anything Ive had previously. Rich, malty, and alcohol completely masked, this beer is similar to Belgian strong ales in complexity. Delicious.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Smell of chocolate, licorice, plum, dark caramel. Taste of dark caramel, slightly burnt, licorice, raisin and rye. Very bready and easygoing but medium to full mouthfeel, very softly roasted with quite black.

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours dark ruddy amber with a beige head. Aroma is suggesting chocolate rye, but thats not it. Full bodied or nearly. Flavor is sort of rye treacle. Flavor is really nice. Finishes far away from dry.

Bottle from Beer Revolution . Pours ruby brown with an attractive beige head and an aroma halfway between chocolate and rye. There is a slid treacle flavor that is a bit fruity with a hint of chocolate. Very tasty.
Pours dark amber/red, head is slightly tanned. Aroma is malty with bread. Taste is dominated by malt. Very nice bock.

[Tap] Pours a very dark amber color with a large amount of dense beige colored head. Aromas of bakers chocolate, bready malts and sweet toffee. Flavors of toffee and caramel abound. Cocoa, toasted grains, sweet breads, mild dark fruits also linger in the finish. Really nicely balanced.

Coppery-brown crystalline color. Powerful aroma, with a big fruity inclination of plums and raisins. 

Raisins are predominant in the taste, and also some nuts, and some roasted chocalate notes.
50cl bottle. Brown to dark Collor. Médium body. Los sweetness. Aroma is chocolate, mal and roasted.

Bottle. Dark clear ruby with medium off white head. Aroma is mostly dark fruit, specifically grape/raisin. Taste adds some chocolate, roasted malt and light bread crust note. Medium sticky mouthfeel and light carbonation. Very tasty.

Poured with a small creamy head. Smell is stronger than the taste: raisin, slight syrup, banana, spice and fig. A heavy Weiss beer almost bock style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Serving: from bottle--purchased at Allendörfer 

Aroma: light caramel malt.

Appearance: average-sized, frothy, off-white initial head with no lacing and fully diminishing longevity. Clear, dark-orange/light-brown body.

Taste: heavily sweet, burned caramel malt and date-like initial flavor and finish with average duration.

Palate: medium-to-full body, syrupy texture and soft carbonation.

Overall: this is probably an excellent doppelbock, but this style of beer is too sweet for my taste.

Bottle thanks to a trade! Pours a clear amber brown with a tan head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has notes of raisin and light chocolate with a dark bread and dark grain backbone. Flavor has a nice cocoa note with some dark grains and a hint of toffee underlying.

Bottle (500 ml). Dark brown with reddish reflects, medium diminishing beige head and little lacing. Aroma is of caramel, breadied malt, light roasted notes, berries, some smoke and raisins. Taste is moderately sweet with caramel, breadied malt, berries, smoked notes, roasted malt, raisins and a light alcohol warming finish. Medium to full body. Moderate carbonation. Superb balance. Theres a ton of malt/caramel in there, but its still drinkable. Thats impressive. Quite tasty.
At Suppenkusche. Mahogany with reddish head. Caramel malt nose. Not over the top, deceiving, but rich and flavorful. A nice sampler treat. Mellow and well appreciated.

Bottle from Beers of Europe [280414]
Dark ruby caramel brown, clear, light tan head that dissipates away
Aroma of soft sweet brown malts, some raisin, mellow fruits, no hops, soft toffee, all malts
Taste of caramel, touch of toffee, raisin malts, smooth fruity caramel, dab of soft toasted malts, slight chocolate, its all malts 
Palate - soft carb, medium body, sweet. Finish of soft lingering sweet fruity caramel and soft raisin malts, some warming alcohol.
Overall - Came across as a bit simple, mainly malts. A reasonably good beer but not fantastic
Bottle. Darkest amber body with not very long lasting white head. Aroma is roasted malts some alcohol. Taste is roasted malts with caramel. Aftertaste is slightly bitter with some sourness?

50cl bottle pours a clear dark ruby brown with lasting off-white head and good lacing. Aroma is full of caramel, lightly roasted malts and dark fruits, with touches of coffee and bread. Taste is sweet until a hint of bitterness and alcohol warmth in the finish. Body is full with a creamy mouthfeel and slight carbonation. This is the first beer in a long time which made me say WOW. Ill reward myself with another one of these any time I feel like I need to celebrate another good week.

Bottle, 0.50l. Clear ruby brown color with large creamy light brown head, fair lacing and sparkling appearance. Aroma of caramel and light roasted malt, wheat, banana and hints of dried fruits. Taste starts with heavy sweet caramel and spicy malt, follows by grainy sourness with warming mouthfeel and moderate bitter finish. Full body, syrupy texture and average carbonation in palate. As expected, rich and almost perfect brew...

Draught. Pours a clear brown color with some slight red to it, and a very large off-white head. Nose is quite bready, with some slight caramel notes to it. Taste is pretty sweet with a fair amount of caramel. Not a huge fan.

500ml bottle from Gourmondo.de, clear dark reddish brown colour, large frothy off-white head, decent lacing. Heavily malty aroma of plums, nuts and a bit of chocolate, moderate herbal and resiny hops. Taste is initially modreately sweet, slightly bitter and acidic, turning into a long light bitter and roasty finish with a moderately alcoholic and acetic feel.Full body, creamy texture, lively carbonation. Certainly one of the better doppelbocks Ive tried though not an aficionado of the style.

Bottle from Berrmerchants.com Colour is cherrywood brown, medium to large off white head. Nose is nutty, earthy, caramel, boiled sweet, slight mahogany wood, Autumn leaves. Its like a strong English bitter. Taste is caramel, nutty, woody, earthy hops, roasted/toasty malt. Its got a very nutty, earthy, mahogany wood tang which is not really my thing.

Bottle in Frankfurt. It pours clear mahogany brown with a thick light tan head. The nose is caramel, toast, raisin, sultana, dried cherry, wood and vinous notes. The taste is toasty, earth, wood, leather, cocoa, plenty of dried fruits, light spice and decent bitterness with a dry, woody finish. Medium+ body and moderate carbonation. Well rounded and pretty flavoursome. A great doppelbock.

Very nice and strong flavored dopplebock, caramel, chocolaty taste, defiantly a beer to try and drink more than once

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Truly a great doppelbock with excellent sweet malty character the shows layers of complexity between caramel candy, sweet chocolate, bitter chocolate, hints of fruit. Great stuff.
Bottle post office vaults Birmingham. Dark brown ruby colour decent tan head. Aroma is fruity malty. Taste is similar dark fruits nice strong malt backbone. Nice body mouthfeel. Great stuff
Dont really know a great deal about the style. An enjoyable ale, sweet, vinuous. Tastes the 7.1% ABV but very drinkable.

500 ml bottle. Not totally sure why I bought this, but Im glad I did. Pours clear, dark brown with ruby hues and off white, fine-bubbled head. Beautiful, lush malty aroma: dark fruit, plums, rich dark molasses, even some cocoa. Taste: moderately sweet with a surprisingly dry, roast finish. Love the complexity here. Palate: full body, velvety texture, light carbonation. Overall: its telling that Im always surprised by how flavorful and multi-faceted these malt-focused classics can be. Its definitely something I dont seek out or find much when following my usual tendencies, and that is to my detriment.
Dark brown pour, with an off white head, sweet taste of malt and caramel with a light hop finish, good Doppelbock.
Pours dark brown with beige head. Very nice, malty aroma. Taste a bit flat. Lightish beer, almost delicate. Definately not the strongest in its class.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, süß, fruchtig, Karamell. Geschmack röstmalzig, stark fruchtig süß, Karamell, schokoladig, leicht alkoholisch.
Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma of roasted malt with caramel in the background. Taste of fruit and malt. Full, soft and well in balance.
A very smooth beer with malty aroma and taste. I would definitely recommend this, and I think it would go well with food.

A reddish brown beer with a medium and beige head. The nose of dark malts, bread and some sweetness. Taste is strongly bready, some sour bread, hint of roastiness, also herbal like bitterness in the end. Medium bodied, quite smooth to drink. Simple, bready and good quality beer.

En botella de 500 cc. Color Ambar o cobre profundo. Color cognac, diria. Espuma beige claro, densa, con persitencia normal. Malta muy compleja en boca y en nariz. Deliciosa riqueza de la malta, corteza de pan, notas de caramelo. Por lo demás limpia y pura. Cuerpo lleno, carbonatación alta, en conjunto una fiesta para el paladar. Redonda, limpia, intensa, potente. World class Beer

Very good Doppelbock!!! :)
I need to taste this in other conditions.........

Bottle, 03/23/2014. Pours deep chestnut brown, ruby highlights, creamy light tan head fades over a few minutes, thin ring of lacing left. Aroma is rich nutty caramel, medium roasted malts with touch of chocolate, slightly fruity. complex finish with hints of spices, hazelnut, vanilla, Taste is toffee with lager yeast fruitiness, grassy hops adding some bitterness in the middle, round chocolate coming through the end, lingering. Medium body, well balanced and easy to drink. Happy to see this distributed in the states now, great doppelbock.

I see that this doppelbock dunkel is very well rated, however it wasnt really to my taste. Perhaps I was expecting something different and was thrown off in the end. It was a strong beer poured from 500ml bottle. It had very high carbonation, roasty charcoal taste with strong bitterness that persisted in aftertaste. Thin head lasted very little (less than 1min.). I might (perhaps) try it again some other time, but not sure.
From battle. Dark red brown. Some corn on the nose. Roasted malts. Chocolate notes. Bitter upfront, but sweet as it lingers. Creamy.

This is a really nice doppel and very much deserving of being one of the top rated beers of its style on this site. I pours a garnet brown color w/ an initially thick head that wanes to a slim ring of fine bubbles. The nose on this is initially swartzbier-ish w/ a hefty dose of roasted grain. Once tasted, raisin and caramel aspects become more apparent along w/ a touch of herbal hops. This is a rather dry brew which is really nice as it allows the malts to shine w/o becoming cloying. There is a bit of sweetness apparent but that is as much due to low hopping as anything. It finishes w/ a lingering caramel note and a prickle of carbonation across the tongue.

Ar: Grassy, sticky sweet malt - a bit grassy, slight herbal note.
Ap: Clear deep chestnut brown - large light tan head with moderate retention - leaves a ring of foam, some sticky lacing, and a thin, almost-complete film.
T: Deep toasted malt, sweet - clean malt, toffee, and bread crust - grassy - low bitterness - very slight warming alcohol.
P: Medium-full body with medium-high carbonation - finish is medium.
O: Nice doppelbock - good depth of malt flavor, clean flavors, rich.
500 mml tasted on 11/03/2014. Caramel brown colour with one finger head. Sweet caramel and cola taste. Next one please!

500ml bottle @ the 2nd Shrewsbury Bottle Share, courtesy of me, bought at Berlin Bier Shop. Pours a chestnut brown, sweet & sticky with prominent dried fruits. Didnt really get into this to be honest, despite this being one of Blackhaddocks all time favourites!

Paid $3.49 for a 16.9 oz. bottle @ Carls Meat Market, Kittery. I was REALLY excited to see this because until recently, it was not available in the U.S. What a great price! Dark cloudy amber color with light retention that shows spider web lace in a dimpled mug. Nose of tons of bready malt. Hints of dark fruit, (prunes and raisins) 
 Flavor is sweet lightly toasted malts, nuttiness, somewhat grainy caramels with a touch of chocolate, a good amount of dried fruits, and a light bitterness from a European hop variety. Light earthy hop. The hop notes is needed to balance the sweetness. The other notable flavor is the amount of yeast. Almost has a Belgian yeast essence to it. Thick body with a bold flavor. Light creamy mouthfeel from the carbonation. 
Im really happy to have finally have tried this. Maybe one day I will travel to Germany. But until then Im glad I can now find this here in the U.S. Beautiful brew.
On draft. Dark brown color with one finger head. Sweet taste. A really good beer.

Poured into stein from 500ml bottle. A reddy brown with off white head. Mild carbonation. Aroma is malty with caramel and raisins. Taste is roasted malt, caramel, dark fruits. Interesting and complex. Slightly bitter in the finish. Maybe even a bit bit nutty. Mouthfeel is dry and warming. Sweet and alcoholic but in not way over bearing. Fantastic.
Bottle from the Dram Shop, Sheffield. Ruby with a tan head. Quite sweet and malty. Notes of red fruit, caramel, raisin and some fairly evident alcohol. Very nice.

Draught at Bronwyn, November 2013Probably the last thing I was expecting to see at this (then) new German restaurant in Union Square. A little background. This beer was never distributed in the U.S. until very recently and back in the day (talking 2004-2007 era), there were no German traders on the site, so it was very difficult to have this without traveling there. And wow was it rated highly by just about everyone.So long story short, here I am 8 years later and finally get to try this much sought after beer.Deep ruby-mahogany liquid is clear with a small but fairly well-retained layer of light beige foam atop it.Prunes, raisins, red wine, touches of bananas, lightly salted caramel, vanilla...I could probably go on for a while here. Sweet, but not cloyingly so, a touch sour but simply from the reserved melanoidins and ever-so vinous and dry on the finish. Eminently sniffable with a good strength to it. No flaws or alcohol.Flavor is...good lord, this is why this stuff was so highly regarded! Aside from the perfect maltiness, rich but well-attenuated, very nice depth (plums, wine, caramel, vanilla, etc...) and kiss of hop spiciness, there is something so endearing and unique about their yeast character. Difficult to describe, but my best attempt is think of a Westy 8 blended with, say, Celebrator. Its certainly got black pepper phenols, plum and red currant-like fruitiness and even a touch of very light banana ester. Soft mouthfeel with light but ample carbonation. No flaws noted. Love the abv too. Pretty close to perfect.
500 ml bottle. Pours clear dark red-brown with a brownish head. Roasty, sweet malt aroma and taste. Slightly bitter palate. Not sweet enough for my taste.
Clear, caramel-browm colour. High brown head. Great sweet and roasty aroma with notes of chocolate,.caramel and coffee. Wonderful oaky taste and a lasting roasty palate. One of the best Dunkelbocks.

Wonderful doppelbock. Rich malty full bodied beer. Alcohol warmth and sweetness but doesnt overpower. Aroma is of mild molasses like notes. Color is a deep mahogany. Flavor is complex with Brown bread, lingering alcohol sweetness and slight hop bitterness just to balance and keep it from cloying. Body is medium full. Finish is moderately dry. Lingering hop and alcohol persist in the finish.

500 ml bottle. Pours a brilliant dark amber , copper color with a large rocky beige head. Big caramel malt aroma has notes of toasted nuts and a light metallic tinge. Rich sweet roasted malt flavor has lots of sweet caramel and milk chocolate nuance. Full bodied and complex, with a big sticky mouthfeel. Finishes slightly bittersweet and chewy. Outstanding.
Maravilha de cerveja completa saborosa encorpada forte. Da abadia na Alemanha. Ótima!

Bottle. Amber, hazy, small to average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate malty and sweetish aroma, some caramel and light roasted malt, light dark fruits/vinous notes, faint alcohol. Body is medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, some caramel, light dark fruits, light sourness and faint alcohol. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, light caramel and light fruitiness with light sourness, light alcohol. Doppelbockwith light sourness in the flavor/finish - bad bottle? Nice aroma tough.

Bottle 500 ml at home, thanks to McTapps! Into a snifter, ABV 7.1%
Clear body, deep mahogany brown colour on it, with a decent sized tan head. Average retention. Light lacing left on the glass and foam islands on the surface.
Aroma of chocolate, caramel.
Taste of toasted malts, milky chocolate, light caramel, .great! A touch of bitterness on the aftertaste.
Full body, nice carbonation, little sticky on the palate.
Very good doppelbock.

Vierte un color marrón oscuro con bonita cabeza de espuma beige que perdura en el vaso; en nariz despliegue de aromas a malta tostada, caramelo, ciruelas pasas y dátiles, en boca entrada potente con presencia de notas a malta y amargor comedido, luego vuelven a aparecer notas a caramelo y azúcar moreno; es dulce pero no empalaga ya que contrasta con el amargor del lúpulo obteniendo una cerveza compleja y excelente de cuerpo y carbonatación medio con pos gusto maltoso.
Bottle 500 ml at Aufsturz in Berlin. Pours dark brown with slightly brown head. Sweet malty aroma. Sweet malty bready taste with some caramel. Medium to full body.
Dark red-brown, with a light brown, firm head. Strong dark malt aroma and coffee. Medium carbonation,medium bitter taste. Quite sweet but developing a medium bitterness leading to medium long finish.

Looks lovely. Crystal clear ruby brown off white head. Liquorice , coffee, chocolate aroma. Strong liquorice after taste. Mellows with every sip. Lovely beer complex. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tasting at lpk by carsten berthelsen. 
Sweet nose, caramel. 
Clear light brown color, offwhite head. 
Medium body, sweet, sugar, lacrics. 


:)
Bolton Brew.
Mild aroma, sød malt, brød. Krydret sirup og alkohol, som kommer frem senere. Lidt bitterhed i eftersmag. Harmonisk.
Bière brune cuivrée très limpide, peu de mousse. Odeur de caramel, tourbe, fumée. Goût très maltée et sucrée, légèrement tourbé. Bien.

Dark red-brown, with a light brown, firm head. Strong dark malt aroma, coffee and roasted dark bread crust. Medium carbonation, full malt and oasted coffee taste. Quite sweet but developing a medium bitterness leading to medium long finish. A really strong, typical Bavarian Doppelbock.
Dark red with nice head. Malt thick muscky raisins in the aroma. Sweet malt burned caramel hay molasis mild thick aftertaste.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Dark brown beer with a medium head. and a touch of lacing. Aroma of toffee, malts and caramel. Taste is dark malts, toffee, caramel and some hops. Decent enough but I was hoping for more, Overated?
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Shared a 33cl bottle from Maruhn (Darmstadt). Pours a reddish dark brown colour with a small off-white head. Aroma is malt, raisins and nuts. Average carbonation and full creamy body, Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with some sour notes. Overall, a good beer.
UPDATED: JUN 24, 2015 Bottle. Pour is dark with a thin head, aroma is toffee, malty, sweet. Taste is malty, sweet, caramel. Very nice

Rich, raisiny, leathery, sweet aroma. Dark, ruby brown. Stiff tan head. Europint bottle, decent bronze label. Figgy/raisin/molasses flavor up front, malty, fairly sweet. Study body, tangy-bitter finish. I wouldnt call this incredibly complex, but its pretty well done. Market Square Liquors, Timberlane.

Schöner, dunkler malziger Geruch. Der Antrunk ist vollmundig, schön mild-malzig. Der Hauptteil wird etwas süßer, fast schon zu süß. Aber sehr rund und wunderbar malzig. Leichte Röstmalztöne in Richtung des Nachgeschmacks. Dieser ist sehr lang, schön malzig-röstmalzig-süß. Ganz leicht wärmend-alkoholisch, aber sehr angenehm!  --> Fast schon zu süß, aber sehr rund, malzig und angenehm! Ein spitzen-Doppelbock!!


Test vom 29.10.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,14,12,13,12,14 - 13,25

Lovely reddish brown warmth emanates from the glass, with a moderate off white head; aroma is sweet, malty, stewed fruit - lovely; toasted bready malt and mellow burnished fruit - raisins, jam; more of the same alongside a touch of whiskyish warmth in the long finish; a marvellous fireside beer which is incredibly easy drinking - sessionable if you ignore the strength; great stuff.

In the aroma I smell honey.
The beer is ruby red and has a small head.
In the taste i have some hazelnut chocolate.
The beer is medium carbonated.

Tallahassee, Fl - Market Square Liquors - 500 ml bottle. Dark chestnut brown pour, bubbly off-white head that leaves a light ring around the edge of the glass. Aroma has some light molasses notes, a hint of dates and brown sugar. Flavor is a bit subdued with some light brown sugar, a dash of molasses, a touch of bubble gum. Mouthfeel is thick enough. Had much better dopplebocks.

Pours an average frothy off-white head that mostly diminishes. Body is clear red brown and sparkling.
Aroma contains heavy malts (dark bread, hay, roasted malts, nuts, caramel), light hops (grass, grapefruit), light yeasts (horse blanket, soap) and sweet dries fruits like raisin or plum, grapes, peach, cherry, tawny port, cinnamon and cola.
Flavor starts off light acidic and light sweet and goes to light acidic and moderate sweet.
Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
Good beer.

Aroma: honey. Appearance: extremely dark amber with amber head. Taste: sweet caramel malts. Palate: fizzy with honey taste again. Overall: wicked Doppelbock, no notice of high alcohol content. Bottle at the Octoberfest Pub, London.

Thanks to Agate,
Pours reddish brown, deep with beige-creamy, soapy top, sustains good, minimal lasing. Aroma like typical doppelbock, below average intensity, pure darker malts, no hints of hops. Taste is sweet with light bitter from darker malts. Thick mouthfeel, slicky-oily texture. Overall - this brew lacks overall intensity to me, more reminds bockbier, not liquid bread what I expect it to be, but its tasty.

A wet mash smell like smelling snow that has been on the ground for a while. A hazelnut brown color that seems clear but it is to dark to see through. Frothy head. Big thick dark sweet malty smokey taste. The flavor comes on heavy and fades slowly down to a light malt. For how thick rinse with little leftover.

On tap. Pours a deep brown with a foamy tan head and lacing. It has a nice aroma of toasty malt, dried fruit, and some spices, maybe cinnamon or pumpernickel. The flavor is malt, plum, and apricot up front with a sweet finish over a medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Clear deep brown liquid with small to medium light tan head. Aroma of bread, pumpernickel, earth, chocolate, dried fruit and light smoke. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of pumpernickel, light ash, chocolate and light earth. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Quite nice.

Bottle @ home. Clear dark amber, medium off white head that quickly settles, okay lacing. Aroma, malty, roasted notes, dark fruits, caramel, spicy, sweet, chocolate. Taste, malty, spicy/peber, licorice, dark fruits, toffee, chocolate, slight alcohol. Really nice beer, very drinkable. Nice bitterness. Bitter aftertaste.

This is such a good beer. Pours a very dark amber with little head from the bottle. Has a malty, deep, sweet smell. Immediately sweet and spicy on the tongue with a bit of carbonation. Almost a raisiny flavor and a touch of cinnamon. Not a thick beer which makes it quite an easy drinker despite its alcohol rating. Not much of an aftertaste. I cellared this for about 2 1/2 years and it is fantastic.

Pours clear mahogany into a stem glass. Tan head with medium retention recedes to skim surface. Caramel and pit fruit aromas. Sweet pit fruit, toffee and grain upfront turning dry in the medium length finish.

Dark brown with red highlights and a light brown head. Malty aroma with some sweet, dark, dried fruit notes. Big dark malt flavor, not as sweet as the aroma would lead you to believe. Short malty-earthy finish. Very nice dopplebock.

On tap at Gollem Proeflokaal. Beautiful port colored deep red pour with a clean slab of off white foam. Aroma of ripe berries, quite fruity, strawberry and cherry, very light caramel notes. Taste is sweet, fruity, rich caramelized malt flavors, intense caramelization, just a touch of alcohol in the finish. Palate is very full bodied, rich with medium carbonation. Very nice.
Good doppelbock with full-bodied and fruity malt and medium aftertaste. Perform its function during cold winter nights.

Serving: Bottle from State Line Liquors. It pours a dark brown color with nice ruby highlights. Grainy nose with notes of caramel. The flavor has a slight metallic note up front that thankfully fades quickly. More grain and a pronounced caramel note pair with a slight white raisin taste. Fairly clean finish. Good.

Bought a bottle at Berts Bierhuis. The beer has a dark brown color and a nice cream colored head, CO2 level is good. In the aroma tones of roasted malts, dried fruits and a little caramel. The taste is pleasantly malty and strong - a powerfull robust body. Also at the same time you can taste the sweetness of the beer, roasted cocoa and a medium bitter hoppiness. This is all together well balanced. Concluding with a powerful punch, this Doppelbock departs with a lingering aftertaste of quality plain chocolate. Conclusion: a really nice doppelbock, which is worth repeating.

500ml bottle. Dark brownish amber. A big head eventually recedes to nothing. Very nice aroma with liquorice, toffee and bonfire notes standing out. Taste isnt quite as good as the aroma. Lots of cold coffee, toasted grain, earth and caramel. Good stuff but I was hoping for something more cohesive.

500ml bottle shared with jeevan - Cheers! Pours a lovely reddish brown, but no head. Aromas are all toffee malt and nuts, light fruitiness. Taste has all kinds of malt-sweet, but not much else. Traditional, drinkable. OK.

500 ml bottle. Dark reddish brown. Clear. Tall light beige head. Peppery nose with dark toffee. Hints of pumpernickel and dark chocolate. Very complex with a lovely malty flavour. Soft texture with a lot of things to chew on. Dry, but rich. A very nice doppelbock.

Bottle @ Circolo Sant Eugenio. Schiuma beige, abbastanza fine, persistente. Birra di colore marrone quasi limpida, attraversata da una sottile velatura. Profumo abbastanza intenso poco persistente tipico di malto, frutta secca (nocciole su tutto) , tostatura decisa, e note alcoliche eleganti. Poco nulla erbacea/ luppolata al naso. Gusto intenso, abbastanza persistente. Dolce abboccato,un maltato ricorda il the, poco amaro, derivante quasi in tutto dalla tostatura. Corposa, morbida, poco carbonata è equilibrata ed armonica. Una bottiglia ne chiama unaltra.

Bottle for Sunday night poker game, Im making an effort to drink more styles on occasion so here I am. Pours ruby brown with nice malty nose. tastes of roasted malt, bready, light fruits, caramel, and nutmeg. chewy palate and light bitter finish.
Deep brown color with tan head, caramel malt aroma, consistent light roasted and caramel malt taste, full body and fine carbonation, one interesting doppelbock beer

Aroma of fruitbread and roasted chocolate. Stunning deep red color, slimy film. Sweet alcoholic fruit, nut and chocolate flavors mingle nicely. Body is not too heavy, finish is chewy. Pretty impressive for a lighter bock.

Whole Foods, Bowery 50cl ($5): Pours reddish brown color with a small head. Aroma is a whole fruit basket, some light roasted malts, breadiness, cookies. Taste is somewhat on the sweet side, but not cloying. Fruity complexity is in there for sure. Body is comparatively light and the beer is easy to drink equally in quaffs as it is in sips. Quite nice.
2013 from tap. poured a a dark red brown colour with big head. malty, nuts, toffee, caramel, some smoky tones. verry smooth beer. never had it from bottle. but its amazing from tap!

0.5l bottle shared with Inbreak @ Hotel room in Amsterdam. A nice big fluffy kinda beige head on top of a really deep dark brown red body. Smells really dark malty with a ton of chocolate malts and lots of biscuits. Ill willingly admit that this smells quite nice. Oh, nothing wrong with the flavor either! Its really on the sweet side, lots of dark malts with a hint of caffeine free coffee, lots of roasted nuts and dark rich caramel. It is somewhat sweet indeed, but it works really great on both my palate and the mood Im in right now. Delicious! 26.09.2013

Aroma is very rich and malty with a lot of toasted bread, dark caramel, toffee and other melanoidins. Light fruitiness with faint dark cherry and plum. No hop flavor. Light nuttiness. 
Pours a clear dark copper to brown with ruby highlights and a moderately thick tan head that has really nice retention. Faint lacing and no legs. 
Flavor is moderately to very sweet with a large malt character. Lots of toasted bread along with dark caramel and a light chocolate note. Light raisin with medium light plum and cherry notes. Medium light bitterness with no hop flavor. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low to medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a pretty enjoyable beer. I dont find myself often reaching for German beers, but the maltiness has a nice complexity to it. Fairly big and sweet, but also very easy drinking and clean.
Tap at CK thanks to craftycarl21! Clear, deep jewel ruby/blood red pour. Thick, starchy red twizzlers nose. Taste is clean, malty, mild hop bite, dense, bready. Balanced, clean. Nice.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 Old rating rerated 26.09.2013, 0,5l bottle shared with Palme @ hotel in Amsterdam:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is sweet, caramel malts, malt candy, dark sugar, nuts, toffee. Taste is slightly sweet, caramel malts, grass, hops, toffee, nuts, dark sugar, hints of licorice. Medium bitterness. Fair enough.
Helder en kastanjebruin bier. Neus van wijn, caramel. Zoet en bitter. Medium tot volle body, zacht in de mond. Lekker!
Poured dark reddish brown with a huge frothy beige head. Aroma of zesty sweet roast malt. Medium body, toasted malt, chocolate, coffee. Dry, bitter sweet finish.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2013 Deep red clear appearance, medium head. Roasted barley aroma, similar to roasted grain coffee substitute aroma. Sweet and well rounded. Very good and satisfying Doppelbock style beer.

Bottle 50cl. Yellow creamy medium head. Clear dark brown color. Aroma is bread, sugar, cloves and roasted choco malt. Taste is sugar, syrup, malt and chocolate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2015 Big malts, caramel in both aroma and taste, with a moderate bitter finish. It lacks the creamy body of better bocks, feeling a bit thin. Still, a good bock.



10-OCT-2013. BOTTLE 50CL.

Head: beige, medium, frothy, bwloe avg. retention. Colour: ruby-brown, clear.

Aroma: caramel, burnt sugar. 

Taste: caramel, well done biscuit, slightly bitter and phenolic. 

Body is medium, on the dunkler bock side. Not bad. 6/3/7/3/14=3,3

Bottle poured a brown color with red highlights and a thin coating of tan head that held a ring on the glass. Aroma has brown malts, chocolate, mild roast, and a touch of earth. Mouth feel is on the lighter side and there is nice steady carbonation. Flavor brings the malt to the front, chocolate powder, mild creeping bitterness, and some toffee sweetness. Just the right balance of flavors and very smooth to drink!
Dark brown with a thick head. Brown sugar aroma. Flavor is sweet, but not in a bad way. Very good all around.

Rating #863, flaske fra Sky ved Puttgarten. En mørkebrun (mahogni) øl med luftigt skum, dog ikke den bedste holdbarhed. Duft af malt, chokolade og karamel. En smule alkohol og metal. Smagen er tydeligt mærket af metal, søde malte, mørk chokolade, alkohol og en let ristethed. Ubalanceret bitter-besk afslutning med en smule sødme og noter af bær. God mørk chokolade. Blød i bunden, men burde være lidt tykkere. For ubalanceret alkolholsmag, ligesom der godt måtte være noget mere sødme. Jeg forstår ikke de høje ratings - den er da god nok, meeen.....
Draught @ Beer OClock. Dark brown with a nice beige head. Aroma is moderate sweet, burned sugar, roasted malt. Sweet and caramel flavor with almost no bitterness, also some dry fruits. Quite nice

27.09.2013. 0,5l Bottle. Aroma of dark malts. Burnt candisugar and caramel. Strong with rith body and alcohol. Soft bitterness that goes well with the malty body. Strong malty aftertaste with alcohol and burnt sugar. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap. Sweet cherry aroma. Cola pour. Sweet toffee, chocolate, cherry notes with a tosty finish. Moves great through the mouth. Sweet, but good.

On draft at Churchkey DC on Zwanze Day. Pours a clear cola with a thin bubbly tan head. Aroma of sweet roasted malts. Flavors of chocolate. Smooth and mellow mouthfeel with light carbonation. Dry cocoa finish.
Pours a deep brownish amber with a medium creamy off white head. Aroma of dark fruits, toffee, nuts, toffee and toasted bread. Flavor of dark fruits, toffee, cherries and caramel.
From a Barrel, 9/9/12. Extreme melanoidin and caramel. Thick and chewy with a very light smokiness. yum yum yum. Many elderly ladies drinking doppelbock after church.

Pours with a nice 1/2" light khaki head... the brew is dark brown with beautiful garnet highlights... good lacing.

Nose is dark toast... very malty... light caramel... 

Flavor mirrors the nose... no chocolate like some darker versions (like Celebrator)... just pure malty goodness... something that I associate with dates with warmth, so does a grainy sweetness.

Very smooth body... the head is so creamy it almost feels like nitro.

Worthy of the hunt and the reputation.
Mörk brun med litet skum! Väldigt söt av malt och smaken är malt och alkohol! Inte så jättegod!

Bottle at Rauhrackel.
Clear dark brown with a small brown head.
Aroma has nuts, caramel malt and dark chocolate.
Taste has caramel malt, dry chocolate, honey like sweet notes and a distinct hop bitterness.
Mouth feel is smooth yet dry, medium bodied, low carbonation.
After taste is dry chocolatey with a slight bitterness.

Bottle. Aroma has dark syrup, barley and grain. 

Taste has dark syrup, soy, citrus, barley. Quite bitter on the aftertaste. Quite a lot of flavor but not my kind unfortunately.

On tap at the Gourmet Haus Staudt. Finally get to try this one! It pours dark amber brown but not hazy. Tan head. The aroma is bready malts with cherry, toast and a hint of cocoa. The flavor is the same. Dry but malty with lots of bread, toast, some raisin and plum, cocoa and a rather spicy hop finish. Very nice, satisfying and balanced.
500ml bottle. Pours dark orange brown with a small head. Aroma is burnt toffee with some orange hops underneath. Taste has orange and caramel to start with burnt toffee and toast on the finish.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; clear dark brown pour with ginormous beige head, bready aroma, bready taste, caramel with a sweet malt background very drinkable with violent carbonation.
Dark amber color with nice big head. Aroma is fruity malt. Sweet malt flavor with bitter aftertaste. Great Doppelbock.

Donker bruin robijn koffiekleurig bier. Lekker zoet van smaak je proeft Haagse hopjes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Gedeeld op bierproeverij bij bryanvdv. Roodbruin bier met fijn gebroken wit schuim. In de geur kuilgras, haver en kandijsuiker. In de smaak gebrande mout en tikje alcoholisch. Een aardig bockbier, iets te dun naar mijn mening.

Heerlijk bokbiertje. Lichte koffie-caramel geur. 
Licht troebel en donkerbruin van kleur. 
Middelmatige body. 
Hoofdsmaak is zoetig, met een bittertje. 
Nasmaak is bitter.
On tap, nice deep gold amber. Thin tight heady. Malty, sweet nose. Very balanced malt and dough and sweetness. Good beer. Not my favorite style though.

Bottle BB Jan 2014, at room temp. Pours clear dark brown, high carbonation, big fluffy head. Smell is burnt caramel, bovril, bread. Taste is a little sharp to start which masks the flavours. Then liqourice, weak coffee. More sharpness in the aftertaste. I think it would have benefited from being colder and fresher. Nice anyway.
On tap at PIB, pours a dark mahogany with a small beige head. Aroma and flavour is full of toasted nuts, bready malts, and dry caramel. Very easy to drink and bready qualities dominate. Solid stuff.

On tap at the PIB. Colour...dark, clear amber with a thin tan head. Nose...redolent of malt and biscuits with honeycomb as well. Palate...sweet but not cloying, somewhat dry with caramel and toffee up front and then fruity esters mid palate and a slightly oaky finish with beeswax and brown sugar.
On draught at 2013 Portland International Beerfest. Clear amber brown color. Sweet caramel malt aroma. Taste is honey toffee and grape juice, with a slight pleasing hop bitterness.

rich, sweet malty aroma. a touch of esters. super dark brown color, modest head. very sweet malty flavor. sweet dark break made liquid! a reasonable shot of bitterness in the finish countering the malt sweetness, which takes a while to get used to on a hot summer night! brilliant beer. it tastes like history.

On tap at the kloster. Pours clear red-brown with a frothy tan head. Aroma is of caramel, roasted malt, with some floral notes. Taste is very sweet/malty up front, with caramel malt and a nice balance of roasty and hoppy bitterness toward the end. Medium-full bodied, and the alcohol is not noticeable at all. Pretty much flawless doppelbock.
Very light aroma. The head is white but small. The color is dark rubin. Its correctly carbonated and has a malty, caramel taste.

On tap at Gourmet Haus. Rich, caramel and bread-like malt aroma. Pours a deep reddish-brown that is clear with light tan head that fades quickly. Sweet rich malt is powerful with slightly dry finish. Medium- full mouthfeel. Nicely carbonated.
At beer garden in Wiesbaden. Dark reddish colour, lots of sweet malty aroma. abv well masked. fruity, sweet, bready, nice. Prost!
Ruby red cocacolaish with little head. Aroma strong with fruit, plum. Taste sweet fruit, malt, spice. Medium body, text smooth, long sweetness.

50cl bottle from some beer store in Gräfelfing. Pours a clear, deep brown colored body with a nice ruby hue. Finger-width, creamy, tan head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is slightly sweet, nutty and bready caramels with a nice dark fruit note, touches of roast, and a bit of a chocolate note. Flavor is similar. Medium sweet, nutty, bready, somewhat grainy caramels with a touch of chocolate, a good amount of dried fruits, and a light roasty hint. Finishes fairly dry and pretty clean with a light bitterness and a nice roast touch. Lengthy aftertaste following a smooth, medium-full body and a soft, moderately lively carbonation. Overall, a really nice doppelbock. A bit sweet and malty, but really well balanced with a nice dried fruit, chocolate, and roast touch. Great beer.

Pours clear, amber. Tan head which dissipates quickly, leaving a little lace around the edge of the glass. Not a lot of aroma, mostly hints of malt and some alcohol. Palate is well-balanced. A good mouthfeel, velvety in the middle, dry finish. Not sweet at all, considering it purports to be a dopplebock. The flavor is understated. The best things here are the appearance and the palette, which is unusual.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2016 De color marrón oscuro, con reflejos rojizos. En el aroma destaca el dulzor intenso, así como cereales y frutas oscuras, particularmente ciruelas pasas. En boca, un cuerpo muy denso y sedoso, los aromas se complementan con el dulzor intenso de la malta; se suman chocolate y caramelo, pasando a regusto con cierto regaliz al final del trago. Una de mis doppelbock preferidas, de esas cervezas que alimentan el estómago y el alma.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2015 reddish-brown colour, medium brownish head, which collapses quite quickly; aroma of caramel, dried fruits like raisin and maybe figs and some alcoholic notes; taste is dominated by rich maltyness with hints of alcohol in the backgroung some roastedness and candy sugar (which is not physically present, of course, due to the Reinheitsgebot :) ); excellent doppelbock
Tap at Andechs. Aroma is dominated by sweet caramel malt. Flavout continues the caramel malt them but with the addition of some herbal hops leading to slight medicine vibe. Very good.

KEg at Andechser Am Dom. Pours Brown with a reddish hue and an off white head. Thick, sweet aroma and the flavour of Rolos on the tongue. Rising carame is tamed by sparing hops. Sweet caramel and a full body. This beer is delicious.

Bottle bought from München. Blood red beer with a frothy beige, first huge then dissapearing, head. Points given by the look after pouring the bottle to the glass. Sweet caramel malty aroma has a bit alcohol too. Flavour is sweet caramel malts and some roast. Full bodied and oily mouthfeel. Really good!

Bottle: &nbsp Ruby brown in color, thin to moderate sudsy sandy head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Strong bready aroma. &nbsp 

Seems pretty simple, which somewhat baffles me given its stature. &nbsp Smooth maltiness up front. &nbsp Soft dark pitted 

fruit, but mainly a strong bready component you would expect from a Doppelbock. &nbsp Breadiness lingers from front to back, 

with only a minor emphasis on dark pitted fruit. &nbsp While smooth, body and mouthfeel are moderate. &nbsp Good, well 

crafted, and very solid, but this one just seems so ordinary in my book. &nbsp Perhaps its the fact I am not having it at the 

source thats a problem, but the bottled version likely does not do it justice. &nbsp Good, but I have had many other examples 

that were more interesting. &nbsp Good, but unsure why its at the top. &nbsp I expected much more depth with this one.

Bottle acquired through an amazing trade with Homer321!  Have wanted to try this one for a significant amount of time and excited I was able to experience it.  Deep copper pour with an tightly packed eggshell head.  This one is filled by dark fruit, raisin, prune, fig, caramel, toffee, honey, and molasses.  Medium mouthfeel...not heavily carbonated but not terribly syrupy either.  Love the balance.  Really nice brew!

Color rojizo caramelizado, espuma beige clara, densa y muy bien formada. Aromas dulces y caramelo. En boca muestra ese mismo carácter con un final alcóholico equilibrado, nada molesto. Textura ligera, muy fácil de beber. En mi opinión, una gran doppelbock.

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100706.
Pours dark copper color with a medium head. Aroma is sweet with caramelly and chocolaty malts, some ripe fruits, syrup, sugary notes and yeast. Flavor of caramel malts, licorice, syrup, ripe fruits and yeast. Very good.
Earthy dank smell. Taste is grassy, roasted malt and sweetness. Complex beer. Love it!

Kobber klar skum brunlig luftig lang 
Nød brød gær korn 
Bitter lidt sød moderat 
Sirup livlig 
@værksted 5/4-13 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle sample at a tasting at the new Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Yoav. Cloudy dark brown with tan ring. Raisins, malty and a little alcoholic aroma. Tastes malty and sweet, slightly grainy and roasty. Full body, slightly carbonated, long, malty finish. Tasty and decent.
Bottle from a friend. Smell of malt and caramel. Similar taste with a wortlike character. Very sweet and malty.

Pours deep mahogany with a medium tan head. Smells of caramel and dark fruits with a subtle hint of earthy hops. Taste is caramel and toffee, hints of chocolate, slight hints of grass, dark fruits, incredibly well crafted flavor profile. Full-bodied with a slick, smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Aandechser Doppelbock Dunkel finishes with a lingering sweetness that is not syrupy, to my surprise, and has a slight pumpernickel hint.
Me gustó muchísimo esta cerveza. El sabor es intenso, algo dulzón y el amargor del final es ligero. No puedo explicarme mejor pero estaba muy muy bien.
50cl bottle. Nice color, aroma has malt, yeast and even smoke. Taste is heavy well balanced, little less carbonation and this would be even better.
Draft at Only Good Beer, Budapest. Mild head on rich mahogany. sweet molasses nose, warming full body. Raspberry, leather, relatively mild alc note and coating brown malt character. Nice

500 ml bottle from Beiropholie, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 22DE12.
App.:  Clear deep mahogany with a nice tan head.
  
Aroma:  Strong, rich, brothy malts, dark dried fruits, sweet and inciting, dark rye bread crust, brown sugar and treacle, some booziness, faintly metallic.
  
Palate:  Medium+ body, fine, restrained effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Much like the nose, rich, sweet, lightly fruity, raisins/figs/dates, a bit mashy, light rootbeer-like note, dark rye bread crust, rye bread too; sweet with limited bitterness and a long, inky, sweet, deeply malty finish.

Koestlich.
UPDATED: JAN 18, 2014 Best dark Doppelbock I know! Great taste, but drink only one because when you drink the scond the aftertaste may become too stong in my oppinion. Awesome beer.

Bottle 50 cl from Bier-Bienne (CH). Brown with nice beige foam drawing the glass. Soft aromas of roasted malt, cereals, a little straw, toffy. The mouth is sweet, low acidic, unctuous. The taste is roasted malted wrapped with caramel, brown sugar, rye bread. Perfectly blended and balanced. Long finish, creamy, sweet and warm.

Pours a clear, dark mahogany color with a nice tan head. Smells of molasses, caramel, dark fruit. The taste is somewhat sweet roasted malt arma with caramel, licorice. Full bodied with average and smooth carbonation.  A great Doppelbock.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2014 Brown beer, with nice red shine, and thin, but dense, and vanishing medium beige head. Very bready aroma, roasted notes. Nice taste, bitter but not too much, woody taste, and some sweet part, with the usual smoky aroma too. Well bodied, one of the best doppelbock.

Botella de 50 cl. Excelente doppelbock. Corona beige de espuma que no dura mucho. Aromas torrefactos que luego se confirman en boca....regaliz...ahumados...cafe....deliciosa. Primera entrada dulce para dejar un regusto a regaliz brutal.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2016  A good example of a Doppelbock. Thick molasses body, but a little more creamy than some others. Very enjoyable and smooth. Roasted malts, strong doppelbock. Nice and recommended.

500 ml bottle. Pours a rich, dark brown with caramel head. Minimal lacing. Smells of hops, malts and chocolate with molasses in the background. Taste is great. Very full mouth feel. Slightly carbonated, with toasted hops and malts. Caramel and coffee aftertaste.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2017 500ml botle. Malty, some caramel and roasted aromas. Pours dark, with some tan head, vanishing, some lacing. Medium body, average carbonation, oily texture. Taste is sweet, warm, oily, some caramel, toffe roasted notes. Quite balanced. Enjoyable.

Keg @Andechser am Dom, Munich. 03-08-2016.
Pours clear very deep amber with nice off white head. Moderate head retention, good lacing. Licorice, caramel nose. Medium body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is quite sweet, licorice, caramel.
Ar:7, App:4, Tst:7, Pal:3, Ovll:14, Total: 3.5.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy dark amber with airy light tan head. Clear aroma of malt and caramel. Sweetish, malty taste with distinct notes of caramel and coffee beans. Nice, dryish aftertaste. Really nice.

Bottle. Pours an auburnish dark brown with a large, dark latte-colored head. Aroma is very malt bready, roasted, dry, light salty liquorice. Taste is malt forward as well - not that surprisingly. Malt bread, darkened crust of dark malt bread. somewhat roasted, light herbalness in the background. Light tones of coffee and salty liquorice. Palate is full, slick and quite carbonated.
Soft malty and syropy nose. Pale beige fast dissappearing head. Clear dark brownish red color. Soft full filled taste. Slightly sweet syropy.Some hints of koffee. Average hoppiness. Nice color

Bruna-rubino con riflessi rossi. Due dita di schiuma poco persistenti. Aroma maltato complesso inizialmente lieve, poi riscaldandosi diviene via via più complesso e si sentono anche i malti tostati. Al palato dolce, abbastanza carbonata. Ovviamente complessa, fruttata. Finale molto aromatico: tipo lamaro del rosmarino secco. Equilibrata ma complessa ed elegante. Birra buonissima.

Appearance: Dark brown color with a tan head. Ok lacing.Aroma: Dark malt and fruity.Palate: Medium body. Sweet and light bitterness. Creamy carbonation.Taste: Deep caramel malt, fruity and toffee.Overall impression: A pleasant surprise. Personal stats: Bottle from Systembolaget in Uddevalla, Sweden.Blytjern 13

Bouteille de 500 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Légère odeur de céréales grillées avec une pointe caramel. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée avec une moyenne densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel avec une pointe sucrée. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Présence de caramel en arrière goût. (Rating #4540)

I drunk this beer more than 50 times and i never get bored.
Brown colour with one finger of tanned head. Malts, caramel, bread, toffee in nose.
Cara malts, toffee and some alcohol in mouth.
If you have the choice, try it. One of the best doppelbocks

Sample, brown bottle, 0.5 l, best before 27 09 12, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savoured on October 18 2012; eye: ruby with caramel reflections, minimal effervescence, beige head that disappears completely, no lacing; nose: malt, caramel, light pepper, light alcohol, light scotch; mouth: malt, caramel, light pepper, light alcohol, slight acridness, light scotch, slight chocolate, a-bit-short finale with presence of caramel, medium body, below-average carbonation, lightly sweet, a bit thin; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, bouteille brune, 0,5 l, meilleure avant 27 09 12, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 18 octobre 2012; il : rubis avec des reflets caramel, effervescence minime, mousse beige qui disparaît complètement, pas de dentelle; nez : malt, caramel, léger poivre, léger alcool, léger scotch; bouche : malt, caramel, léger poivre, léger alcool, très légère âcreté, léger scotch, très léger chocolat, finale un peu courte avec présence de caramel, corps moyen, carbonatation sous la moyenne, légèrement sucrée, un peu mince; en résumé : bien

50cl bottle, local Edeka. - Old school Doppelbock. Pours a somewhat flat and fizzy translucent dark brown. Light-medium mouthfeel, low creaminess. COuld be fuller. Unexpected and to my palate somewhat unsavoury mix of bitter and ABV-amped sugary notes, not much roasted malts. More interesting tasting notes are to be made in the finish & aftertaste. Conservative, heady. Not my favourite of German Doppelbocks.

Pours dark brown with a creamy head that disipates.
It smells of malt, caramel and roasted malt.
Taste is very sweet, just a hint of bitternes, full body, thick texture and soft carbonation.
Not my style of beers but a really good one!

Aroma: soft, no hops, some cereal smell Appearance: nice foam, it dessapeared almos all Taste: malty malty, caramels, sugar, biscuits... Palate: if leaves a great taste of malty, some alcohol Overall: I am not an expert on this style but I want another one of this!

Kaatuu lasiin syvän ruskeana ja hieman valoa taittavana vaahdon ollessa nopeasti katoava eikä jätä pitsiä. Tuoksu on todella makea ja limppuisen maltainen, paahdettua sokeria kinkkua, suklaata ja jopa minttua löytyy myös. Mieto maku on hyvin makea, limppuisen maltainen, paahteinen ja kinkkuinen. Suutuntuma on melko mieto, makea ja äärimmäisen tasapainoinen. Se myös paranee lämmetessä. Kokonaisuutena tämä on aivan liian makea eikä leipäisyys sovi sen kanssa ollenkaan yhteen. Voisi olla huomattavasti parempaa tuoreena juotuna.

Bottle 0.5L. Dark amber colour with big, frothy, light brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel and red grape. Kinda vinous, maybe because of  grape aroma... Sweet at the start, turns to light bitter with caramel and chocolate finish.
Madre mía.... En buen hora he descubierto esta sublime Dopplebock. Tiene algo de caramelo y de café, quizá, de frutos secos, acaso, y yo qué sé qué más, sin dudarlo. Me encanta!!!
Dark brown, almost black beer. Taste like a mild stout. Foam is very thin and is quickly gone

Great doppelbock, very dark with a deep red colour, almost copper, and a small and shortlasting head. Nuts, roasted malts and some yeast palate. Medium bodied and good development. Rich and great bock.

#21
Kupferrotbraun im Glas mit reichlich feinporigem Schaum, first class. Verschlossenes herb-malziges Aroma und ein Antrunk, der seines gleichen sucht: Malzig-würzig-bitterschokoladig-etwas herb. Sicherlich trägt der Alk.Gehalt zur Vollmundigkeit dieses Nektars bei, ist aber weder dominant noch entscheidend für den glänzenden Eindruck eines dunklen Doppelbocks, der kühn dem Gold-Bier-Trend trotzt und zweifelsohne ein Referenz-Bockbier ist, an dem sich andere Böcke messen lassen müssen!
	
Test vom 15.1.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 14,13,14,14,12,14 - 13,75

Questa e davvero buona, nella mia top ten delle basse fermentazioni....aromi complessi con caramello, caffè tostato, prugne, salsa di soia..... Secca, corpo medio, finale pulito, amarognolo e persistente.....

With its deep rich brown colour and deep rich tan head it certainly is one of the most gorgeos looking beers I have ever seen. On the nose there was an almost burnt bready medicinal woody quality. On the tongue it is pretty dry and vinuous with a flavour reminiscent of treacle and molassess. Tasty but does not have the big richness of classic Aventinus and I cant help to see it almost like a closed wine.

Malt smells lightly caramelized with some dark chocolate and nut. A little booze in the aroma - on a pretty good level. Pours mahogany with creamy foam and pretty good lacing. Good for style. Leave is a little sweet and some bitterness. Thanks to Boutip.

A reddish dark amber bock with a thick mocha head. In aroma, huge dark malt, grainy, scotch like, with dark fruits. In mouth, a good roasted caramel malt, with dark fruits, light molasses, grassy character, very nice, alcohol warmth, great!  Shared with GRM, Oct. 2012.

2010 vintage bottle. Thanks to KyotoLefty. Cherries, raisins, sugary nose. Dark brown with ruby highlights, smooth tan head, and great lacing. Thin sweetish fruits in initial; smooth and fruity mid; something is a bit off in the final -- not sure exactly what, but the flavors change in an unpleasant manner. Thin body. Good and complex, but rather thin.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2012 500ml courtesy of Don. Thanks! Tulip.A: Plum and brown with a quarter inch lasting head. Decent legs.N: Clove, brown sugar, malt, soy sauce, prune. Has a deep appreciable sweetness that never ventures to cloying.T: Complex. Brown sugar, some earthy hop bitterness. A hint of smokiness and some soy sauce, but not as a flaw. Incredibly balanced. Clove again. Cola. Breadiness like a dark rye loaf.M: Rich and full. Very clean.O: A rewarding beer. A veritable loaf of bread in a glass. Extremely glad t have tried this, and a beer I will revisit whenever I get the chance.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Andechs, Maß (1 litre). Rich, creamy texture, warm, copperly appearance. Special aroma with malt, bread and notes of nuts. Definetivly not alcoholic. Lively carbonated, better than the sold bottles. Best Beer I ever had.

Bottle@ the fiddlers. Pours a very dark red color with a small tanned head. Aroma is full of dark malts and caramel. Slight alcoholic. Flavor has a spicy sweetness, loads of malts. Very nice doppelbock. Week definitely pick this up again.
On tap @ PINT Bokbier Fest 2012. Clear brown color. Aromas: cooked vegetables, laurel/drop, with caramel & malty sweetness retronasal. Flavor is medium sweet, roasted. Medium bodied.

500ml bottle, dark amber-brown color, with a thick frothy beige head, good grainy toasted, biscuity, caramelized, bready, munich malt nose, with a light bubblegum yeastiness accent, with some bran muffin, toffee, muesli cereal, dried dark fruit, faint coffee notes in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a sweet grainy toasty, caramel, biscuity, bready maltiness character with some yeasty, fruity dried raisin, fig, bran muffin, french toast, toffee flavours, with a faint nutty, peacan pie, brown sugar undertone, leading towards a dark dried fruitiness, good grainy maltiness finish.

Bottle 500ml @ My parents place
Pours clear brown with a small off-white head. Aroma has notes malt, pumpernickel, alcohol, chocolate and caramel. Taste is medium sweet  and light bitter with a long chocolate finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

On 50 cl bottle from Ambrosetti,Berlin.
Dark amber color, ok foam.
Immediate malty aromas, dried fruits, some vanilla.
Medium/full body & high compexity.
High sweetness, but balances it well with alcohol & body.
Very enjoyable

Clear dark ruby with lasting brown foam head lacing to glass. Aroma is sweet caramel, same like taste. A bock beer available all year and a nice one too. Short bittersweet aftertaste. (Velp 201210)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

29/09/2012 Birrifugio Trastevere (500ml bottle). Bruna, riflessi color miele di castagno, limpida, schiuma bianco-sporca non molto abbondante e non molto persistente. Al naso sentori di caramello, pane, zucchero di canna, miele, con note tostate. In bocca è dolce, caramellata, zuccherosa, con finale appena amarognolo. Corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Scende giù bene, ha una notevole beva, ma alla lunga risulta stucchevole come la maggior parte delle doppelbock.
Copper red brown colour creamy head that discipates. Raisins caramel and brown sugar in the aroma. Full bodied with moderate carbonation. Hope to have this fresh from the brewery at some point.

Aroma: The smell is fruity ,grassy and yeasty, dry and fresh grass, some honey.Appearance: The beer is clear red-brown, with a tan head leaving some lacing.Taste: The taste is rather sweet, raisins and dates, acidity - green apples and pears.Palate: Medium carbonation, medium complexity, a somewhat sticky feeling.Overall: Not at all bad. Note: bottle. Sampled at a "blind" beer tasting at De Klomp, Linköping, Sweden. We did nail it. Reviewed 2010-08-21.
On tap at Andechser am dom in Munich.Pours Red Amber with a Beige head.nutty,malty,molasses like aroma with notes of Buttery nuts,licorice,toffee,caramel,cappuccino,dried fruit and malt syrup.
Mahogany brown colour. Aroma is dry and woody. Flavour is malty and has a sweetness but the overall strong wood is too overpowering.

Bottle: #2 of my RateBeer travel list to Germany. Weak aroma (get it with all Andechsers); red-black clear color. Taste is complex: wood, red berries, brandy, licorice, cough syrop. Very good but not great. Food Pairing: Honey BBQ ribs.
Sample on tap at Bières et saveurs (Chambly). POurs burgundy red with copper reflect. Beige head. Aroma: malt, banana bread and caramel. Taste is sweet, has some vanilla.

Dark and rich, black with hints of coffee and chocolate. Almost no head to speak of, but flavor and aroma make up for lack of eye appeal. Oily mouthfeel, has the color of a cola. Carbonation is light, but flavor is full.  Nice mellow bitterness remains on palate. Thumbs up!

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2013 Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Very delicious, honest beer. Flavours of dark chocolate combined with ripe fruity nuts. Drink it at a little bit under room temperature and it was just quaffable.

After tasting it different times I was surprised how different this one can taste. Huge malt and some nice coffee aroma in it ending a bit more sweet or a bit more bitter. Definitely a good one but beaten by it´s brother, the Bock hell.

Bottle. Pours a very dark red, with a full, creamy head. Aroma has a nice burned maltiness, with good notes of caramel, coffee and a touch of almost peaty smoke along with some syrup and bread. Flavour is sweet, with burned malts, coffee, cocoa, candi sugar and syrup, and finishes of with a nice burned sweetness.

500ml bottle. Clear red glowing dark amber with huge, firm, frothy to creamy, moderately lacing, off-white head. Moderately sweet, caramel malty aroma with a toasted, nuttily touch. Taste is minimally sweet caramel malty with a fresh husky overtone. Well balanced; carbonation alleviates heavy body leading drinkability into extraordinary and dangerous regions for a Doppelbock.

Dark hazelnut color with a little head which vanishes quickly. Great mouth feel. Not as malty as most Dopplebocks like Paulaners Salvator or the Bockbier brewed by Löwenbräu. This is one of my all time favorites! When youre in Bavaria... take a visit at the Andechser monastery with its very own delightful Biergarten nearby. 500cl Bottle

Bottle shared by drabmuh. Thanks Matt!

A: The beer is a hazelnut brown color with crimson highlights. Atop the beer is a thick inch of beige head that leaves a healthy dose of lacing on the glass.

S: The aroma is pleasant but subtle with hints of yeast and bread.

T: Without a doubt, this is the best doppelbock I have ever had, one of the two best lagers I have ever had (Humulus Lager), and one of the best beers I have had the pleasure to taste. Rich, smooth, packed with flavor...this is world class beer. The beer has a yeastiness and/or bread-like quality characteristic of Belgian quads.

M: Alcohol content completely hidden. Remarkably smooth .

D: Insanely drinkable. It took a lot of willpower to drink this as slowly as I did. My highest recommendation.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-29-2010

Purchased from Barleywine in Copenhagen. 
Brown in color, nice mild aroma.  Great dunkel flavor, very nice beer overall.
A very complex body, oily texture, sweet malty aroma, and a long lasting warm aftertaste.

Bottle @ Beer OClock 2 in Bucharest.

Dark brown colour with burgundy hints, beige head.

Aroma has notes of blueberries, chocolate, raisins, honey, dried plums, caramel, baked apples.

Medium to full body, sweet taste, medium carbonation, bittersweet aftertaste.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ (0,5l) Nice light brown head. Color deep dark redbrown. Aroma hops, malt. Taste some pleasant bitter, chocolate, dry finish. Palate long finish. Very good Doppelbock. Like to try it locally,

Tap @ Andechs am Dom, Munich. Fairly clear dark orange/brown appearance with an off white head. Rich nutty, burnt caramel, toffee aroma. Some light fruity notes, burnt toffee, toasty caramel malty, light coffee flavor. A classic really.

Pour murky hazel-nutty brown, with a huge frothy creamy off-white. 
Aroma is huge of caramel, slight bread? 
Taste is dominant sweet, with just slight bitterness. 
Medium bodied, with a rather flat carb.
This doppelbock was a very nice experience. One of the best beers I have ever tried.

Coffee aromas and taste, caramel, vanilla aftertaste with a metallic hint.
Not my style, but I can see why this is considered an excellent beer.
Amber-brown colour. Aroma of coffee. Taste is sweetish, malty caramel and nuts.

Ok, this was one of my top wants for a while, since I have a special affinity for doppelbocks.  It was difficult to get my hands on due to distribution, but here goes!  Pours a slightly disappointing clear mahogany brown with thin light tan head, no lacing.  Aroma of slightly roasted malt, sweet caramel, and dried dark fruits.  Flavor threw me off a little bit because of the depth of its complexity that I just wasnt getting from the nose.  Add in slight chocolate, vanilla, exotic mixed nuts, and nougat.  Mouthfeel is slick, but slightly dry.  Overall heavy body, but drinks thin if that makes sense?

Reddish-brown colour, minimal off-white head. Aroma of caramel, dried fruits and wheatgerm with a little bit of chestnut and nuts. Taste is medium sweet, wheat, hay, some bitterness, yeasty. A cellar taste comes along and becomes stronger at the end.

Shared by someone at the Montes Krown tasting yesterday.  Pours a clear amber with a thin tan head.  Nutty in the aroma.  Very smooth, very sweet taste.  Walnuts in the taste, along with heavy malts.  Decent.

500ml bottle. Aroma is malt, caramel and toffee. Appearance is very dark amber. Head is small, almost not existing white. Taste is very sweet with a very nice, almost creamy mouthfeel. Long sweet finish. Overall a nice bock, a little bit too sweet.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2012 from bottle. clear red/brown colour and quickly disappearing medium tanned head. wonderful aroma of toffee, nuts and chocolate. light sweetness, medium body, long lasting, slightly bitter finish, this beer has got all what it takes to be a fantastic beer!

.at the maibock, chapter,cardiff.
this is not beer.
these 6-7% superbeers/imperial stouts, etc. are not for me
tastes like jagermeister

0,5 liter bottle bought in Jumbo, Santiago de Chile. Tasted while listening to "Illuminate-Eliminate" by the norwegian black metal band  Mayhem. Pours a dark brown/mahogany color with three fingers of an off-white head that last for a while. Aroma is hugely malty, luscious and enticing showing a wide array of scents. Initially I got toasted grains and cereals. But this Doppelbock starts quickly showing strong notes of chestnuts, caramel, molasses, brown sugar, butter and nougat. Some pumpernickel bread and licorice are there too. Taste is predominantly sweet but well-balanced with toasted bitterness. Caramel, toasted rye bread, chestnuts, wood and crystallized sugar/honey (chancaca). Fantastic. More balanced, less sweet and less alcohol-driven than Paulaner Salvator. Texture is rich, oily (not quite syrupy) with a full mouthfeel. Alcohol is invisible on this one. Long finish but the aftertaste is a little dull compared to the enormous flavor. A world-class Doppelbock I wanted to try for years. An amazing experience to taste it while listening to Mayhems 2007 masterpiece "Ordo ad Chao" through headphones.
