Bottle from my friend Bill (thanks Buddy!).  Reddish brown with a super fizzy head that quickly fled.  The aroma is pure toffee.  The drinks is the same ... Sugar wafer sweet, topped with caramel.  Bit thin.  (#4588, 5/7/2012)

Oct 2006 from BA: This review is of the beer poured for me in Regensburg at the Andechers Kloster Hotel Bar (I think that was its name anyway). 

Lovely glass, lovely sight, almost jet black with a half inch of a tight creamy coloured head, which stayed with me and the pint (half litre really) until we had both finished. 

Aroma of toffee apples dipped in malt and then plunged into plum ram. 

The taste was wonderful, syrup like, but not sticky or jammy, just wonderful and right. 

Stuck to my mouth, giving the palate time to take in the taste and flavours, so complexed, it is hard to explain. If you have never tried it, try and find some, it is very, very good.

50 cl. bottle @ home // (a) clear burned sugar amber / tiny / disappearing white head // (s) sweet caramel, malts, syrup, dark fruits, burned sugar // (t) toasted caramel malts, syrup, burned sugar, nectar, fruits, slick, syrupy, brown sugar, berries, slight leather, toffee, spices, bitter aftertaste // slick, syrupy, soft carb. // +/- 2 yr. old @ RBWG 2012 & couple of months bottle @ home - thx to Klaas (?)

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2015 2012-04-26: 50 cl bottle, 1.75, 7.1%, 1 month past expiration date. Dark red-mahogany color, clear,  with a small creamy tanned head. Nose of toasted malts. Mouthful of toasted malts, dark bread. Taste is sweet due to the huge malts amount, balanced with a soft bitterness, Creamy to oily texture, soft carbonation, quite smooth. Full bodied, heavy, dense, thick. Doppelbock dunkel, interesting rare style. 7 4 7 4 13 = 3.5

2015 update: on tap at Andechser @ Munich. Deep bugrundy-mahogany color, clear, beige head. Smell of toasted malts. Aroma of roasted malts, sherry, whiskey, nuts, notes of chocolate in the finish.  Sweet taste with a light bitter balance. Carbonated, creamy texture. Full body, thick. Long smooth semi-dry finish, sticky. Sweet solid doppelbock. 8 4 7 5 14 = 3.8

caramel, chocolate, coffee, roasty, resin, leather, alcohol, alcohol, brown, clear, minimal head, brown foam, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, full body, thick feel, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish, 
0,5l bottle.   Best before 17 Aug 12
UPDATED: AUG 30, 2012 500ml bottle. Dark amber brown colour with tiny beige head that disappears quickly. Aroma is malty,bread, yeast, dark fruits, bit coffee. Flavour is malt, sweet.
Bottle at the Fiddler.  Amber pour with a tan head.  Aroma of malt, caramel, bread and fruit.  Flavour is caramel, dark fruit and raisins.  Really nice example of the style

Pours somewhat clear chestnut amber with a decent tan head. The aroma is unique, sweet malts with a bit of toasted nuttiness. The flavor is sweet pleasant malts with some nutty flavors that settle smoothly on the palate.

Bottle courtesy of Ekstedt shared @ Ekstedts bock-tasting. Pours chestnut brown with a small off-white head that quickly dissipates without leaving any trace. Smell is sweet and malty with dark bread, prunes, vanilla, raisins, caramel and alcohol. Taste is malty sweet and tiny bitter with dark bread, prunes, dates, caramel, pears and alcohol. Mouthfeel is silky and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with bread and orange peal.

From notes.  First reviewed 12/14/2011.  Poured from a 500 mL bottle into a stemmed tulip. Thanks to bauermj for bringing back this long-anticipated bottle from Europe.

Right away I notice the perfectly sized tan head that is tightly wound with bigger bubbles in the center from an aggressive pour. The beer itself has a date brown color with a ruby tint and transparent edges.

Rum soaked raisin, plum, dates, figs, and soft molasses all enter the nose. There is some clove like spiciness in the background.

The flavor starts with a rum-soaked raisin. Gooey molasses and toffee sweetness seem to coat a biscuity malt. Some plum and dates some in toward the middle. A slight metallic flavor is a bit off-putting toward the end. A soft, spicy bitterness helps to take the beer out with more balance.

There is a sweetness that coats the lips and inside of my mouth with each sip. Almost syrupy, the soft hops at the end prevent it from becoming cloying. Very creamy carbonation, but it is not as strong as it looked after the pour. The body starts medium and seems to get a bit heavier as the sip progresses.

There is a reason this is a sought after beer. Very well put together, this is the type of beer that I would drink again.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2012 50 cl. bottle @ home. Ruby with a thin off-white head. Smoky, roasted malts, caramel. Had a sligth earthy flavour to it. Easily drinkable despite the robust 7,1 % ABV. Great beer.

50cl bottle. Pours chestnut brown with a red hue, gentle bubbles and a nicely proportioned head. This disappears after a while, so not quite perfect, but very good. The nose has fruit cake, some sweet spice. 
The taste has more fruit cake with molasses, dried fruit and a touch of sweet spices. The palate is medium to full bodied with a big mouthfeel and a reasonable finish that makes you want to take another drink. Overall, a big tasty beer.
Malty/bready aroma.  Amber-brown in color with slight off-white head.  Bready, chewy sweet and roasty.

0.5L Mug On-tap at the Kloster Andechs....

Appearance: A lightly darkened caramel brown with some, but very little, reddish transparency to it. Solid bubbly consistency with a frothy head.

Aroma: Malty sweetness that hints toward caramel and bread but with its own element of fruity darkness.

Taste: Definite malt kick of caramel sweetness but with a balance of both dark fruit and hop tones that add to the subtle complexity.

Palate: Medium crisp carbonation with a smooth, highly drinkable, body. Beware! xD

Overall: For those who enjoy a good Doppelbock this is easily in the upper echelon of the style so consider it a must. This beer sets a standard. Make a mecca and go see the monastery. The food and beer are extraordinary and will set the mood for the best, most palatable, experience.

Serving type: on-tap

[ASPETTO] 			
marrone scuro con tonalità porpora, limpida			
[SCHIUMA]			
color beige, media presenza, buona compattezza, breve durata			
[OLFATTO]			
malto, con sfumature tostate, miele, frutta secca, fondo alcolico			
[GUSTO]			
dolce, con reminiscenze di tostato, frutta matura, miele. Evolve con una leggero calo delle componenti dolci, lasciando spazio a sensazioni tostate piu evidenti, una amarp presente ma non dominante che si fonde con note alcoliche che danno una sensazione speziata. retogusto durevole, pastoso, con una tocco quasi astringete che contrasta con note dolci dure a morire			
[TEXTURE]			
corpo medio,  leggermente oleosa sulle labbra,  carbonazione bassa.			
[COMMENTO FINALE]			
lager possente, rotonda e ricca di sapori maltati che giocano con sensazioni dolci e un tostato altalenante che crea dinamismo. Finale caldo, alcolico e quasi fruttato. Una sorta di alterego di una strong ale belga ma senza lapporto dei lieviti. Alcolicità evidente ma che non molesta, dando quel pizzicore quasi pepato nel finale. manca un poco di carbonazione, anche se credo sia tipico dello stile, ma che per un mio gusto personale non stonerebbe.

Bottle.  Pours clear dark brown with an average, frothy light tan head, medium retention with light lacing.  Aroma is caramel, cookie, and nutty malt with light, spicy hops, dates, and slight earthy character.  Flavor is malt dominant with dark fruits, light hops and bitterness, and a sweet finish.  Medium-full body, medium warmth and carbonation.

Thanks to kickinchalice for sharing this rarity.  Smells of rum raisins and deep malts, excellent!  Pours beautiful deep amber with red highlights and a finger and a half of white foam.  Taste is good but doesnt quite live up to the nose.  Bready malts with a light dose of dark fruit sweetness.  Tasty but not as complex as the nose.  Feel is solid.
Donker bier met een moutig aroma. Weinig body, zoetig van smaak in het begin een beetje bitter op het laatst. Weinig nasmaak.  Drinkbaar maar niks bijzonders.

Pours a deep reddish orange with a frothy tan head that slowly recedes to form a cap on top. Smells of caramel, raisins, burnt sugar, melanoid, slight earthy aroma. Taste is quite sweet with lots of darker and burnt sugars, dark dried fruit like raisins and prunes. Theres a touch of alcohol heat but it disappears just after I notice its there. Long lingering sweet malty prunes on the finish. Medium to full body with a moderate level of carbonation, and a sweet almost bubbly mouthfeel. Thats a nice bock here, I only wish it were a little easier to come by on this side of the pond.

From memory: In the beer garten of Andechs. This is the beer that turned me on to real beer, until this beer was just that -"Beer". As i sat on the hilltop that is Andechs and sipped upon the luxurious liquid I knew the Gods had touched me.
OK for real, if you get  a chance to try this, DO IT. 
If you are ever in Munich. GO to Kloster Andechs and experiance perfection of the doppelbock dunkel!

Pours deep brown reddish copper with beige thick creamy head with lacing.  Aromas sweet malts, raisin,  little of moldy bread, and some herbs. Texture is medium thick, oily sticky with smooth carbonation and full mouth feel. Palate is sweet caramel, malts with some fruity aftertaste and hints of dryness. Finish is sweet, balanced medium long, ABV is well hidden, with vague bitter note. Nice beer for a style, maybe too sweet  for me.

Bottle from Csakajosor.hu. Poured deep ruby, with a tan thick foam. Plum, dark chocolate, toffee, caramel, hops in the nose. Sweet taste with a slightly tarty kick in the finish. Roasted malts set a baseline for the overall aroma. Smooth on the palate, goes down very easy. No taste of alcohol, well hidden behind the caramel sweetness. This is an excellent doppelbock, very well done.
UPDATED: SEP 2, 2012 citrus, caramel, resin, basement aromas, bubblegum, red, sparkling, rocky head, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, full body, sticky, flat, long finish,

500mL bottle purchased at Bierkoning on my Amsterdam trip and consumed in KC.   Best before 28/03/12.  Pours with a clear dark color and a small quickly fading head.  Small bubble are visible as they travel to the surface of the beer.  Aroma is strong earthy prune with leafiness.  It is very novel and intense but not sweet and well-attenuated.  Its different drinking a beer that doesnt get all its flavor from either hops or ester rich yeast.  Some weird caramel in there as well.  Flavor is like tree caramel and not sweet.  Dark bark/earth at the end of the flavor and it sticks around.  Sweetness is there just not sugary.  Easy to drink yet full of flavor.  Split with two others and poured into a Stone IS snifter glass.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Thank you, Julia Dubowy.  Pours a clear dark amber with a steafy stream of the finest ascending bubbles.  Good dense head and lacing.  Chewy caramel malt with just the right amount of bittering.  This is an exceptional dunkel, well worth searching out.  I dont think it is available in America; I received a bottle from Julia, who was returning from Germany over Christmas.  Highly recommended.
Bottle 50 cl. Deep red with a short lived lightbrown head. Aroma of bread, chocolate and roasted malt. Sweet taste with a light bitter roasted and licorice ending. Ligth alc taste also..
UPDATED: JUN 5, 2012 170811: Strong and heavy malty beer. Classic German double bock. one of the better examples of its kind..

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 A: Dark reddish-brown body with about an inch of light tan head. Quickly receded but left behind a nice skim and some lacing.

S: Sweet malts: Caramel, chocolate, and cola. Real clean aroma profile.

T: Packed with plenty of sweet malts that are neither cloying nor heavy on the palate. Lots of cola, caramel, dark fruits, some chocolate and a bit of generic roasted goodness.

M: Medium bodied with a gentle rolling carbonation that keeps the sweetness moving across the tongue. Smooth finish with just a hint of lingering sweetness.

O: A pleasant drinking experience! My glass was empty before I knew it. I wish this was available in the states... Id drink it every time I grilled some sausages. Glad I was able to finally track this one down.

In short: A typical dunkel of superior quality
How: Bottle 500ml at Die Stube, Brasov, Romania
The look: Clear burgundy body topped by a small beige head
In long: Nose is on the sweet-ish side of things with black liquorice candy, toasted fruit cake.  Taste is toffee, raisins, some ripe bananas, black liquorice¸ caramelized nuts, very light notes of chocolate.  As it is often the case for that type of beer, almost not hops presence.  I generally find that type of beer a bit too sweet for me but somehow this one was very easy to drink.  A superior example of the style.  A pretty good beer to drink while sitting on a patio in Brasov.  People find me weird when I say that Id prefer to lick my cats butt for a full week rather than go back spend a week in Brasov.  They find it weird because Brasov really is one my favorite city in the world.

Rating #1300. 500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Poured a deep, effervescent mahogany with an initially large though steadily fading foamy light tan head. Spicy raisin, prune, molasses, caramel, some boozy rum warmth and bready hints on the aroma. Rum-soaked raisin and prune, a spicy warmth and roasted malt touches flavour-wise with a liquorice and berry skin bitterness. Finished with a soft and shortish bitterness but a lingering spiciness. Medium body, a hint of warmth in the throat and medium carbonation that added a pleasant dryness to the rich and chewy sweet malt spectacle.

Bottled. A dark brown beer with a huge beige head. Arom ais sweet, caramel and alcohol. Taste is malty and sweet, caramel, burnt sugar, spicy. HIgh carbonation and nice texture. Warming alcohol in the end.
This one worths the while... I really liked it. Even better if you actually drink it in the monastery...

Bottle at Aufsturz, Berlin. Pours clear, deep copper-red with a sturdy, white-tan head. Huge, malty aroma, toast, dark fruits, cherry liqueur. Full and rich flavor, medium to big sweet, rich toast, cherries, raisins, very faint alcohol, slight leaves. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Faintly warming finish, dark and toasty sugars, dark fruits, heavy malt sugars. Despite the fairly high ABV the impact is impressively mellow. Rich character. Excellent beer overall. Very drinkable.

Name: Doppelbock Dunkel
Date: October 01, 2010
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting
Appearance: clear dark amber, wispy beige head
Aroma: light sweet caramel malt aroma, hint of chocolate
Body: sticky body
Flavor: sweet caramel flavor, candy sweetness, light chocolate
Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 14/20
Rating: 3.4/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: *** /4

Had a litre stein this beer at the Monastary from a cask.  Dark read color with little head and what little head it has diminishes quickly.  Great mouth feel. Not as malty as most Dopplebocks like Ayinger Celebrator or Paulaner Salvator.  This is my all time favorite beer!

50 cl bottle, rated on 23.08.2010
Brown-orange colour. Big-bubbled and disappearing head. Aroma has malt, rye bread and some licorice. Palate is a bit low on CO2. Flavour is floury with licorice and some alcohol. Nice DP!

500 ml bottle shared by beastiefan2k.  The pour is a clear golden brown, a bit reddish, along with a smallish off white head.  The aroma is cedar wood, caramel sweet malt, floral and grass.  As it warms, some dried fruit comes out.  Taste is grassy caramel sweet malt, with a bit of earthy woodiness behind that.  Sweet beer, though it is nicely integrated into the overall flavor profile.  Palate is medium bodied, soft mouth feel, sort of a yeasty clove perfume mineral finish.  Thanks for sharing this Eugene, my eye had been on it for awhile.

Bottled. Pours a dark brown with a slim dark beige head that fade away quickly. Aroma is sour with roasted malts and some swetness. Taste is pretty much the same. Mouthfeel with caramel and hints of soar again and roasted malt. Not my favorite....

Sötét borostyános textúra, aszalt gyümölcs és kevés kávé illatával. Ebbe bizony valami jobb féle komlót tettek. Szénsavtartalma nem sok, mint általában a bockoknál. Sűrű hab, édes, olajos finom. A keserűség megmarad keményen a nyelven. Hamum és masszív fémes karakter.
Nagyon jó de nekem édes.
2011 - 12 - 06 500ml bottle. brown colour. small off-white head. dark roasted fruits in aroma. fresh sweet taste.

500ml bottle.
Dark amber, white head.
Malty aroma, fudge, toffee, dried fruits.
Medium sweet, medium body, medium bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty taste, toffee, hops, alcohol, fruit, roasted.
(2011-11-19)
Brown-red color. Light tan head that fades quickly.  Aroma is Coffee, Caramel with a bit of alcohol.  Medium body.  Tastes sweet at first, with a long bitter aftertaste.  Lively carbonation.

Draught at Kloster Andechs (and also at the pub in Munich a day before).

Head is fully diminishing.
Body is dark brown.

Aroma is moderately malty (caramel, molasses, coffee, nuts, husks), with notes of nut shells (oxidation), soured fruit, and alcohol.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium to full body, watery/syrupy texture, lively carbonation, moderately alcoholic.

There was a time when this was a world beater, but alas that time has passed.  A truly sad rendition in recent years, and only now after several retries do I feel compelled to rate this accordingly.  They still make a nice weissbier, but most of the Andechs line is pretty mediocre.  The draft sample in Munich was even worse than this...sour to the point of being undrinkable, and while I consider that sample to be off/unrateable, its still clearly only a shadow of what it was 8 years ago.

0,5l bottle from Csakajósör, Budapest. Clear brown color with minimal head. Caramel, chocolate, coffee aroma with a little smoke. Medium sweet taste with light bitterness. Medium body with oily texture and average carbonation. Long sweet finish. Delicious beer. Its a bit like stouts, but much softer. Classic, characteristic taste. I recommend it for everybody, who like dark german bocks.

50cl bottle. BBE 12/2011. Poured dark amber with a thin white head. Aroma is caramel and toasted malt. Flavor very similar. Some sweetness in finish, but not at all disturbing. Very enjoyable, smooth mouthfeel and medium bodied. Alcohol well hidden. I am no fan of doppelbocks, but this one was a real killer.

(Flasche) Der Bock hat eine klar filtrierte, warme, dunkelbraune Farbe mit einem bernsteinernen Einstich und einer bräunlichen Schaumkone. Das Aroma ist sehr schwer-süßlich mit einer leicht röstigen Koppfnote und einer Spur von frisch geschrotetem Malz. Der Geschmack ist überraschend schlank, recht röstig und im Abgang bleibt eine breite Bittere am Gaumen hängen. Es fehlt ein bisschen an Rezens. Im Ganzen ein leckerer Bock, der aber fast wie ein normales Dunkles schmeckt.

Reddish-black with a medium frothy, tanned head. Smells very roasty, a bit bread and a bit sweet. Tastes sweet and like berries. The medium bitterness comes in the middle and reaches its peak at the end. At the end it seems a bit salty with hints of soy sauce. full bodied, no alcoholic taste. creamy and a bit sticky with a long lasting taste.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2012 50cl bottle. Pours as a clear red, with almost no head.
Smells of caramel, malt, and dried red fruit.
Tastes of a heavy sweetness, a light-medium bitterness, and a fair amount of fruity tartness.
Texture is creamy, body is medium, carbonation is light.
A beautiful doppelbock. Id gladly drink it again, and again.

50cl bottle pours out clear deep ruby red amber with copper edges and a nice minute long tan head. The aroma is on the light side with some caramel and dark fruity esters mixing with a faint winter spice / fruit cake sort of thing. The taste is lush and soft and slushy on the palate and offers up caramel malts, wafer thin ribbons of caramel candy, chunky yet brown sugar simmered cherry bits, raisins and prunes. This all comes together very nicely. Yeah, I can drink more of this anytime.
Fine head, That falls, brown. Caramel,  nice nose. Medium body and fine length. Caramel, soft.

Andechs Dobbelbock is deep ruby red color beer. The foam quickly disappear into air. Aroma is strongly malty, rye bread, some dried fruit and a hint of caramel. A bit of toasted chocolate looming in the background.
The taste is like liquid bread.  Sweet maltinness, slightly sticky sugar too. Rye bread crust, plum, round, lightly fruity and chocolate. After-taste is kind of rye acidity with a light hop bite. Palate is a moderately full-bodied, carbonation suitable, easy to drink, and the alcohol is hidden. Not exactly typical of more than 7% lageroiduille beers. Absolutely gorgeous Dobbelbock, a prime example of its styling and overall enjoyable beer.
A clear brown colored beer, wth tick beige head. The aroma of fruits with caramel. The taste of caramel, fruits and spices. The aftertaste is a little bitter and sweet.

50cl bottle. Dark brown with light beige head with good lasting but quickly dissipating. Aroma is dark malted, nutty, sweet, alcoholic, complex, bready. Flavour is sweet, viscous, dense, creamy, bready; with a moderate sweet long final. Flat carbonation with full body and oily and creamy feel.
Deep mahogany coloration.  Aroma is malty, powered by a dark fruity body, almost like fruit cake.  Taste is sweet and typical for the style.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2012 A - Roasted dried fruit and chocolate
A - Dark and cloudy with thin head
T -Slight sour and sweet
P - Mid to soft
O - Nice dark

A lovely mahogany colour with a beige head that sinks back into the glass and leaves a thin film across the surface of the beer. There are scents of chocolate and lovely pumpernickel bread with hints of molasses. Sadly my beer was a little on the cold side so the more complex aromas remained a little hidden. At first taste it is strong, viscous and a little creamy before chocolate notes come through filling the mouth with gorgeous chocolate malt and cocoa butter. The finish is sweet and chewy. This is a beer for savouring. Lush and tasty,

Redbrown colour, dark copper. Beige head.
Aroma sweet, especially just after pooring. Candy sugar, malts, caramel, dark bread, coffee, burned malts. Flavour sweet, nice bitterness coming through. Lots of malty flavours, caramel, raisins, nuts (walnut and hazelnut tones). Oily mouthfeel, Finish changes from sweet to biter. Nice one, though on the sweet side.
(From 0,5L bottle)

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2013 Bottle from a little shop in Kreuzberg Berlin. One of the all around best beers Ive ever had and certainly the best German beer to date.  

Dark brown but clear.  No head retention or even bubbles visible, yet slightly prickly in the mouth.

Huge sweat bread and raisin aroma 

Very full all over body.  Warms as it goes down.

Incredibly well put together and satisfying.

US Import Lot L1693 drank Nov 2, 13 - Either my tastes have refined, the bottle is old, or travelled poorly. The aroma is less fresh and full. The flavor is a bit metallic. So is the feel. Id probably give this a 8-3-8-3-15 = 3.7. Still really good.
Purs dark reddish brown, foamy head. Aroma of sweet malts, heavy sweetness. Taste is mainly malty. Very nice one.

This is truly one of the best, if not the best, lager yeast beers I have had.  You have to go to the brewery and have the fresh stuff on draft.  The bottled, shipped beer does not compare.  When I drink it, I imagine myself relaxing on the slopes of the Zugspitze, and eating some fine sausage with the beer.
Cerveza de color cafe-rojizo, con aromas a malta, caramelo y algo de alcohol. De cuerpo medio,  sabor a cafe, malta,  y poco amargor. En resumen, buena doppelbock

Sörspecialista, Budapest. Tükrös barnásvörös színe van, csak nagyon kevés világosbarna habot fejleszt, ami nyomtalanul el is tűnik. Illata likőrös, almaboros, csokoládés, karamellás és aszalt szilvás, tehát meglehetősen összetett és kellemes. Íze nem túl édes, karamell és kesernyés fekete tea ugrik be a korty elején, majd lecsengésében jön a likőrös és kissé almaboros zamat. Olajos testű, de nem túl édes és könnyen fogyasztható, igazán szép duplabak!

Bottle. Pours a nice dark reddish color with brown notes and a fizzy beige head. Aroma is very malty, lots of dark fruit, caramel, rum like notes, nutty notes, dark bread and sugary notes. The flavor is really malty too, tons of malt sweetness, caramel, toffee, some lightly buttery notes, darker bread, dark fruits especially raisin, nutty and brown sugar. The body is medium with a lightly oily mouthfeel. Overall a really nice Doppelbock!
UPDATED: SEP 3, 2014 (Bottle 17/08-2011) Fast fading head, dark amber color, sweet malty aroma, alcohol dominant sweet malty taste. Rerated 03/08-2014, BB date 28.08.14.

Reddish brown with a grey head. Sweet malty aroma with notes of nuts, coffee, caramel and brown sugar. Very sweet, almost no bitterness. It warms the throat and the alcohol is very present, perhaps a bit too much for my liking. But other than that, it is a complex and well tasting doppelbock.

bouteille 50cl.
cuivre, mousse crémeuse beige.
Arôme de fruits noirs, malt caramel et toffee
En bouche, bière avec une bonne  note de malt grillée allant vers le biscuit avec un profile de caramel, et malt torréfie mais aussi une touche de sucre qui reste trop liquoreux pour moi.
Brown to red colour with little to no head. Smels wort and caramel. Tastes as a wort bomb, also lots of sugar. Medium body. Dont like it.

Schöne dunkle Farbe, Schaumkrone ok. Der Doppelbock riecht nach vergorenen Kirschen. Er schmeckt fruchtig-kirschig, aber nicht süß, dezent alkoholisch, leichter touch von röstmalz der aber sehr gut umbunden ist, so das man ihn nur in einer kombination herausschmeckt. Der Nachgeschmack schmeckt genauso wie der Geschmack und hält ein paar Minuten an. Fazit: Insgesamt erinnert es mich etwas ans Pelforth Brune allerdings ist das noch etwas Geschmacksintensiver, dies dürfte obwohl es schon Geschmacksintensiv ist, auch hier noch etwas stärker sein! Sehr lecker!
	
Test vom 2.12.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 12,13,13,13,13,12 - 12,50
Bottle @ home shared with DutchDrebus.Very nice deep dark red color, small light beige head. Smell sweet, fruity. Tastes a little like an amber. Decent carbo, medium body.

Mahogany pour with a nose of roast, brown sugar and caramel malts.

An earthy caramel malt taste. The middle of my tongue detected more brown sugar and chocolate. A nice solid body with a sweet and dry finish. A very well blended beer.

Pours a dark brown with a dark beige head.  Aroma is chocolatey with roasted malts.  Taste is a pleasure.  Full mouthfeel with caramel, chocolate, a little date, lightly roasted malts.  Just great, wish this was in Canada.
Draught (dmg notes from the basement flooding). Readable: Slight caramel aroma...
Hasselnötsbrun med beigt skum. Doft av bränt socker och karamell. Söt smak med inslag av russin. Svag rostad ton.

500 mL at Andechser am Dom in Munich.  Dark brown with hints of red, with a good creamy head.  Light, rich, mild taste, roasted notes, pleasant.  Better than Id remembered.  Smells of bock and meibock.  Slight bitter aftertaste.

Le liquide a une robe brune cuivrée.  La tête mousseuse se retire rapidement.  Le nez est très agréable avec toute cette richesse maltée : le caramel domine, les fruits sont goûteux, le sucre dorge et les noix forment un heureux mélange.  Les saveurs sont extraordinaires : le malt est presque sirupeux, les papilles sont doucement attaquées par des malts grillés et du caramel.  Les fruits offrent des flaveurs qui rappellent les raisins et les noix émanent avec une gentille tonitruance.   En bouche, le liquide a un corps moyen-fort avec une effervescence marquée et une texture légèrement grasse.  La finale est davantage laffaire des malts que des houblons.  En résumé, très bonne dégustation offerte par Yan.  Désormais pour moi la référence dans le style.

@Victors Fantasy Tasting-500ml bottle-pours a dissipating light tan head and copper color.   Aroma is sweet medium malt-bready/caramel, dark fruit-cherry.  Taste is sweet medium malt/wheat-bready/caramel, dark fruit-cherry.

Bottle at Aufsturz in Berlin.  Pours a deep copper with a lofty beige head.  Light bready notes, dark fruits, slight booze in the nose.  Notes of caramels up front with a muted sweet fruitiness that fades into a drying and slightly bitter finish.  Lingering raisin character after each sip.  Quite full on the palate, low carbonation serves to allow the flavors to express themselves.  All in all, seems to be a pretty good example of the style.
Sweet & great. (This beer rating was imported from FB and unfortunately lacks any further comments.)

Description: Doppelbock Classique de Bavière.
Comment: Bouteille de 500ml achetée en RFA (danke Luisa).
Visuel: Cette bière est brune, elle ne fait pas de mousse.
Olfactif: Le malt traverse le nez, il est sucré. Des arômes de fruits secs, de noix grillé et de malta sont aussi perceptible.
Gustatif: Le malt Munich est à son meilleur, elle est chaleureuse, lalcool nest pas présent, il y a même une certaine fraicheur. 
Résumé: Un très bon doppelbock, classique.
Note: 8/10

Bottle thanks to Paul at his place. Pours dark brown. Tan head. Nose/taste of smoked caramel, toasted malts, sweet malts and orange and apple skins. Fruity notes throughout the background. Well balanced body.

Bottle at Victors bracket box tasting at Pauls.  Pours a clear brown amber with a  thin white head.  Big caramel and toast.  Big malt and toast, lots of big caramel and toast.  Toast and warm malt, crisp malt and candy malt on the finish.

(bottle)  , This reminds me  of one of those fat and  abbrassive Eisbocks  things , only just not as obesse or boozy , but similar flavour profolio . Huge chunky  malt accents that have burnt rubber like qualities ;notes of roastiness too, caramel ,choco, apple esters ;  maybe a tad cloying ,.A plesant Dopplebock  ,if a tad anticlimatic . The group on the back of the bottle look like theyre having a great time anyway.!

Bottle at Aufsturz on Oranienburgerstrasse in Berlin. Beautiful rich mahogany colored pour with a creamy off-white head. Aroma holds really nice sweet breadiness and fantastic dark fruit character, including plum, raisin, a touch of red wine, and even some sweet nectarine. Flavor is much of the same, with that impressive amalgamation of fruity notes. Really great brew.
Sampler at CBF 2011-05-27. Clear copper with an off-white, creamy head. Caramel and dried fruits on the nose. Full bodied with flavors of sweet caramel sauce and tobacco.

.5 Liter at the Andechs Monastery in Germany.  Clear dark red/brown, with sticky light tan head.  Dark sugary malts, dark dried fruit, toffee, nuts, a bit of chocolate, and bread.  In my opinion a very nice doppelbock, and the scenery is wonderful.
Dark brown with huge brown head that quickly disappears. Sweet malty aroma, ryebread, figs. Taste sweet sugar, malt, bread, some bitterness in the finish. A great beer.
Bottle. Brown body. Begie head. Aroma is loaded with chocolat, malt, burnt sugar, nuts and mily. Flavor is malty, sweets, nuts and burn sugar. Smooth palate.

Bottle 500 ml 
Aroma malty with good character to it, plums on alcohol. Good aromas depth. Solid.7+
 Appearance  garnet with touches of ruby. Medium beige top. 3+
Flavor and Palate : Medium full bodied.  Heavy on malts with plum accents. Rather simplistic approach. Well made ,classic at its time but now days just good.
(bottle) clear dark red-brown colour with tiny brown head; aroma of caramel, sweet flavour with noticeable alcohol

Aromatisch malziger Antrunk mit leicht herbe, vor allem aber würziger Unterstützung in Form von röstigen und süßen Schokoladennoten. Diese wirken nicht nur tiefgründig sondern auch gut aufeinander abgestimmt, das Bier ist in sichs timmig und trotz des Alkoholgehalts und des aromatischen Gesamtpakets süffig. Es findet keine große Veränderung statt, aber wieso sollte es auch? Die Aromen sind bereits auf einem exzellenten Niveau, das Bier ohne Einschränkungen gut. Ein Bier, welches nicht viele Worte zum Beschreiben braucht. 11/12/12/13/11/13

,5cL bottle via a trade (very cool to get to try this as I stayed near this town by Ammersee about 7 years ago (before my beer days). Pours with an oddly murky deep garnet hue with a medium sized off-white head (fine bubbles). Head seems to last and there is some good lace. Aromas are rich and full of melanoidins. Grainy and malty, rich caramel, light hazelnut (oxidation creeping in?), marzipan, maple, brown sugar, and a ton of kettle caramelization. Toasty. Alcohol and light hints of raisins. Otherwise clean with little fermentation byproducts to speak of. Minimal light spicy hop notes. Mostly all rich malt. Slight hint of age. Flavors of rich malt, burnt marzipan, molasses, rich melanoidins. Enough bitterness to balance (and perhaps a touch extra). Malty, a bit nutty, maple. Light stale notes. Hop flavor is light and spicy. A hint of tobacco. Slightly peppery, throat tingling alcohol. Clean fermentation. Hint of dark fruits. No diacetyl.

Warmth is kept with in check. Very smooth and creamy. No astringencies. Medium carbonation with a full body but a crisp and decently dry, malty finish. Very easy to put down. A very well crafted doppelbock without question. Look forward to trying it a bit fresher one day.
On-tap. Tre Små Rum Göteborg. Brown with a beige head. Malty, sweet and smooth. Caramel, chocolate and light fruitiness. Light carbonation. Very drinkable.

Kupferfarben und süß-malzig im Geruch. 
Im Geschmack rauchig und etwas röstig. Auch malzbetont, dennoch süffig und ausgewogen. 
Der Klassiker. So muß ein Doppelbock schmecken. Nicht überfrachtet, mit einer guten Balance zwischen Malz, Hopfen und Süffigkeit.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours like cola with a small beige head. Aroma is lighter than most, prunes, bread, fruit. Lively fruits and malt in the taste. Not bad but was expecting a bit more with the rap this beer comes with. Very easy drinking
Ho un caro amico e spesso va in Germania per motivi personali, e proprio vicino a questa zona di produzione della Andechs, ovviamente me ne porta parecchia di questa splendida doppelbock...
Amber/light brown colored with medium head. Aroma and taste of caramel, raisins ripe prunes and port. Sweet aftertaste. Very nice doppelbock.

The taste has a heavy cloying sweetness and a lightly bitterness. Oily feel, slick feel, soft carbonation. Brown, clear body, tan foam. Aroma of nuts, caramel, roasted malt, brown sugar. Well balanced without a dominating alcohol. Good quality.

Bottle. Dark reddish brown with a creamy beige head. Aroma: candy, toffee, raisins and dried fruits. Taste: very malty, sweet, candy, raisins, some port, geléhallon, Svendborgs Halvbitter. Pretty full-bodied, but not a lot of carbonation. One of my favourite doppelbocks.

500ml bottle, mente antes de: 30.12.11.

The pour is actually not that pretty with this beer. It has a beautiful rusty reddish brown color and tan head but it comes of as too soapy looking.

The smell is fresh and clean, just smooth, sweet malt flavors like dark bread, honey, dark fruit,and brown sugar and some subtle but noticeable hops that produce a delightful smell.

The taste is out of this world, i havent had a good doppelbock this fresh. It is bursting with sweet malt flavor with raisins and dark sugar, it is clean but the sweetness isnt too low. The sweetness is higher than the average doppelbock though, so bear that in mind.

Overall a solid doppelbock, the best? Maybe.

medium mahogany with a big light beige had, great retention and lacing... epitome of a doppelbock, molasses, prunes, bready... the taste is just like the nose but with a touch to much alcohol on the finish... not my favorite style but its great for the style

Appearance: Dark deep brownish red. Clear. Some light tan head.
Aroma: Fruit, quite sweet. Some malt.
Taste: Malt, lively. Fruit too. Some hidden bitterness. Warming. Wintery.
Info: 500ml bottle, 29/3-2011
caramel, bread, toast, nuts, brown, clear, brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation.
Bottel. Sweet malt aroma with plums and raisins. Unclear brown colour with beige head. Sweet, slightly spiced flavour with plums, raisins and a bit of caramel. Nice, soft mouthfeel.
50 cl bottle, Sheffield, UK, via The Dram Shop. Dark caramel colour, sweet brown sugar aroma with some clove spice. Sweet flavour, undertones of hops, with a bit of an alcohol kick on the finish.
Bottled from Bierzwerg. Ruby colored with medium white head. Red fruit aroma, with plums, raisins and honey. Taste, plums, honey, caramel, toffee. Alcohol is well hidden. Nice complex beer.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2012 50cl bottle from ABCBeers, shared with friends.
No head, no carbonation. Amber colour.  Very good brew.

12/03/2011 - 50cl bottle @ home - BB: 28/10/10 (2011-111)  Thanks to Klaas for the bottle! 
Clear dark brown beer, light beige head, dissipates quickly. Aroma: sweet caramel, dried fruits, mocha. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: mocha, sweet caramel, spices. Aftertaste: mocha, caramel. Knowing the Germans cant add sugar or spices, so an amazing fine beer when all youve got is malt, hops and yeast!
Dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty and dried fruit. Flavor is rather sweet and light bitter. Dry finish with a little warming alcohol. Soft smotth and almost full bodied. 051210

Andecher Doppelbock Dunkel on väriltään Coca Colaa muistuttava. Oluen vaahto on melko runsas ja väriltään jotain valkoisen ja vaaleanruskean väliltä. Tuoksussa on karamellia, leipää, paahtunutta mallasta ja sokerista makeutta. Aika hyvältä vaikuttaa. Maultaan olut on karamellisen makea ja hieman paahtunut. Humalointikin tuntuu hieman. Aivan vähän on myös metallisuutta mukana, mutta ei niin paljon, että se pilaisi koko oluen. Suutuntumassa on jonkin verran hiilihappoja ja runkokin on kohtalaisen vahva.

another one ive been wanting for a while .. flavours of chocolate banana, with a back of bark and fruit .. . very easy to put down, one second it was in front of me, the next, gone .. . great finish, and something i would definitely recommend .. . I didnt mean to upset the apple cart.

Pours a clear caramel brown. Small white head that dissipates quickly leaving no lacing behind. Looks delicious.
Malt, caramel, a slight dark fruitiness. Quite pleasant with nothing standing out that would detract. There is a slight alcohol aroma, but just faint enough to not be picked up until the beer warms significantly.
Sweet and malty. A slight caramel sweetness. A bit of a copper taste. Decent.
Slightly thinned out from the alcohol that gets left behind each swallow. A sweetness is left behind as well and leaves its mark on the edges of my mouth. 
Not too bad. There is the off-putting copperness, and the slight alcohol bite. But not a bad beer at all.

50 cl flaske. Rødbrun hælde med beige hoved som som forsvinder hurtigt. 
Aroma af sød malt, tørret frugt og rosiner. smag som næse med noter af blomme og portvin.

Tap @ Oluthuone Kittys.
Poured a slightly transparent reddish brown colour with a creamy, patchy head. Aroma of sweet dried fruits and bread. Flavour of pleasant chocolate malts, good hops, licorice, bread and nuts. Medium/full bodied, slick mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Fruity and dry finish. Pleasant.

Draught @ Kaisla, Helsinki

Strong and sweet doppelbock. Pours dark brown with a small white head. Full and malty body. A bit too sweet for my taste.

Wow. Delicious doppelbock dunkel. Double-dark beer, I love this style and this one of the best I have had. Awesome all around. The color is dark brown with brow-red amber in the light. Aroma is of Roasted malt, brown sugar, a hint of coffee and chocolate scents. The flavor is infallable -almost, I never had a perfect beer, but there is nothing that this beer does badly, it is a finely tuned drinking machine! Gorgeous roast malt and slight coffee notes, not too much choco-coffee just due to the malt used gives that impression but it is truly well rounded and close to perfect!!!! Great beer, definitely try it
On tap, it has been one of the best doppelbock Ive ever tried. Intense taste, brown and very malty. It is also a little bit sweet but at the same time it has coffee notes. Very good!
On tap at Kittys, Helsinki. Poured dark brown with tan head. Aroma is sweet malty with some light burnt coffee. Flavour is slightly roasted malts and sweetness of dark syrup.
1st December 2006  Warning! Early amateur rating! Thick dark brown beer with a slight sour worcester sauce falvour. Crisp and dry palate. Tasty. Refreshing.

500 ml bottle. From bierzwerg.de.
Dark reddish brown colour with small off-white head.
Roasted malt, caramel, sugar, nuts and molasses in aroma.
Flavour is caramel, roasted malt, nuts, molasses and balancing hoppiness.
Good Doppelbock. Alcohol well hidden.
bottle. nice black color and head. pretty decent taste and nice palate. good one.

Draught at the monastery as well as bottled in Munich. Clear brown color with a stable beige head. Lots of toast and bread crust in the aroma with a touch of dried fruit and sweet caramel. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Very similar flavor to the winterbier but with a little more sweetness and fruitiness. Leaning heavily of bread crust. Ends up feeling a bit thin, but this does make for a more digestible beer overall. Almost a sessionable doppelbock. Solid but not quite substantial enough and Im a bit surprised that this is put above so many others that are just as good if not better.

17-dec-2010
50cl bottle at home. Brown with average beige head. Aroma is caramel with balanced sweetness. Lightly bitter well balanced, long aftertaste. Definitely a great beer!

Thanks to steptin.  Pours a clear burgundy-brown, head dissipates quickly.  Earthy aroma with a hint of vegetal.  There is a winey feel to this beer, with lots of fine bubbles on the tongue, followed by dark fruit, but subtle ( rather than fruit forward).  Pretty good.

At the Doppelbock Width Tasting in Shachars house, thanks Shachar, bottle, pours very dark brown with a nice head that dissipates slowly, sweetish and roasted coffee aroma, smoky flavor, sweetish ending, and overall an excellent beer.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2011 Bottle @ Frankfurt Airport, Germany. Hazy colalike colour, ofwhite head. Roasted malt, yeast and wheat in aroma. Roasted malt, wheat, banana, and some light sour tone in taste. Medium body. 061210
5-3-5-3-11

Bottle @ Home. Pours clear dark brwon with a offwhite head. Aroma of wheat, roasted malt, nuts, caramel, sweet fruit. Taste is roasted malt, nuts, caramel, some wheat, fruit. Medium body, soft carbonation. 130611

7-3-7-3-14
Far better bottled than the tap i had in Frankfurt airport

Taster at Michael, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 011210.
Brown with off-white head. Aroma of malt. Flavor with caramel and notes of dms.

Huge, huge thanks to Masterski for opening this up and giving me a hefty pour at the Hunahpus release. The search for this one had been a long one, and then just fell into my lap thanks to a very generous trader.

A: Took this over to the light to get a better glimpse. The pour was a deep, roasted brown with a bit of an amber hue. A very nice off-white head.

S: Very nice slightly-sweet malt alongside caramel, toffee, a nice brisk hop presence, and a bit of brown sugar.

T: Very malty with nice caramel and brown sugar notes. Hints of dark fruit. Hop presence is a little high compared to other examples, but melds beautifully with the rest of this ones flavors.

M: Very nice. The creaminess requisite of a good bock is there, but theres also a nice dryness that comes through as well. Moderate carbonation on a medium-to-full body. Good aftertaste comes through.

D: The combination of the elegant mouthfeel and complex taste make this one well worth coming back to sip after sip. Thanks again to Alex for letting me try this one, although Ill definitely say that my search will only intensify as we get into bock season and this one keeps springing back into memory.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 03-13-2010

On tap @  3 små rum, thx ned cons 2010-11-26, Göteborg
AR: caramel
AP: mahogny reddish, wee head, oily
F. caramel, almond liqueur

Totally deserved reputation! Served from bottle at Aufsturz, Berlin. Aroma is a bit herbal, nutty, and with molasses.  Flavor is iron, earth, molasses - sweet but not very (thank goodness!). Delicious, entirely drinkable, very fresh (best before July 26, 2011). Best dopple ever, in its great handling of the sweetness? A little still in the mug.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Bottle.  Pours chestnut brown, huge beige head.  Aroma of chestnuts, caramel, light spice.  Taste is full bodied, nutmeg, butterscotch, dryish and slightly bitter finish.  Easily the best beer of a 10 day trip to Germany.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2013 Pours a dark amber colour, with a medium white head. Aromas are mainly malts and roasted malts, but also caramel, fruits and alcohol. Some hint of coffee. A bitter finish. A great and balanced doppelbock !

Bottle. Courtesy of drabmuh on BA. Pours a dark copper brown red color with a big 2 1/2 finger head that settles down rather quickly to a nice offwhite coaster head. Malty aroma for sure with notes of raisins, plums, nuts, caramel, and slight spice like cinnamon. Minimal lace left on the glass. Nice medium mouthfeel with good carbonation. The taste is a real nice balance. Slightly sweet with fruit like characteristics and a nice bready, biscuity backbone that balances it all out. Ends pretty cleanly without any apparent bitterness. The alcohol is very existant in the flavors. I imagine drinking this from a huge stein in Germany with all my BA & RB buddies, wouldnt that be sweet!?
not much aroma and a crappy appearance but this is an otherwise good beer. Bottle is a little big for 7% I feel :D
Bottle 500ml. Color dark red with small brown head. Aroma caramel, berries, roasted, sweet. Taste caramel, coffee, alcohol, fruits.
Beautiful appearance with a sweet fruity aroma.  Taste is predominately caramel, toasted cereal, and raisins.  Nice finishing.  Great beer.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Clear dark mahogany color. Pours with small dissapering white head. Aroma of malt. and alcohol. Taste is sweet, malty and some notes of peach. Nice carbonation, with creamy mouthfeel. Ends with a nice warming feeling from the alcohol

Live review, this beer has a great mahogany colour, can smell hints of smoked dark chocolate. Has a slightly bitter but very smokey aftertaste. Not a great deal of carbonation but I just drank a cheap french lager. This goes down well, im not noticing the 7.1abv too much. Will I drink this again? Yes theres another in the fridge, good winter brew, i like it but prefer what belgium has to offer in strong beer, can recomend

Bottle, 50cl. Pours a clear and dark reddish/caramel beer with a weak offwhite head. The aroma is malt, sweetness and caramel. The flavor is malt, dried fruit, sweetness, caramel and notes of chocolate. The palate is sweetness. Overall an average beer.

Bottle at home & Tap at the brewery : Pours a Nice Dark Brown/Ruby with a modest off white head here. Love. This Brew. Really - Aroma is incredible - Nice Fruity Malt here - The big thing is how drinkable this Doppelbock is. Honestly I dont think theres a more drinkable one out there that happens to be this incredibly balanced and delicious. Great feel, great drinkability, alcoholic element is so subdued - Flavors are nice caramel malts, dates, raisins, berries, nice carbonation - finishes fantastic. It doesnt have the complexity of celebrator , no, but that really doesnt matter.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2010 Shared with Muja. 0.5l bottle. Slighlty sour smell, nice caramels flavor with alcohol in the aftertaste. Very drinkable. UPDATE: Shared with quiznoaz, strong barnyard in the nose and sip - not as amazing as the first time, but then again, it rarely is...

A nice bottle shared by Shawn. Pours a dark brown color with a large beige head. A nutty and huge malty nose. A sweet caramel flavor with large fruity malts, smooth and tasty. A great fluffy palate. Smooth and easy.
Bottle. Red brown colour with a medium beige head. Aroma and flavour of caramel, toffee, malt, dried fruit, spice and bread.
Pours brown with a beige head. Aroma is heavy breaddy malt, alcohol, caramel and fruity notes. Flavour is heavy breaddy malt, alcohol, caramel and raisin. Vineous.
UPDATED: DEC 10, 2016 Thanks to Angelika for recommending.  This is fantastic stuff. Lovely rich doppelbock. Serving: Bottle

Bottle at Café Abseits, Bamberg. Nice red-orange-dark brown with a frothy head. Big malt aroma of caramel, a touch burnt, some dried plums and raisins, port. Super sweet, with caramel and tons of dried fruit, some booze, a touch of oxidation and licorice. Wonderfully smooth and rich. Great. A perfect match with my vegetable risotto.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2013 500ml bottle from IPB.
Appearance : Clear dark amber with small foamy head.

Aroma : Raisons and rich molasses. Light floral hops with rich caramel.

Taste : Rich caramel with raisons and dark fruits. Lovely sweetish caramel but far from being sweet. Finish is even a bit dry. Nice long smooth finish with light butterscotch.

Palate : Smooth carbonation.

Overall : Really nice beer. Really complex, nice persistent finish, great raisins notes with the caramel. Very elegant beer, not too sweet, perfect attenuation of the sugars leaving complex flavors without the heavy sweetness. Probably the most elegant example of the style. A must !

Bottle from KaDeWe in my hotel.
Appearance : Deep amber with a small foamy head.

Aroma : Sweet and sugary. Quite nutty with notes of toffee and red fruits. A little bit mineral.

Taste : Toffee and caramel. Rather sweet but also dry on the finish. Light bitterness on the finish. Soft carbonation.

Overall : Quite nutty overall. Enjoyable beer thats for sure. Quite complex. I think I was expecting a bit more. Nose may be a little bit too spicy and mineral for my taste. Id like to have this one again. Maybe the bottle was not too fresh... 7,3,7,3,17;3.7 August 2010.

500 ml bottle courtesy of Doodler poured a clear reddish brown with a small lingering tan head. Aromas of molasses, figs, dark bread and light spice. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of molasses, dark bread, figs and light spice with a smooth lingering malty finish.

At a tasting, thanks Shahar, pours an hazy brown with a tan medium head, aroma of plums, cherries, toffee, wood, chocolate with a touch of lemons, flavor of roasted and smoked malts with toasted bread, toffee, cinnamon and butter sweets, almost full body. A very well made doppelbock.

From bottle, 50 cl. Taste with friends @ Gents Beerfestival 21.08.2010. 
Special brown (reddish shine) color, with offwhite head.
Aroma caramel, fruits, bit smoked.
Medium body.
Taste dark fruits, roasted malts, smoke touch.

Bottle from Cracked Kettle, Amsterdam. Pours black as coke, with some nice ruby colour as well, a big spongy tan head on top. Aroma is heavy malty, dark fresh baked bread, nutty and some dark caramel as well. Taste is wonderful mellow nutty, sweet but not overdoing it, dark caramel malts paired with a moderate bitterness which lingers to the end. Sticky mouthfeel.This is the first dobbelbock i have tasted without that  strong "in the face" alcohol presence. Very good stuff.

Aroma: toffee and strong malt, hint of alcohol with a touch fruity notes. Appearance:perfect brown with red highlights, pours clear with a perfect tan brown head leaving thick sheet lacing. Flavour: oh WOW malt with immediate hop balance (not expected but brilliant) followed by mocha toffee complexity. Palate: thick and nicely carbonated leaving the hop and mocha finish.

500 ml bottle - brought back straight from Munich by my bro. Reddish brown body with light tan head. Nice carbonation with a nutty malt chocolate aroma. Some tastes of light fruit, plus caramel and vanilla. Smooth texture and mouthfeel. A very nice Dopplelbock / Dunkel with a great finish. Glad to have fairly fresh. Love to try on tap someday....
Alla spina in un birrificio di Brema; colore ambrato, schiuma abbondante, buon sapore di malto, parecchio corposa seppur equilibrata.

Bottle from bierkoning, thanks man! Pours a clear, dark, ruby tinged brown with a solid finger of tan head. The one thing that struck me in the aroma was tomato puree. Goddamnit, why do bocks have to smell like tomatoes to me? There is also artificial fruity candiness, toasted bread, caramel, and something spice like, almost christmasy, perhaps a tiny bit smoky as well. As I keep sniffing, the tomato aspect kind of disappears, along with the head. Maybe Im imagining things, but its mostly gone at this point. Very sweet when drank, loads and loads of dark caramel, burnt sugar and toast, roasted malts. There is a bitterness in the finish that seems a bit metallic, but it doesnt really taste hoppy at all. Aside from that there are no hops to be found. Full bodied and generously carbonated, but it feels pretty thick and smooth. Doesnt taste strong at all, but wierdly I get this pleasurable numbing feeling in the mouth after swirling it around. This was quite enjoyable if you like the sweet stuff. I can imagine a whole half litre would be a bit much, Ive only had one quarter of it so far. Gonna give the rest of this to the gf, shes gonna love it.

Bottle @ meeting. Port like pour, minimal head.
Aroma of caramel, malts and candy sugar.
Flavour is sweet, caramel, candy sugar and roasted malts.
Too sweet for me.

Served into a Heinneken mug

The pour it was a dark brown resembling any cola with a big off white creamy head that dissipates rather quickly leaving a small lacing

The smell (for me) it was overpowered by the malts and coffee with hints of licorice and banana.

The taste (it was awesome), malts, coffee, licorice (also my wife tasted some chocolate that i couldnt), the alcohol taste its very smooth for a 7.1% ABV, I think if you have a couple it can sneak on you. The flavor its not very long lasting the only thing that leaves behind its coffee feel in the mouth.

In all its a very light beer to drink for a dark one with complex flavors, that leaves you wanting more.

I will have more!!!

Serving type: bottle

Bottle at Dutch RB Meeting. Clear dark amber pour, thin off-white head. Aroma of sweet sugary malts, fruits and some smoke. Flavor is sugary malts, quite sweet, and with some smoke. Creamy texture and average carbonation.
UPDATED: FEB 19, 2012 Cherry, sugarcane, yet not too sweet. Earthy base. Quite strong and fizzy; a good palate overall. Dark red, impressive colour. Sweetness is well balanced with bitterness.

Brown, decent sized head, retention is very nice, mostly clear... Very very traditional clean aroma slightly sweet sticky caramel... Some dark fruits, touch roasty, some sweet caramel notes, not much of a hop presence... Medium bodied, dry finish, some lingering sweetness... not nearly as big as americanized versions, this is more what they should be striving for....

A: The pour is a dark amber-kissed brown color with a fingers worth of khaki foam.

S: A nice sweet nose with some cola, chocolate, and caramel. Theres a fair amount of roast to this, which I was not quite expecting.

T: The flavor is pretty much what I expect from a doppelbock. Toffee, caramel, cola, cherries, and just a pleasant sweetness overall. The roasted and toasted malts provide some nice complexity.

M: The body is medium with a very nice creamy and smooth carbonation to it.

D: I really liked this doppelbock, which is becoming a style that I enjoy very much. Good flavor and mouthfeel, and easy to drink.

Bottle. Finger and a half of light khaki, thicker head that leaves a thin layer on top throughout.  Rich, ruby chestnut hue.  Sweetish malts in the aroma at first, bit of toastiness and toffee, hint of tobacco.  A lot more rich in the flavor with a nice roastiness that cuts through a very tempered sweetness, bit of earth, and a dry bitter finish.  Medium body with nice lively carbonation.  Great brew, and definitely at the top of the style range.
Nice deep, rich aroma with medjool dates and autumn leaves.  The flavor is lightly sweet with a light, charry roasted-ness to it that is just superb.
at first a sourfresh nose that develops some malt and hay, medium dense body, the feel is a bit bubbly, and the taste is burnt malt, apricot, honey and hay

Pours clear dark reddish broown with short lived light brown head. Roasted malts, dark freshly baked bread, caramel and floral aroma. Full bodied, sweet, malty and hoppy flavor, but also acidy crispy and fruity. Wonderful beer. Lean and pleasant on palate. Finishes with a sweet bitter malty long lived aftertaste

Bottle 50cl. Dark amber beer, very clear, nice carbonation, good lacing. Smell is on cereals, malt and caramel. Aroma is very malty, cereal and brown bread like. Near to Dunkel style beer, some smoked notes at the finish, nice but not exceptional.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2010 Bottle at DSB, thanks to Carlo. Darker amber, like brown coloured. Medium head, but disappears a bit to quick. Sweet dark fruits taste. Prunes and spices, caramel. Nice balance with pretty sweetness. Lightly bitter aftertaste that holds ok. Well balanced brew for sure, nothing overwhelming. Only maybe it could get a little more body/power inside.Thank you Carlo to let us enjoy this one!
Walked to the brewery and tried it (best way!). Very dark with a strong caramel flavour but not hugely bitter. Sweetish, as one would expect, but not cloying. Recommended.
Draught. Dark Amber with a nice lasting off white head. Strong malt aroma. Wonderful smooth texture and a long lingering aftertaste. Excellent

Bottle 500ml. Great beer. Aromas of burnt caramel, cherries, and alcohol. Taste is sweet, with light bitterness, and long lasting. Palate is syrupy, with a medium-to-full body. Brown, with a head that doesnt last.

Egy Doppelbockhoz képest, meglepően friss üde sör. Gyönyörű habkorona alatt egészen sötétbarna ital. Illata a tavaszi hegyoldalt, a havasi legelőket idézi. Virágok, széna. Belekortyolva csak folytatódik a frissesség érzet. Aztán elönt mindent a pörköltmalátás telt íz. A cukros édesség csak a 2-3. korty után érezhető, de csupán finoman a háttérben. Grillázs, gesztenyeméz keveredik bele. Lecsengése közepesen hosszú, benne a komló virágosan kesernyés íze dominál. Ideális tradicionális bajoros főfogásokhoz, barnamártásos, Kloss-os, zsemlegmbócos húsokhoz.
Brown body with a nice fluffy head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, some fruit. Flavor is smooth, clean, sweet. Nice full body, well made.

Pours dark copper with a light tan head. Restrained but rich aroma of caramel, nuts, prunes, cherries and earth. The sweet taste has mouthfilling fruit, chocolate, caramel and nut malts. But then theres earthy balancing bitterness and the finish is dry - hay and fruit cake spices. Classy.

33cl bottle. Pours a dark ruby color and a medium lasting beige head. Aroma is astonishing: mostly malty with toasted notes and cookies. Spices and alcohol too. Taste: malty sweetness is prevailing with alcohol and toasted notes. Palate: medium-bodied with consistent texture and medium carbonation. Overall, a splendid, aromatic doppelbock
33 cl Bottle. Dark red body with a nice tan foam. Aroma of sweet maltyness, big body, with a taste of coffee , and nice medium bitter finish.

Pours dark amber with small to no head.
Nose has caramel, hazelnut and is very malty. But there is only little nose in it, you have to work the glass to get a bit of aroma out of it. 
Taste has caramel, hazelnut and a bit of hoppy bitterness in the finish. Creamy palate, medium duration, medium body.

Bottle.

A - Dark reddish-orange copper color with an average sized foamy and creamy off-white/light beige head. Good retention with a good amount of lacing left.

S - A lot of dark malt with caramel, toffee, toasted grain and a slight bready smell. Hints of nutty and fruity smell as well. Hint of earthy hops, but this is definitely a malty beer.

T - A good balance between some dark fruit (particularly cherry) and dark toasted malt taste (prominently grainy and bready malt but the caramel and toffee flavors are also fairly strong). Very rich malt taste is present throughout. A hint of something similar to semi-sweet cocoa/chocolate is also present. Fairly sweet tasting but has a bit of a tart zing to it. Nice toasted malt flavor lingers on the tongue well after the sip.

M - Medium body with slightly above carbonation. Quite smooth with just the slightest bit of drying, sticky feel at the end.

D - Superb. Great malt flavors. It is sweet but definitely not cloying. Just a very easy to drink and enjoyable beer. The flavors are well balanced and very satisfying to taste and it goes down very easy. Too bad the ABV is a touch high.

Notes: Very nice malty beer. Sweet but not overly sweet. Just a very easy and enjoyable beer to drink. Luckily the taste also lingers a bit. It doesnt seem like a beer that blows me away or really shocks me, but rather a beer that I would happily drink everyday. Very rich flavors, but it isnt too much or cloying. Wonderful beer, if you can try it, do so.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2016 Nice aroma, but a little bit too light., with smoky-dry notes. A deep rubin colour, fast head, almost no lacing. Beautiful silky texture, a bit oily. Brilliant maltiness, i love it. A very fine, well-balanced dunkel. By the end it becomes dense and sweety caramelic. 
Revisited Starkbierzeit 2016, Andechser am Dom. Perfekt. Pörköltcickány. Bombasztikusan itatja magát. Pörkentyűs disznócska.

0.5 L bottle brought home from KaDeWe, Berlin. Tall, foamy tan head. Brilliant, shiny ruby colored body. Initial aroma of sour dark bread. Yet fresh, with a nice smell of roasted nuts, acidoulus fruits and faint caramel. Taste is nutty, almonds maybe, slightly sweet and medium malty, added by a fine acidic-sour fruitiness. Filling. Palate-coating. A lingering bitterness reveals in the ending. Great stuff, doppelbock from the source!

Had this beer at Ratskeller in Germany and this is the best beer that Ive found in the local area.  Pours a dark amber color with a creamy head.  The alcohol content balances the beer and is not overpowering.  I recommend the 1 Liter beer if you happen to be at a restaurant that serves it as the ,5 L portion just isnt enough.

500ml bottle from Cracked Kettle.

Great appearance: clear dark brown with a nice tan head that leaves swirling foam on the beer.  Aroma is very nice, nutty with chocolate, spice, roast, and dark fruits.  Flavor is really good and complex for the style.  Caramel malt, toffee, chocolate, spice, raisin and date.  Well-balanced and not in-your-face in any way. Smooth on the palate with a phenomenal mouthfeel.   Medium-full body.  This is one of those beers that just strikes you as really awesome.  Supremely drinkable.  Will seek this one out again for sure.

Bottled. Pours clear and dark amber with a large,fluffy, light brown head. Sweet malty nose with caramel and fruit. Sweet breaddy flavour with carmel and notes of spice and dark fruits. Medium bodied. Slightly bitter finish. Enjoyable.

50CL Bottle, bought at the bierkoning in Amsterdam. A dark, reddish brown beer with a strong white head. A very sweet, toasted malt nose with a hint of citrus fruit, the finish is slightly bitter sweet, similar to liquorice. The taste again is sweet malt, a potent, slightly alcoholic flavour comes though towards the end, with a long, lingering malty aftertaste

This was a Kardstadt purchase in Dortmund, Germany. I recall passing up this brew a few years ago while in Germany. Glad I finally got it this time around. Pours a nice dark with ruby hues. Nose is alcohol, chocolate, hops, and brown sugar. Some dark fruits and vanilla are present. Taste is vanilla, banana, dark fruits, brown sugar, some toffee notes and lots of yummy molasses. Fill comes through with a nice roasted end, slight bitters, although slightly off-balanced. Overall, after the first sip which carried a heavy alcohol sting, this brew rounded off nicely and just kept getting better and better. It really opens up after about 15 minutes at room temperature and its full balance and taste really do come alive. Very enjoyable. I can easily say that I would love to have these regularly stocked.

This dunkel doppelbuck pours out a bronze body with a mid-sized, off-white head. Looks very good and smells of caramel malt. Taste is stronger malts and burnt sugar. A bit too sweet, for some reason, particularly mixed with the burnt-ish toasty taste. Smooth and nice mouthfeel. An ok beer, but not great and I think its overrated compared to many of its kind.

0.5 l bottle.
Dark brown/ruby colour, fine pored/creamy pale brown head, average carbonation.
Nice malty, roasty and tiny alcoholy smell, the start is moderate sharp, tastes sweet.
Bitterchocolate/coffee-liked flavour, the aromas mainly roasty and of sweet fruits.
Coffeebitter and dry finish, alcohols warming up a bit at last.
Medium/full bodied, the texture is sticky/kinda oily, so its not an easy drinkable one.
Overall a very delicious brew.

(Bottle) Poured dark reddish brown and cleae with quite large and light brown head. Aroma contained malts, molasses and hint of chocolate. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, roastedness, molasses, sweetness, chocolate, mildly grass and bitterness. Aftertaste contained malts, chocolate and bitterness.

Pours a very dark oily brown with some deep reddish hues and a tanned head that diminished quickly. Sweet malty aromas with notes of chocolate, coffee, toffee, licourice, prunes and alcohol. Dark fruits and toffee come through in the flavour. Warm and sweet finish. The alcohol blends well with the smooth palate. Really enjoyable and one of the best German beers Ive tried.

Clear chestnut pour with a white head. Very nice aroma. Caramel, roast, coffee, licorice, brown sugar. Flavor is even better. Lots of caramel/brown sugar sweetness, earth, a hint of soy, a hint of anise, awesome coffee and chocolate in the finish. Very full bodied, smooth, oily. Wow. This beer is great. Dopplebocks arent usually my thing, but I want to drink this all night. This might be the best German beer Ive ever tasted.

Comparative tasting with Weltenburgers Asam Bock. 
Appearance: Bottle from recently opened german beershop called Beer-Specialist. A lighter doublebock with mahogany color with ambery, coppery red hues. Breezily carbonated look. Tiny beige head with ok retention and nice lacing. 
Aroma: Nutty main impression with almost oaky wood scent. Some rosted malty tones with pure grainy, rye-bread quality. 
Flavor: Roasted walnuts, sweet chestnuts, dried figs with subtle toffee sweetness at the mid-palate. Moderate, spicy hops at the end. 
Mouthfeel: Medium body with soft, but lively carbonation. Smooth alcohol warmth. 
Overall: A more pale kinda Doppelbock what i expected. A bit similar to Salvator,with even more balanced malty falvor profile with huge dried fruity, sweet components.
Chocolate. Raisins. Dates. Toffee. Fresh, doughy, brown bread. I think I have a new favourite beer. This is incredible.

Chocolate note at the beginnig, softly sweet nice rye fruits and confit plumb on a . Bitter-sweet with nice alcoholic note at the end. Nice color, red-ruby, soft carbonation, very enjoyable. Great double bock that keep you warm in winter

Superbe double bock, rechauffe bien!

Pours ruby with a large but fading head.
Nose shows loads of caramelised, bready malt, with a faint hint of soft alcohol.
Equally malty flavours, with loads of caramel and toasty note, and again, some soft alcohol.
Creamy slick mouthfeel, with soft carbonation.

Pours a brown and dark amber color with a very tall, spongy bubble looking off-white/cream head.  Aroma has a very pungent fruity date note up front,, a very heavy toffee nose, mild tootsie roll chocolate sweetness, modest amount of caramel malt,  some solid toasted and nutty malt notes round out the aromas. Flavor starts with a combination of date, toffee and toasted malt note moving into a mild noble hops grassy kick in the middle with it finishing off with a caramel, slight walnut nuttiness and some light smokey malt note. Beer is modest to heavy in feeling with a moderately high carbonation rate. Head retention is average and the 1/4 inch head remains atop the brew through the entire rating. Overall the hefty malty notes really meld well with the modest fruity and nutty notes present in this brew. The alcohol is almost completely hidden behind the smooth, heavy body of the brew. Great beer.

A:  Pours a nice deep brown with a nice tall cream colored head.  Okay retention with nice chunky lace.

S:  Very malty.  Tons of caramel, and brown sugar.

T:  Malty as well.  Rich sweet caramel and brown sugar.  Hints of chocolate and light dark fruit.  Subtle molasses and a hint of nutty toffee.  Malty goodness for sure.

M:  Medium in body, smooth and sweet.

Bottle. Pours a lovely clear copper colour with a light tan head that diminishes quickly to surface cover. Lots of malt on the nose as well as notes of toffee, dates, raisins and spice. Flavour is also quite malty with notes of caramel, chocolate, dark fruit and clove. Smooth mouthfeel, with moderate carbonation and a long bitter finish. A very good doppelbock, less sweet than a lot of others, and with a little complexity in the flavour.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2011 Dark red, small, diminishing had, beige coloured. Aroma is malty, with (lots of) caramel, cinnamon, clove. Full taste, fruity, smotheing like figs or dates. A little carbonation, slightly bitter, long finish, somewhat dry. Nice.
Drunk again jan 2011: Very nice to drink. Re rate higher.

Bottle shared by malrubius at Pauls homebrew day: Thanks Mike. Deep auburn pour with a dense creamy tan head. Toasted toffeeish  aroma- very clean with a slightly raisiny note yet dry. Creamy body with a flavor that is also rich yet dry. Toasted thick dark clean maltiness with a mild raisin note and a touch of smoky character. An awesome Doppelbock.

Bottle, Carringtons, Chorlton. Not really the worlds biggest fan of the style, but I could appreciate there is some quality here. Red tinged brown colour, with a small tan head. Burnt malt and brown sugar aroma, with dark fruit notes. Similar story in the flavour. Sweetness level tolerable. Alright, but bit over rated imo.

Deep reddish brown with a thick tanned head of about 2 cm. The head settles after a while and leaves some lacings.

A rather big smell, very malty. Caramel, roasted malts, coffee and dark fruits. Grassy and spicy hop notes.

The taste is better than the smell would have you believe. Its not overly sweet, but heres still plenty of malty sweetness. I like how the expected caramel and bready malts are complimented by roasted malts and coffee - interesting and not very common. Lots of date-like fruity notes. Wood and a subtle herbal hop note. The finish is mildly bitter with a well integrated alcohol flavor and lingering malts.

Rather full bodied and very smooth. Quite a lot of carbonation.

As for doppelbocks go - a style I sometimes have a hard time dealing with due to the cloying sweetness some of them showcase - this is one of the better Ive had. The sweetness is not overly powerful and the "dunkel element" in this one adds lots of levels and flavors. Nicely balanced. But still, its not the most interesting beer in the world, and after one bottle Ive had more than enough.

Serving type: bottle

(Copy of old Beer Advocate review)

Bottle shared by malrubius at Pauls homebrewing session.  Pours a clear reddish brown with a linen white head.  Very pleasant aroma of malt, brown sugar, molasses and a bit of prune.  The flavor is equally enjoyable with lots of rich malt, dark brown sugar, molasses and a bit of prune.  There is some slight smokiness to the flavor as well.  Overall, a first rate doppelbock.  Thanks for sharing, Mike!

Brown coloued with a small beige head. Aroma is fat malty of caramell, toffe and light minerals. Flavour is generously malty, sweet and thick with carmelized fruit, caramell, nuts and other malt goodness. On the sweet side but still very balanced.
Bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours light brown with a white head. Aromas of burnt sugars, chocolate, caramel. Flavours of caramel, roasted malts, dark fruits, molasses. Finishes malty and hoppy.

real sweet with a real caramel aroma. Just the thing for autumn. Really an art doing this without sugar. long live "dem bayerischen reinheitsgebot"

I recommend!

500ml [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Germany. Malty and sweet dark Doppelbock from the Kloster Brauerei.

Pours a deep mahogany/brown, bit of tannish foam that dissipates quickly. Odor is a bit sweet and cloying, as is the initial taste. Seriously, not sure what the big deal is, Ive had much better DBs than this one.

Recently, Tried this on a trip to europe, at the Andechs Monastary. This is now the best beer I have ever tasted. In my opinion this is the most under-rated beers on the entire web site. Nice malty flavor. Smells like paradise. Everyone who loves dark beers has to try this one once in there life.
Clear amber of color with an off white head. An aroma of prunes, sweets and dried fruits. A flavor of dark fruits, malty and sweets.
Bottle 0,5ltr: Dark clear brown brew, an well balanced sweet Doppelbock with hints of caramel.

Mahongany red in colour. Large off white head that disappeared realtively quickly. Lots of malt sweetness and a little smoke. Moderate to full body carbonation is moderate. Very drinkable. Lots of malt sweetness broken up by the little smoke. Good drining beer.

Bottle.  Was definitely looking forward to this one, but I was a tad disappointed.  Color was close to almoond.  Aroma of caramel, nuts and fruit.  Flavor was the same with a lot of bread, dough and alcohol.  Dark fruit throughout as well.  Smoke/roasted notes were subdued.

500 ml bottle - thanks bvc!! clear, light brown with soapy, thin tan head; thin texture with mild chocolate and wheat notes; some smoke in the nose and flavors too; wheaty, not too dry in the finish; pretty nice

Dark clear brown red tinted body with a tan creamy head. Laces well. Smell of roasted malt and caramel. Notes of raisins and licorice. At first the taste is sweet like a doppelbock normally is but then you get kicked in the mouth with a bitter creamy raisin aftertaste that lasts awhile. Yet you still have the slight raisin taste which is great when mixed with the dry bitterness. Best doppelbock Ive had since its not too sweet.

500ml bottle (BeerAngel.de)
Deep reddy brown, large doughy head.  Treacly malty aroma. Smooth
palate, soft carbonation. Rich roasty malts in the taste. Sweet and
cakey, some dark fruits. Tingly bitter finish. Hides 7.1% well.

[2316-20090719] 500mL bottle. Mild fruity malt aroma hints at cherry wood. Hazy, dark brown amber body with a quick creamy light yellow head. Fruit bar malt flavour has a long sweet finish. Medium body. Nice, a lot going on.
(c/o HogTownHarry, w/ DuctTape, jerc)

Brown-red, thin white head.
Aroma of caramel, chocolate, spices, fruit and gingerbread. Sweet, thin flavour with malty finish.
50 cl bottle. Dark brown body with small off-white head. Flavour is malt, caramel fruit.

bottle bb9/15/09 via psprings...

dark walnut -woody brown color with a soft off white head. 

the nose is extremely malty... followed with aromas of toasted nuts, vanilla, a little smoke and some vegetal/roasted corn notes.

the flavor is pretty much the same... add in some unsweetened cocoa, dark bread and a really crisp clean finish. 

medium bodied with a crisp refreshing mouth feel which pairs incredibly well with almost anything you would want to eat. 
 
i could easily drink this stuff every day. 8/4/8/4/16/4.0
bottle, via trade with koelschtrinker,dark brown, with strong tan head, aroma of nuts, malt, cocoa, flavors of roasty raisins, caramel, malts and more fruit, good finish
Bottle. Dark amber colour with large creamy off-white mostly lasting head. Aroma is roasted malt with notes of chocolate. Sweet spicy flavor. Bitter finish. Creamy palate.

2009-07-19. Dark brown body with a nice foamy beige head. Aroma is interesting. Something fruity with the sweet malt, sort of cherry like. Flavour is quite sweet, malty base with mild fruity overtones of fruit, and light touches of the the cherry like character from the aroma. Smooth average to medium bodied palate suits the beer despite a slight under carbonation. (3+) Bottle courtesy of HogTownHarry

Dark clear brown with a vanishing beige head. The aroma is lovely malty sweet, rusks, honey, nuts, just a hint of roasted choco beans. Rich taste, sweet, balanced, with an inviting dry end. Nice bodied, right carbonated. A very nice discovery.

july 2009. Andechser am Dom munich.
clear, red/brown color with off white head, moderate malty. not my beer but good.

50cl bottle provided by karsten S.
clear amber, smooth brown head.
slight sour aroma, roasted grains, toffee.
flavor is malty sweet, slight hoppy, toffee, well blend of flavors, more than what i could name here.

50cl bottle poured into a dimpled mug. Dark amber brown with two finger tan head.   Aroma is cherries, raisins, slight licorice.  Flavor is roasty and sweet.  Some cherries and licorice and maybe wood.  Some warming alcohol in the short to medium finish.
Dark brown, unclear ale. Small beige head. Malty sweet flavour and aroma with underlying sourish note (like aceto balsamico).  Roasted malts, wood. Notes of chocolate? Hides the ABV well. Varming.

Bottle.
Pours red with a short lasting head.
Sweet and malty, a bit like a barley wine light.
